loans.name: Annah

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Annah. She lives in the Nandi Hills area of Kenya, renowned for its rolling hills, carpeted in manicured tea plantations. Annah is a mother of six children and she has been in the agriculture business for ten years. Her primary income sources are milk, eggs, and tea. 

Annah has been relying on agriculture to make all her income. However, rising costs of farming inputs, such as fertilizer, and fluctuations in market prices are some of the serious challenges that are cutting farmers' profits significantly. Despite these tough conditions, Annah remains positive and passionate about her economic activity. 

Annah is seeking a loan to purchase poultry. This will enable her to expand the section of business least affected by harsh external conditions. Poultry farming is cheaper to run and the demand for chicken products is always high. 

With this loan, Annah will be able to increase the sales from her poultry business and make more profits. An increase in income for her is timely since it will enable her to tackle high, farm-related costs next season. This will greatly improve the quality of work since the cost of every input will be adequately met. As a result, she will realize better quality produce and more yields.

 This loan will support Annah’s economic activity and will indirectly change her family’s living standards.

loans.use: to buy poultry.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more accessories and cosmetics to resell to the women in her area.

loans.name: Uom's Group

texts.en:
As a long-time member of M7-MFI, Mrs Uom - a 54 year old Thai ethnic person - is always enthusiastic, exemplary in all activities of the M7-MFI. Her family now lives in Mai Son district, Son La province. She and her husband have three sons, two older sons are married and live locally, and her youngest son is currently attending college in Hanoi.

Because their two grown-up sons are all married and live separately from them, the married couple whose main income is from cultivation and breeding do not earn enough to cover their youngest son’s education costs. She hopes to borrow a loan to invest in her youngest son to provide better conditions for learning.

loans.use: to invest in her youngest son by providing better conditions for learning

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy clothes to stock her shop.

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is 36 years old and married with two children. With two children currently in school, Eva works very hard to provide for them.

Eva runs a general store in the Philippines.  Eva has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items.  She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock like soft-drinks, chocolate drinks, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell.

In the future, Eva would like to save enough money so that she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock like soft-drinks, chocolate drinks, noodles, cooking oil, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Annabelle

texts.en:
Annabelle has three children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Annabelle is 32 years old and has two children who are in school.

Annabelle has a food vending business in the Philippines. Annabelle requested a PHP 7000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Annabelle has been in this business for 2 years. In the future, Annabelle would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Anacorita

texts.en:
Anacorita is 63 years old and widowed with thirteen children and has one child in school. Anacorita works very hard to provide for them.

Anacorita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines on November 8, 2013. Anacorita is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Anacorita has requested PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 
 
Anacorita is committed to rebuild and in future would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as shampoo, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 43 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Alma has a food vending business in the Philippines. It was damaged by Super Typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Alma requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business to restart her business activities.

Alma has been in this business for two years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business.

loans.name: Sapnah

texts.en:
Sapnah is 42 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has two daughters. She and her husband have been traders in waste or secondhand goods for over seven years. She was glad to help increase the family’s income.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 6,000,000 rupiah. This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family. She wants to have access to safe sanitation for her family. Her family's income is still not enough to build a toilet and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.

She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda works hard to support her family. She is married and has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years now.

Erlinda requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Erlinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Ana Elsa

texts.es: Ana de 32 años de edad es una mujer que todos los días se levanta desde muy temprano para iniciar su jornada de trabajo, elaborando prendas de vestir las que le solicitan en diferentes mercados del departamento, además desde muy pequeña aprendió a bordar por lo que también recibe pedidos de productos con bonitos bordados. Ella es madre soltera y habita en vivienda propia junto a su pequeño hijo de 16 meses de edad que es su más grande inspiración y su mayor deseo de salir adelante es por él y para darle lo mejor. Ana tiene el deseo de realizar más y mejores productos, pero al no contar con el efectivo necesario para invertir en su negocio ha decidido solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cepillos, cojines, edredones, hilos, telas, etc.
texts.en:
Ana, aged 32, is a woman who gets up very early in the morning each day to start working. She makes articles of clothing, which she sells at different markets in the department. In addition, she learned how to embroider from a very young age. For this reason, she also receives requests for products with beautiful embroidery.

She is a single mother and lives in her own home with her  16-month-old child. He is her main motivation, and she wishes to get ahead for him and give him the best. 

Ana wants to make more and better products. Because she doesn't have the cash to invest in her business, she has decided to request a loan from FUSAI to invest in brushes, pillows, comforters, thread, fabrics, and the like.

loans.use: to invest in brushes, pillows, comforters, thread, fabrics, and the like.

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es: María tiene 38 años de edad y habita en casa propia junto a sus tres hijos de 20 años, 16 años y 9 años de edad quienes se encuentran estudiando. María se dedica a la crianza y venta de pollos desde hace mucho tiempo. Este negocio es su principal fuente de ingresos y desea mantenerlo activo por mucho más tiempo. Por lo anterior ha tomado la decisión de solicitar este crédito a FUSAI para invertir en su pequeña granja. Desea comprar mayor cantidad de pollos y espera lograr aumentar sus ventas e ingresos y poder segur llevando el sustento a su hogar.
texts.en:
Maria is 38 years old and lives in her own house with her 3 sons of 20, 16 and 9 who are all studying. 

For many years, Maria has made a living breeding and selling chickens. This business is her primary source of income and she hopes to keep it going for a long time to come. For this reason, she has made the decision to take out a loan from FUSAI to invest in her small farm. 

She would like to buy more chickens and she hopes to be able to make more sales and generate more income to continue providing for her family.

loans.use: to buy chicken to fatten up.

loans.name: Evangeline

texts.en:
Evangeline works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fruits, root-crops, and vegetables vending business in the Philippines.

Evangeline requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits, root-crops, and vegetables to sell to her customers.

Evangeline has been in this business for 20 years now.

Evangeline would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more fruits, root-crops, and vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To purchase merchandise for traditional clothing.

loans.name: Huong's Group

texts.en:
Mrs Huong is a 27 year old Kinh woman, who has been part of the M7-MFI program since 2013. She currently lives with her husband and her two children in Mai Son district, Son La province.

Her family lives primarily through cultivation and breeding so their income is unstable and just enough to buy food. Huong is planning to raise more animals such as chicken and geese to increase their income and improve her family's life. Therefore, she really wants to take this loan to invest in breeding to implement her plan.

She hopes that with the loan amount borrowed from M7-MFI,  her family’s breeding model will be expanded to improve the quality of her family's living standard and to be able to support her children’s education.

loans.use: to invest in breeding chickens and geese.

loans.name: Leticia

texts.es:
Leticia vive con sus padres y hermanos, a la vez que estudia también trabaja, es una persona que esta luchando incansablemente por sus metas.
Está estudiando la carrera de Ingeniería Comercial, y que quiere poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar las cuotas de su carrera y poder seguir sus sueños.
texts.en:
Leticia lives with her parents and siblings. At the same time as studying she is also working. She is someone who is working tirelessly towards her goals. She is studying for a degree in business engineering and wants to become a useful professional in society. 

She is asking for this loan so she can pay her university fees and follow her dreams.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy miscellaneous articles [for resale].

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio proviene de una familia trabajadora de clase media, su meta es culminar sus estudios para poder ser una profesional útil a la sociedad.
Ella está siguiendo un post grado en finanzas, con lo que quiere poder seguir creciendo en su conocimiento.
Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus cuotas de post grado de su universidad, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Rocio comes from a hard-working middle-class family. Her goal is to finish her studies so she can become a useful professional in society. She is following a postgraduate course in finance, with which she hopes to continue increasing her knowledge.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay her university postgraduate fees, so she can continue with her studies. She is grateful for this opportunity she is being given, which will be a great help to her.

loans.use: to pay her university postgraduate fees.

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, está estudiando la carrera de ciencias económicas en la especialidad de administración de empresas para poder salir adelante. 
Le gustaría poder contar con una casa propia  y también poder realizarse como persona y profesional. Pide este préstamo para poder pagar sus gastos de titulación, y de esa forma poder seguir su sueño de ser alguien en la vida.
texts.en:
Adriana comes from the city of Coronel Oviedo. She is studying for a degree in economic science with a specialisation in business administration, so she can make progress in life. She would like to be able to have a house of her own and also to be fulfilled both personally and professionally.

She is asking for this loan so she can pay her degree costs, and thus be able to follow her dream of making something of herself.

loans.use: to pay her degree costs.

loans.name: Gabriela Soraya

texts.es:
En la ciudad de Santo Domingo de los Colorados, un sector muy agradable por su gente y clima, además por ser un sector muy productivo vive Gabriela, una joven madre de 19 años, quien tiene dos hijitos ya que actualmente vive separada de su esposo hace varios años. Ella ha sido madre y padre para sus dos pequeños y gracias a su trabajo ella ha podido salir adelante.
Gabriela es una mujer que le gusta trabajar, todos los días trabaja vendiendo ropa interior, blusas, pantalones  y pijamas, recorre  vendiendo a clientes de su sector, ya es muy conocida y tiene varios pedidos, con los créditos pequeños comenta que ha podido crecer en su negocio.
Cuenta con una pequeña casa en terreno de su madre, poco a poco ha podido ir mejorándola.
Acudió a Fundación Alternativa por referencias del sector, se le aprobó un crédito el mismo que lo invertirá comprando más mercadería para surtir su negocio y poder seguir creciendo ya que quiere estar preparada para las fiestas del sector.
Agradece enormemente a la institución y a todos quienes conforman Kiva por este aporte que le ayudan a crecer personal y profesionalmente.
texts.en:
The city of Santo Domingo de los Colorados, a very pleasant place because of its inhabitants and climate, as well as being a very productive area, is where Gabriela lives. She is a young mother, 19 years old, and has two small children. She has now been living separated from her partner for several years. She has been both mother and father to her little ones and thanks to her work has managed to provide for them. 

Gabriela is someone who likes to work. She works every day selling underwear, tops, pants, and pajamas. She goes to various houses in her sector selling to her clients, and is already well-known and has various orders pending. Thanks to small loans she has been able to build up her business. 

Gabriela has a little house on her mother’s land, and little by little has been improving its conditions. 

She was referred to the Fundación Alternativa in her sector, and approved for a loan that she will invest in new merchandise to better stock her business and continue to expand it. She especially wants to be ready for the upcoming holiday season.

She sends an enormous thank you to the foundation and all those that are part of Kiva for this support that will help her grow both personally and professionally.

loans.use: to buy new merchandise to stock her business. With this growth this young, single mother will be able to support her two children.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.es:
Ruth está estudiando para ser contadora, está esforzándose por poder cumplir con su meta de ser alguien en la vida, un profesional útil para la sociedad.
Ella es una persona luchadora que desea ayudar a las demás personas por medio de sus conocimientos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en el pago de sus cuotas, de manera a poder seguir con sus estudios como lo viene  haciendo.
texts.en:
Ruth is studying to be an accountant. She is working hard so she can fulfil her goal of making something of herself and becoming a useful professional in society. She is a hard-working person who wants to help other people through her knowledge.

She is asking for this loan to pay for her fees, so she can continue with her studies as she has been doing already.

loans.use: to pay her university fees.

loans.name: Gloria Iris

texts.es:
Gloria es una mujer muy trabajadora, madre soltera de un maravilloso hijo, quien se ha convertido en el motor de su vida y por quien lucha para poder salir adelante. Desde hace varios años trabaja en una tienda de venta de electrodomésticos, diariamente se esfuerza al máximo para poder obtener buenos resultados y así crecer profesionalmente, también está estudiando una carrera técnica para más adelante poder tener mejores oportunidades laborales y apoyar a su familia.
Gloria está agradecida con los prestamistas Kiva porque con el apoyo que le han brindado podrá apoyar a su madre en los arreglos de pintarrajeo de su casa, como una manera de agradecer el apoyo con su hijo que le brinda mientras Gloria trabaja. Más adelante espera poder ver a su hijo convertido en un excelente profesional.
texts.en:
Gloria is a very hardworking woman. She is a single mother of one wonderful son who has become the driving force of her life, the person who motivates her in her fight to get ahead in life. 

For many years she has been working in an electrical household appliance store where she gives her all every day so she can perform well and develop professionally. She is also studying a technical course so that in the future she can have more work opportunities and support her family. 

Gloria is thankful to the Kiva lenders because with their support she can help her mother repair the plastering on her house as a way of thanking her for helping out with her son while she works. In the future she hopes to see her son become a successful professional.

loans.use: to make improvements in her mother's house (to plaster the walls).

loans.name: Rocio

texts.es:
Rocio es una persona que se esta esforzando por poder ser alguien en la vida, esta estudiando la carrera de derecho, quiere ser una abogada buena en lo que hace, y que pueda ayudar a las demás personas. Comenta que su préstamo anterior lo uso en invertirlo en las cuotas de su carrera, lo que le fue muy util.
Hoy pide un nuevo préstamo para poder pagar nuevamente sus cuotas, y de esa forma cubrir ese gasto que tiene.
texts.en:
Rocio is someone who is working hard to make something of herself. She is studying for a law degree and wants to be a good lawyer in what she does and help other people. She says she used the previous loan to pay her university fees, which was very helpful for her.

Now she is asking for another loan so she can again pay her fees, and so cover this expense which she has.

loans.use: to pay for university expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home

loans.name: Wendy Del Carmen

texts.es: Wendy de 22 años de edad es una mujer que siempre se ha destacado por ser emprendedora ya que desde hace 2 años se gana la vida vendiendo diversidad de prendas de vestir, además buscando tener más y mejores ingresos decidió dedicarse a la venta de tamales de gallina en su domicilio para poder apoyar a sus padres y su hijo de 2 años de edad con el que vive al lado de sus padres y sus hermanos en vivienda propia desde hace mucho tiempo. Wendy ha observado la buena demanda que tienen sus productos por lo que ha pensado en invertir en su negocio pero no cuenta con la liquidez económica necesaria por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ropa y productos para la elaboración de tamales.
texts.en: Wendy is 22 years old. She has always stood out for being an entrepreneur. For two years, she has made a living selling clothes. In addition, in the search for  better, higher earnings, she decided to sell chicken tamales at her home in order to support her parents and her two year old son. They live with her parents and her siblings in their own house for many years. Wendy has observed good demand for her products, so she thought about investing in her business but she did not have the necessary liquid capital. She is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in clothing and supplies for preparing tamales.

loans.use: invest in clothing and supplies for preparing tamales.

loans.name: Martina Beatriz

texts.es:
Martina Beatriz tiene 50 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 01 hijo dependiente, vive con su hijo en el distrito de Pucará, distrito mediano con aspiraciones a superarse, en dicho distrito la población se dedica a la agricultura siendo el cultivo de arroz siendo este el de mayor producción, así como al comercio en general. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. La misma que está ubicada en el distrito de Pucará, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Martina Beatriz se dedica a la cría y comercio de animales de corral como son cuyes, gallinas, etc., ella cuenta con más de 5 años de experiencia en el rubro, por lo que cuenta con clientela en la zona, además cuenta con un corral amplio para dicha actividad. Martina Beatriz adicionalmente se dedica ha brindar el servicio de pensión(servicio de comida) a estudiantes, cuenta con más de 10 clientes. Ella tiene muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El destino del crédito es para invertir en el negocio para la compra de un número mayor de animales para criarlos y después venderlos, así como también invertirá en el arreglo de corrales para tener un lugar en mejores condiciones y así criar animales con una mejor calidad, para poder venderlos a un mejor precio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Martina Beatriz is 50 years old. She is a single mother with one dependent son. She lives with her son in the district of Pucará, a medium-sized district, and has a desire to make progress in life. In this district the locals work in agriculture, growing rice, which is the main crop, as well as general commerce. Her community basically works in agriculture, livestock and commerce. It is located in the district of Pucará in the province of Jaén in the Cajamarca region in the northern sierra of Peru.

Martina Beatriz makes a living raising and selling domestic animals such as guinea pigs, chickens etc. She has more than 5 years' experience in the field and so has customers in the local area, as well as a large pen for raising the animals.

Martina Beatriz also provides lodgings (with food provided) for students and has more than 10 students. She has very good personal and work references.

The loan will be used to invest in the business by buying a larger number of animals to raise and later sell. She will also use the money to improve the pens in order to have better conditions so she can breed better quality animals, so she can sell them at a better price. In the short term this will enable her to improve her income, increase her profits and so improve her own and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy a larger number of animals and to fix the pens.

loans.name: Erlinda

texts.en:
Erlinda has six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. She is 41 years old and has two children who are in school.

Erlinda has a bamboo stick-weaving business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. 

Erlinda requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to buy additional materials to use in her business, to restart her business activities.

Erlinda has been in this business for one year and she would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, she would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials to use in her bamboo stick-weaving business.

loans.name: Jesusa

texts.en:
Jesusa is 38 years old and has four children. She is married and has three children who are currently in school.

Jesusa is in the agricultural business, pig-fattening in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, Inc. (NWTF) to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Jesusa has been in pig-fattening for two years now and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Jesusa would like to save enough money, so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pang's Group

texts.en:
Pang is a member of Pang's Group. Participating in the program of M7 Microfinance Institution (M7-MFI) since 2011, Mrs. Pang is currently living with her husband and her two sons in Mai Son district, Son La province. As an Thai ethnic woman, she is always taking care of her family and she loves her husband and her children.

Her family’s main income is from her coffee garden. After subtracting the investment cost, there is only enough money to cover daily living and she can only save a very small amount. With awareness of environmental protection, she always wants to use organic fertilizer for her coffee garden, but due to the cost of organic fertilizer, which is much higher than chemical fertilizer, she does not have enough money to use it.

Pang hopes her coffee garden will have a higher yield by using organic fertilizer, thus improving her family life, and hopefully the environment will become better.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer.

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old single man from Gaza City. His father is an employee with a low income. Mohammad works as a house painter; he started his job two years ago, and now he has very good experience. It is a good business, but its unstable due to the demand. 

Mohammad would like to improve his business and buy new tools. He took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his painting workshop. This will increase his work quality, and attract more clients. 

Mohammad appears in the photo while he was working.

loans.use: to buy new tools for his painting workshop.

loans.name: Jorecita

texts.en:
Jorecita works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years now.

Jorecita requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items and ingredients for her business.

In the future, Jorecita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is 49 years old and married with six children; three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Evelyn runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for 10 years. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Lenaida

texts.en:
Lenaida works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 5 years now.

Lenaida requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more sacks of rice grains to sell.

Lenaida would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Chorn

texts.en:
Chorn (pictured here) is 40 years. She lives in Posen Chey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. She had been married since 1994.  She has three daughters and they are still young.

Chorn is a garment factory worker with three years experience, while her husband is a farmer with a long time of experience.

She would like to apply for a loan to buy more cows to raise.  She hopes that in the next year she can get some money for the cows.

loans.use: to buy two cows to raise

loans.name: Cesar

texts.es:
César tiene 65 años de edad, es casado, con 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito La Florida, provincia San Miguel, región Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

César se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, gallinas, gallos, pollos, cerdos, chivos,etc con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio; el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. César solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales, para diversificar y aumentar su stock, con lo cual podrá satisfacer los diversos gustos y preferencias de su público consumidor. Dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
César is 65 years old. He is married and he has one son. He lives with his family in a rural area of La Florida within the San Miguel province which is located in Cajamarca in the northern mountains of Perú. His community is mainly dedicated to farming and trade. 

César is dedicated to raising and selling animals like ducks, hens, roosters, chickens, pigs, goats, etc. He has more than 20 years of experience in this business. His business is located at the back of his home. César is requesting a loan to purchase a large number of animals to diversify and increase his stock. He can satisfy the diverse desires and preferences of his customers. This investment will allow him to have greater variety and productivity with his animals. This will allow him to improve his short term revenue, increases his earnings and improve his quality of life as well as his family's quality of life.

loans.use: purchase animals to increase and diversify his stock.

loans.name: Elvie

texts.en:
Elvie is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Elvie is 46 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

Elvie has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, salt, seasonings, meat, etc. for her food production business.

Elvie has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like chicken, cooking oil, salt, seasonings, meat, etc. for her food production business

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 60 years old and has six children. Nenita is married and has one child who is still in school.

Nenita is in an agricultural business fattening pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.  Nenita has been in this business for 10 years now, and has borrowed 4 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Nenita would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Vilma is 53 years old, and has one child who is still in school.

Vilma has a buy and sell rice grains business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional sacks of rice grains to sell to her customers.

Vilma has been in this business for five years. She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of rice grains

loans.name: Dima

texts.en:
Dima is an 18-year-old young lady, living with her family in an area in Jordan called Ajloun. She is a university student majoring in Special Education, and she is still in the beginning of her study journey. 

Dima is seeking to work as a teacher in her future. To do so, she needs to get her Bachelor's. Now Dima doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees. For that, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Samia Group

texts.en:
This group is called Samia. It consists of four hardworking women from Aden,Yemen. They have requested a group loan of 340,000 YER from AMB, and they will hold each other accountable for the loan repayment.

Samya is a very active woman from a poor family. She is 40 years old, and a mother of two children. She is the leader of the group. Her husband is the sole breadwinner of the family. He is an employee with a small salary which isn't enough to cover the necessary needs of the family. 

Samya wanted to help him in this responsibility. She has been selling women clothes door-to-door with an amount of small capital for more than five years. Her income from this business is small, and she wanted to improve it more. Most of the money she earns goes to the expenses of her family. 

On the other hand, she wants to improve her business, but she doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, she asked a loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more stylish and new women's clothes to sell them to her customers.

Samya looks forward to expanding her business more by opening a store to sell all kinds of women's clothes. She hopes to save a lot of money in order to renovate her old house.

loans.use: to purchase more stylish and new women's clothes

loans.name: Caren

texts.en: Five years ago, Caren started farming on a small inherited piece of land in Cheplanget, a remote village in the Litein area of Kenya. Today, this humble mother of two children sells milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. She is a passionate farmer and, because of the immense knowledge she has on farming, she commands a lot of respect from other farmers in her village. Dairy farming is close to her heart and every day she wakes up to milk her cow and that makes her very proud. Although she makes profits through milk selling, she lacks a proper dairy unit and she is seeking a loan to build a modern dairy unit. Through the loan, she will have a humble time milking her cow and also feeding. A good dairy unit provides a good place where cows can relax and it protects them from diseases that may arise because of being exposed to harsh weather conditions such as rain. Caren believes that through this loan, her living conditions will change because she is going to have an increase in milk production. She will save money that she used to spend on treating her cows because she lacked a good dairy unit. Caren waits for your kindness.

loans.use: To build a modern dairy unit

loans.name: Gay

texts.en:
Gay is 34 years old and married with four children.  With three of her children in school, Gay works very hard to provide for them.

Gay runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, groceries, etc..

Gay has been in this business for three years. 

In the future, Gay would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase items to sell like canned goods, beverages, and groceries

loans.name: Mary Joy

texts.en:
Mary Joy is a merchant from Dulag, Leyte. She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells items like biscuits, cooking oil, canned goods, powdered milk, bath soap and soft drinks. Aside from operating a store, she engages in a food vending business. She makes and sells snack food like puto (rice cake) and home meals like chicken soup and stewed vegetable. She and her husband have two children, ages three and two years old. Mary Joy has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to buy more stock like canned goods, seasonings, and beverages and to use as additional capital for her food vending business. 

Mary Joy would like to expand her business some day to support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy more stock  like canned goods, seasonings, and beverages and use as  additional capital for her food vending business

loans.name: Mirtha Del Pilar

texts.es:
Mirtha del Pilar tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, con 1 hijo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio

Mirtha del Pilar se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, como arroz, azúcar, leche, aceite, huevos, menestras, etc; con más de 2 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para capital de trabajo, compra de más mercadería(arroz, azúcar, café, entre otros), dicha inversión le servirá para incrementar sus ventas, con gran influencia en el negocio; Mirtha del Pilar piensa tener mayor stock de productos para poder atender las diversas necesidades, requerimientos y gustos de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Mirtha del Pilar is 30 years old and a single mother with 1 child. She lives with her family in a rural area of the Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Her community makes a living from agriculture, raising cattle and trade. Mirtha del Pilar earns a living selling groceries, like rice, sugar, milk, oil, eggs, legumes, etc, with more than 2 years of experience in this business, which is located in her home.

She is requesting this loan to restock working capital, to buy more merchandise (rice, sugar, and coffee, among others). Said investment will help her to increase sales, with a great influence on the business.

Mirtha del Pilar is thinking of having a greater stock of products in order to meet the various needs, requirements and tastes of the customers in the area. In the short term, this will allow her to improve her income, increase her earnings and, in the end, improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy more merchandise (rice, sugar and coffee, among others).

loans.name: Sovan

texts.en:
Sovan (shown in photo) is 22 years old, single and lives with his family. He is a student . 

Sovan has studied for an associate degree and now is in his second year at Vanda Institute, majoring in Accounting. He would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fees.

In addition to this, he helps with the family's work. This experience doesn’t relate to work, but he can earn some money to help pay for his living.

He will graduate October 30, 2015. He strongly hopes that he will become a professional accounting manager in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his student fees.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Evelyn is 43 years old, and all of her children are in school.

Evelyn has a buy and sell coco lumber business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan on November 8, 2013. Evelyn requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to  purchase additional coco lumber to sell to restart her business activities.

Evelyn has been in this business for one year, and would like to rebuild it with your help. 

In the future, Evelyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional coco lumber

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 48 years old and married with one child. She works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, beer, candies, detergent soap, biscuits, noodles, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for 10 years, and sells a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, beer, candies, detergent soap, biscuits, noodles, etc. 

Yolanda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like snack foods, soft drinks, beer, candies, detergent soap, biscuits, noodles, etc.

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is 59 years old and married. She has three children, one of whom is in school.  Lucia works very hard to provide for them.  She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 5000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

Lucia has been in this business for one year now.  In the future, Lucia would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like, milk, coffee, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Imelda

texts.en:
Imelda is 36 years old and married with three children, all of whom are in school. Imelda works very hard to provide for them.

Imelda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc..

Imelda has been in this business for 15 years.

In the future, Imelda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods and beverages

loans.name: Virak

texts.en:
Virak (shown in photo) is 23 years old, single and lives with his family. He is a student and has worked as staff at his university for three years.
Virak is lives in Chba Ampov district of Phnom Penh Cambodia, around 7 kilometers from Maxima.  Now he is in his fourth year at Phnom Penh International University (PPIU) in the field of English literature. He would like to apply for a loan to pay for his school fees. 
He will graduate on the 11th of September, 2015.   He hopes that after graduation from university, he can become a professional interpreter in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Santos Maritza

texts.es: Doña Santos de 34 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella posee una pequeña tienda desde hace varios  años ubicada en su lugar de residencia vende una variedad de productos como golosinas, huevos, refrescos, granos básicos, gelatinas, azúcar, sopas, etc. y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios, ella está solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor ya que esa es su única fuente de ingresos y así podrá tener mejores ganancias para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Doña Santos is 34 years old. She is a single mother who lives in her own house with her three children. She has had a small shop for a number of years, which is located in her place of residence. She sells a variety of products such as candy, eggs, soft drinks, basic staple foods, jellies, sugar, soups, etc., and has a lot of customers thanks to her good prices. 

This shop is her only source of income which is why she is asking for a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise. This way she will be able to earn better profits and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy candy, eggs, soft drinks, basic staple foods, jellies, sugar, soups, etc. at wholesale.

loans.name: Corcona Hacia El Progreso Group

texts.es: El grupo “CORCONA HACIA EL PROGRESO” es un grupo conformada por mujeres ansiosas por mejorar la calidad de vida de sus familias. Fiorella tiene 24 años de edad es soltera con un hijo educando y un bebe de 06 meses. Ella  se dedica a la venta de lentes de sol repelentes bloqueadores pelotas y gorras. Y a la vez trabaja en su bodega que implemento en su vivienda. El crédito lo invertirá en la compra de más lentes de sol  gorras pelotas bloqueadores solares y repelentes por estación de verano. El grupo agradece a los inversionistas KIVA por el crédito brindado. Fiorella es la primera persona parada del lado derecho viste buzo lila
texts.en:
The "Corcona Hacia el Progreso" group is made up of women who are eager to improve their families' quality of life. 

Fiorella is 24 years old. She is single with a child in school and a six-month-old baby. She sells sunglasses, insect repellents, sun creams, balls, and hats. She also works in her general store which she runs from her home. She will use the loan to buy more sunglasses, hats, balls, sun creams, and insect repellents for the summer season.  

The group are very grateful to the Kiva lenders for the loans they provide. Fiorella is the woman standing on the far right wearing purple sweatpants.

loans.use: to buy more sunglasses, hats, sunscreens, and balls.

loans.name: Pov

texts.en:
Pov, 42 years old, is living in a rural community in Prey Veng Province, Cambodia. She has two single children; one is a student and one is a construction worker.

To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a rice farming business on small farmland which is located near her house. So far, it is almost thirty years for her being a farmer. On average, she is able to make an earning of 5 USD per day.

Pov wants to have household energy at a reduced monthly cost by purchasing a solar energy home system. Because there is inadequate money, she has requested a Kiva loan through its partner, HKL. After this initial investment, she hopes to have clean energy to power her household lights, TV and radio. She is very happy and thankful because, with this loan, HKL has provided her a special interest rate lower than its general loan rates. She awaits your kindness and relies on your generosity.

loans.use: to buy a solar energy home system

loans.name: Luzminda

texts.en:
Luzminda is 47 years old and married.  She has five children and two of her children are in school.  Luzminda works very hard to provide for them.

Luzminda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 9000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.  Luzminda has been in this business for two years.   In the future, Luzminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: purchase additional items to sell like canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Nicolasa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Nicolasa works hard to support her family.

She has a business selling used clothing in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs. Nicolasa is borrowing 20,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell for her used clothing selling business.

Nicolasa has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional bundles of used clothing to sell

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is 38 years old and married with eleven children. With five children in school, Melanie works very hard to provide for them.   She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 14,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, cigarettes, and canned goods. Melanie has been in this business for 6 years. 

In the future, Melanie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell such as beverages, cigarettes, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Nunung

texts.en:
Nunung is 33 years old and married. She lives with her husband and her children. She has a grocery shop to increase family income. She was pleased to be able to help her husband to improve their life. Her husband is employed at a factory.

She has asked for a loan from KPP-UMKM Syariah for 8,000,000 Indonesian rupiah (IDR). This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family.  She wants to have access to safe sanitation for families.  Her family income is still not enough to build toilets and water resources with cash, but they are able to repay loans received.
She and her family want to live a healthy life with healthy sanitation. She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all lenders.

loans.use: This loan will be used to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at their home for improvement of access to water and sanitation for their family

loans.name: Leah

texts.en: Hello! Meet Leah, 36 years of age, a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Kaptumo, a remote village in Nandi hills. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs and varieties of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaging in another small personal business. The Nandihills area is very populated and demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits I enjoy.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 30,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy poultry. Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved, and she will be able to buy more poultry. Through the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to increased profit margins and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and increase her poultry market to other markets and this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used in fully repaying the loan and permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter is a single man. He describes himself to be humble and disciplined. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, flour, cooking oil, rice and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. 

His business is located in a secure location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, rice and other items. 

Peter's business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will expand his business and open other businesses. 

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to reinvest in the  business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, cooking oil, rice and other items.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. 

Her business is located in a fertile location and her primary customers are large scale buyers. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy farm supplies. 

Elizabeth's business goal is to have a large business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva Lenders! Meet Hellen, a dedicated, determined and honest mother of six lovely children. She is based in Nkubu, Kenya. The rich soil of this area makes it one of the nation’s biggest tea growing regions, lending it the nickname of  “tea region”. 

For the past 10 years, she has been involved in mixed farming and her primary source of income has been selling milk, eggs, tea and a variety of food crops. These ventures have allowed her earn a decent income. Hellen passionately loves poultry farming, but the biggest challenge she faces is the lack of funds. 

However, this challenge has not made her give up. “I have to do something for my family and children,” she said. She mobilized other enterprising women like her in her village, and they have joined Juhudi Kilimo, which is a micro finance that assists small-scale farmers through giving out loans and training. 

Hellen is requesting a loan from Juhudi kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy additional poultry. Having gone through training on loan management, she is educated on how to utilize the loan and save more money. Through this loan, Hellen will generate enough income to take care of the farming costs and expand her poultry business

loans.use: To buy poultry.

loans.name: Mila

texts.en:
Mila is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Mila is 48 years old now.

She has a buy and sell charcoal business in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 7,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

Mila has been in this business for 7 years. In the future, she would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is 34 years old and married with four children, and two of her children are in school. Nenita works very hard to provide for them.

Nenita's business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business. She has requested PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

She is committed to rebuild her business, and in the future she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, etc.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Las calles de Sololá  es testigo de los colores más vistosos impregnados en las blusas y fajas típicas.  Es imposible que cualquier turista deje de admirar este producto, pararse y hacer una buena compra de ello. Es el trabajo de Catarina de 41 años de edad ya con grandes aspiraciones en dar a conocer a su comunidad y a todos los que la visitan la actividad que ella realiza con tanto esfuerzo y dedicación, casada y vive con su esposo con el deseo de superar en la vida e alcanzar grandes sueños que ella quiere realizar en la vida, ella tiene cuatro hijos los primeros dos hijos ya tienen familias apartes y los dos últimos son excelentes estudiantes en la escuela de su comunidad.
	
El trabajo que ella realiza con tanto esmero es la compra, elaboración y  venta de cortes típicas dicha actividad lo realiza en su casa y en lugares cercanos de su comunidad donde ella vive, ella lleva realizando dicha actividad durante 25 años, la segunda actividad que ella realiza es la venta de panes negocio que realiza con su esposo por más de cinco años porque les genera una ganancia para el bienestar de su familia y mejorar las condiciones económicas de su familia y comunidad.

El uso que ella le dará al préstamo que ella está realizando es para la compra de mercadería de trajes típicas para luego venderlas por los alrededores de su comunidad. Uno de las aspiraciones de ella es tener un local en el mercado de su comunidad y ver que sus hijos se convierten en profesionales en la vida.
texts.en:
The streets of Sololá are witness to the brightest colors imbued in the traditional blouses and sashes.  It is impossible for any tourist to stop to admire these products, and not end up making a good deal.  It is the work of Catarina, 41, who has already voiced her grand aspirations to her community, and to all who visit the business that she manages with so much effort and dedication.  She has a strong desire to succeed in life, and has great dreams that she wishes to fulfill.  She is married and lives with her husband.  She has four children; the older two children already have their own families and the two younger ones are excellent students at the community’s school.

The job that Catarina does with so much care is purchasing, making, and selling traditional clothing.  She engages in this activity in her home, and in places near the community where she lives, and she has been involved in this business for twenty-five years.  The second activity she is engaged in is selling bread, a business that she has run with her husband for five years.  This business generates a profit for her family’s welfare and improves her family’s financial conditions as well as those of the community. 

Catarina will use the loan she is requesting to purchase traditional clothing for later sale in the areas around her community.  One of her aspirations is to have a sales local at her community’s market, and see that her children become professionals in life.

loans.use: to purchase traditional clothing.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is a 32-year-old woman who engages in fishing to earn a living. She catches and sells fish to the nearby community. She has four children. Her oldest child is 15 and the youngest is 6. Together with her family, she lives in Dulag, Leyte. 

Melanie has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy fishing net and materials for pump boat construction.  Through this, Melanie will improve her volume of catch and eventually will gain a higher yield.  

In the future, Melanie would like to expand her fishing business to become successful, while at the same time support the needs of her growing children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for pump boat construction.

loans.name: Jaime

texts.es:
Jaime tiene de 42 años, es casado, vive en casa propia junto a sus 02 hijas y esposa, viven en sector Servicentro de Cayaltí. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Y está ubicada en el Catacaos, región Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Jaime se dedica al servicio mototaxi y al servicio de construcción e instalación en estructuras de draywall. Además cría y vende aves de corral (pollos, pavos y patos). Su esposa vende productos de belleza por catálagos. El destino del crédito es para inversión en mejora de techo de vivienda en calaminas y estructuras de metal, pues la época de lluvias ya se acerca y desea brindarle seguridad a toda su familia, para poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Jaime is 42 years old and married. He lives in his own house with his 2 daughters and his wife, in the Servicentro de Cayaltí area. They are a close knit family who live in a zone where people have small businesses, farm, and raise livestock. It is located in Catacaos, Piura region, on the north coast of Peru.  

Jaime drives a motorcycle-taxi and also works on construction jobs and installs drywall structures. In addition, he raises and sells barnyard animals (chickens, turkeys and ducks). His wife sells beauty products by catalog. 

This loan will be used to improve the roof of his house with corrugated metal sheets and metallic structures, because the rainy season is approaching and he wants to protect his family, and thus improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to improve the roof of his house with corrugated metal sheets and metallic structures.

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 56 years old and married with five children, and one of her children is in school. Nilda works very hard to provide for them.

Her business was devastated by super typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. Nilda is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart her general store business. She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to sell. 

Nilda is committed to rebuilding her business, and in the future she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Evaline

texts.en:
Hello world! Meet Evaline, a mother of three from Kapsowar, a remote village in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past two years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk and vegetables produced on her farm.

She also engages in a personal business to make ends meet. Evaline is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities in which she is involved, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her birds. She is so close with her birds that she has nicknamed one of them Kipara, meaning "no feathers on the head."

Evaline wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy additional poultry. With your loan, Evaline will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm.

This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Evaline is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Evaline dreams of a secure future for her children. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry.

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is a 45-year-old widow who supports a family of six children. She has been operating a retail business shop for a period of ten years, earning herself an income of about KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Josephine is now servicing her seventh loan of KES 60,000 with VisionFund Kenya and intends to use the entire amount to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, bread and detergents to add to her current stock.

She plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have growth in her business and live a stable life.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, milk, bread and detergents.

loans.name: Anahit

texts.en:
Anahit is 58 years old and she lives in Vanadzor city of the Lori region. She is happy to note that this will be her fourth Kiva loan. Her previous three deals with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon were rather profitable and pleasant, which brought to her business great development and expansion. 

She still operates her business of selling dishware, ceramics and souvenirs, which before was her family’s single source of income. Anahit’s husband is back from the Russian Federation, and being unemployed he greatly helps his wife in her business, especially on the days that Anahit must go to Yerevan city to bring a new assortment of dishware and ceramics for her shop. 

As Anahit mentions, she changed the location of her shop so it is closer to her city’s wholesale market, so her shop now is more noticeable and more visited than before. 

Anahit is asking for a loan of 400,000 Armenian drams. In her shop, the assortment of tea and coffee sets are few, and with this loan amount she will buy more tea and coffee sets and vases with great hope that this fourth Kiva loan will be as profitable and positive as the last three were.

loans.use: to buy tea and coffee serving sets and also vases.

loans.name: Muna

texts.en:
Muna is an 18-year-old single woman from Jabalia. She lives with her family in a very simple house. Her father is a construction worker and he earns a low and unstable income. This income barely covers all of the family's needs. Muna is a student in her first year where she studies physics. She would like to complete a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future. 
Muna took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to buy a new laptop for her studies. With this loan and the new laptop , Muna will be able to do her home work and write reports easily. Muna appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for her study.

loans.name: Resineros De Curucupaceo Group

texts.es:
Este grupo se llama “Resineros de Curucupaceo”, ya que todos sus integrantes se dedican a colectar resina de pino. Todos ellos vecinos de la comunidad San Diego y  la Cumbre,  que se localizan en una zona accidentada y montañosa del Municipio de Madero en el Estado de Michoacán. Jenaro de 39 años es un ejidatario que representa al grupo, esta casado con Elvia con quién tiene cinco hijos;  dos niñas, Alondra de 4 años y  Jazmín de 9, y tres niños; Genaro el mayor tiene 14 años, Ivan que va en quinto de primaria  tiene 12, el más chiquito se llama Cristian y esta en primer año de primaria, es decir, todos ellos asisten a la escuela.

Desde niño, Jenaro heredó de su padre el oficio del resinero, y a la fecha es su principal sustento y único ingreso económico, ya que el trabajo consiste en resinar los árboles de pino, desde muy temprano en el monte, colectar y acopiar la resina en su casa, trasladarla a 150 kilómetros hasta la Capital del estado para su venta,  además de cuidar los árboles para que no se plaguen ni se incendie el monte.

Conjuntamente con el grupo, pretende utilizar el préstamo para reforestar áreas que no tienen bosque y poder tener mayor cosecha de resina de pino: para tener una mejor calidad de vida y mejorar su economía. En las plantaciones se puede cosechar la resina de hasta 800 árboles por hectárea, mientras que en el monte natural solo se cosecha lo de 80 pinos. 

Sus planes en el futuro son tener plantaciones de pino resinero que sirvan de ejemplo para la comunidad y que generen mayores ingresos económicos, ya que sueña con transmitir a sus hijos el amor por el trabajo de la resina y el bosque y enseñarlos para que ellos sepan y puedan vivir de él.  Le llena de orgullo poder  vivir y trabajar en armonía con el bosque, ya que la resinación se realiza en una zona natural de montañas de pinos.

Agradece a los prestamistas por su apoyo y su interés por el cuidado de la naturaleza, ya que no a todas la personas nos interesa cuidar el medio ambiente, le gustaría platicarles que la resina de pino se ha usado por miles de años en beneficio de la humanidad y que el bosque trae muchos más beneficios que solo darnos oxígeno.

Su mayor reto es conseguir un precio de garantía rentable que permita conservar el entusiasmo por el oficio del resinero. En Michoacán este oficio es muy viejo pues es sabido que aquellos bosques que se resinan, se conservan mejor ya que un resinero es el mejor amigo del bosque.

El grupo ha acordado destinar los recursos del préstamo, exclusivamente para establecer las plantaciones comerciales de 30 mil pinos resineros, para incrementar la cosecha de resina. Opinan que es de mucha ayuda no tener que utilizar los pocos ingresos que se tienen para atender las necesidades de la  familia a los proyectos de las nuevas plantaciones.
texts.en: To find out more about how Ejido Verde is working to create opportunity for indigenous populations watch this video This group is called the “Resinersos de Curucupaceo” because all of the members collect pine resin. They are all neighbors in the San Diego and La Cumbre community, which is a rugged and mountainous area in the Madero municipality in the state of Michoacán. Jenaro, age 39, is the member who represents the group. He is married to Elvia, and they have five children. They have two girls; Alondra, age 4; and Jazmín, age 9; and three boys; Genaro, the oldest, is 14; Ivan, who is in fifth grade, is 12; and the Cristian, the littlest, is in first grade. They all go to school. When he was a boy Jenaro inherited the trade of collecting resin from his father. To date, it is his primary support and his only source of financial income. The work consists of getting resin from the pine trees. It starts very early, going to the trees to collect the resin, storing the resin at his house, and then transporting it 150 kilometers to the capital of the state in order to sell it. This is in addition to taking care of the trees so that they do not get infested or burn on the mountain. Together with the group, he plans to use the loan to reforest areas that do not have woods so as to be able to have a greater pine resin harvest. He will do this in order to have a better quality of life and to improve his finances. In the land that is planted you can harvest the resin of up to 800 trees per hectare, while you can only harvest 80 pines growing naturally on the mountain. His plans for the future are to have resin producing pine trees planted to serve as an example for the community and generate greater income. He dreams of passing on to his children his love for working with resin and the forest. He also dreams of teaching them so that they know that they can make a living from doing so. It fills him with pride to be able to live and work in harmony with the forest. This is because he works with resin in a natural area of pines on the mountains. He is grateful to the lenders for their support and their interest in the care of nature. Not everyone is interested in taking care of the environment. He would like to tell them that pine resin has been used for thousands of years to benefit humanity, and that the forest brings more benefits than just giving us oxygen. His biggest challenge is getting a guaranteed profitable price that allows him to stay enthusiastic about the trade of harvesting pine resin. In Michoacán this trade is very old. It is known that the forests that produce resin are better preserved because a resin worker is the best friend of the forest. The group has agreed to use the loan exclusively to establish the commercial planting of 30,000 resin producing pines in order to increase the resin harvest. They feel that it is a big help not to have to use the little earnings that they have to take care of the family necessities on the project for the new plantings.

loans.use: to buy and plant resin producing pine trees. The resin will be harvested annually, providing income for years to come.

loans.name: Eli

texts.es:
Eli tiene 28 años de edad, tiene un hogar estable, el cual vive con su cónyuge y su menor hijo, él está dedicado a la destilación de aguardiente actividad que desarrolla en el caserío Santa Clara. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Callacyuc, provincia y región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú.

Eli se dedica a la destilación y comercio de aguardiente, con una antigüedad de 7 años en el negocio, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales. El préstamo lo utilizará como capital de trabajo pues desea comprar una máquina destiladora para aumentar su producción e implementar su negocio. Con el crédito otorgado podrá tener una mayor producción en la destilación y así aumentar sus ventas y poder mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Eli, 28, has a stable home in which he lives with his spouse and small son.  He is engaged in distilling brandy, an activity he develops is the village of Santa Clara, located in the Callayuc district, province and region of Cajamarca, in Peru’s Northern Sierra.  His community is primarily engaged in farming, raising livestock, and trade.  

Eli is engaged in distilling and selling brandy.  He has seven years in the business, and has very good personal and work references.  He will use the loan as working capital as he wishes to purchase a distiller machine to increase production and implement his business. The credit granted will enable him to have better production in the distillery and thus, increase his sales and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a distiller machine to increase production and implement his business.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is a married woman with five children. She is 59 years old and one of her children is still in school.

Gloria is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She has a business selling "nipa" roofing in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more nipa roofing to sell.

Gloria has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more "nipa" roofing to sell

loans.name: Elceres

texts.es:
Elceres tiene 27 años de edad, tiene hogar estable al lado se su cónyuge , tiene una hija de 2 años de edad, vive en casa de familia de material rustico un piso, Elceres y su cónyuge son nacidos en caserío el pueblo lo hizo ; vive en armonía familiar y en comunión con los miembros de su caserío, vive en la parte rural del caserío el pueblo lo hizo Distrito de santo tomas ; vive en una comunidad pequeña dedicada básicamente a la agricultura y ganadería, vivienda cuenta con servicios de agua.

La actividad que realiza Elceres es el cultivo de café, contando a la fecha con 1 has. Variedad Catimor, plantación tiene tres años de edad ya que en la zona todos tienen plantación nuevas; café de cliente esta en primer año de producción y para 2015 estará en segundo año de producción; tiene terreno agrícola propio 4 has. donde realiza cultivo de café, actividad la realiza hace 06 años ya que anteriormente a cultiva café variedad nacional. cuenta con experiencia en el rubro del cultivo de café, producto lo vende en distrito santo tomas a compradores de la zona. Adicionalmente cliente se dedica a la actividad pecuaria cría de ganado vacuno y también al cultivo y productos de pan llevar todo esto lo realiza en terreno propio en caserío el pueblo lo hizo distrito santo tomas. El destino del crédito sera para mantenimiento de 1 has. De café en producción, con ello asegurara mayor y mejor producción para campaña 2015 y por ende obtendrá mayores ingresos para así poder mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Elceres, age 27, has a stable home with his life partner.  He has a two year old daughter.  He lives in the family house, which is one floor and made from basic materials.  Elceres and his life partner were born in the settlement of El Pueblo Lo Hizo.  He lives in familial harmony and in communion with the members of his settlement.  He lives in the rural part of the El Pueblo Lo Hizo settlement in the Santo Tomas district.  He lives in a small community that basically devotes itself to agriculture and to livestock.  His house does have water service.

Elceres’s business activity is growing coffee.  To date he has one hectare of the Catimor variety, which is three years old because everyone in the zone has newly cultivated fields.  His coffee is in its first year of production, and in 2015 it will be in its second year of production.  He has his own four hectares of agricultural land where he grows coffee.  He has been engaged in this business activity for six years.  He previously grew the National variety of coffee.  He has experience in the field of growing coffee.  He sells this product in the Santo Tomas district to the buyers in the area.

Additionally, he is engaged in the business activity of raising cattle.  He also farms grain products.  He does all of this on his own land in the El Pueblo Lo Hizo settlement in the Santo Tomas district.

The loan will be for maintenance of the one hectare of coffee that is in production.  With this, he will be certain to get greater and better production during the 2015 season.  As a result, he will get better income in order to be able to improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on the one hectare of coffee that is in production.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a married woman with five children. She is 43 years old and four of her children are in school.

Edna is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a peanut butter "buy-and-sell" business in the Philippines. It was damaged by super typhoon Haiyan last November 8, 2013. Edna has requested a PHP 5,000 bridge loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business to restart her business activities.

Edna has been in this business for two years and would like to rebuild it with your help. In the future, Edna would like to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old and married, with 12 children.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Gloria would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 38 years old and married with four children; three of her children are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Norma  runs a general store in the Philippines, and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase an additional stock of items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc..

She has been in this business for two years. 

In the future, Norma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of items to sell, like beverages, canned goods, groceries, etc.

loans.name: Quan's Group

texts.en:
Quan was born in 1985, and is a Thai ethnic man. He has been in the M7-MFI program since 2012.  He lives with his wife and his daughter in Mai Son district, Son La province.

With an income from agriculture after subtracting initial investment costs, his family has just enough money for covering the family’s expenses and has saved a little amount, which is not enough to buy organic fertilizer for his coffee garden. Therefore, he really needs a loan to buy organic fertilizer for the coffee garden.

He hopes that, by using organic fertilizer, his coffee garden will give a higher yield, as well as his family's living standard will be improved. And with the increased productivity of the coffee garden, his family’s income will guarantee the repayment of the loan for M7-MFI on time.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer

loans.name: Siranush

texts.en:
Siranush is 37 years old and she lives with her nice family in Spitak city of Lori region. Siranush has a higher medical education, and a specialty of pediatrician.
