She is married, and she has two school-aged children.  Siranush has 14 years of work experience of her profession. Now she works at the city’s hospital as a deputy director and pediatrician. 

Siranush mentions the catastrophic earthquake in 1988 in her native city still has a great impact on human health and the mental world of them, even after 26 years, through the generations it is obvious. For many years her city was in ruins, and being the disaster zone, there were few schools and very few hospitals, which were the most important institutions for the people. 

Today the city with its scenes does not remind anyone of the past, but each family here has its own loss and tragedy, which they cannot forget. With her professional skills, Siranush does her best to be useful and to keep the children, the future of this revived city, healthy.

She will be greatly thankful to receive this loan, which she will use for the purchase of a computer and professional literature which will be a big and useful source of information in her profession.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature

loans.name: Richelle

texts.en:
Richelle is a married woman with one child who is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Richelle is 32 years old now.

She has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. Richelle requested a PHP 4,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional spare parts for her bicycle transport business.

Richelle has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional spare parts for her bicycle transport business

loans.name: Santos Nicolas

texts.es:
Santos Nicolás tiene 61 años de edad, es conviviente, sin hijos a su cargo, vive en casa propia; vive en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Santos Nicolás se dedica a brindar el servicio de jornalearía; desde hace 35 años, sus servicios los ofrece en su distrito y caseríos cercanos, él solicita préstamo para invertir en activo fijo; compra de una mochila para fumigar; esto le servirá para mejorar sus servicios a los agricultores dándole un valor agregado a su servicio, lo que le permitirá captar un número mayor de clientes, y esto a su vez le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Santos Nicolás, 61, is in a common-law marriage with children under his care.  He lives in his own house in the rural area of the Oyotún district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on Peru’s northern coast.  His community is primarily engaged in farming, raising livestock, and trade.

Santos Nicolás has been providing services as a day laborer for thirty-five years.  He offers his services in his district and nearby villages.  He is requesting the loan to invest in a fixed asset, a backpack sprayer.  This will serve to improve his services to farmers, giving an added value to his service, which will permit him to attract a greater number of customers. This, in turn, will allow him to improve his income and increase his profits in a short time and, thereby, improve his quality of life and that of his family.

loans.use: to purchase a backpack sprayer and give added value to his service.

loans.name: Dung's Group

texts.en:
Dung, born in 1993, is a Thai ethnic person living in the Mai Son district of Son La province. Though she is still young, she is always exemplary, enthusiastically helping other members in the group/cluster since she joined the program in January 2011.

Currently, she is living with her husband and her beautiful daughter. Her family income is mainly from breeding and cultivation. After offsetting the costs of family and work, she does not have enough money to buy fertilizer for her coffee garden.

Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer for the coffee garden to improve her coffee production, to increase her income and improve her family’s life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda is a married woman with 10 children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Luzviminda is 53 years old and three of her children are in school.

Luzviminda has a bicycle transport business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business.

Luzviminda has been in this business for one year. In the future, Luzviminda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy spare parts and other materials needed for her business

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Teresita is 42 years old and has two children who are in school.

Teresita has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan for 8000 PHP through NWTF to buy additional equipment needed for her business.

Teresita has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional equipment needed for her business

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine lives in the village of Gandzaqar of the Tavush region with her husband, two sons and a daughter (a student). This peasant family is happy with its farming and agricultural occupations. Marine’s husband has a truck with which he makes cargo transfers around his region. Marine, besides being the mother of three children (the smallest son is two years old) and having a great deal of work to do around her house, is also a skilled farmer. On her farm she has four cows, two calves, two piglets and twenty-five chickens. The amount of milk, meat and eggs is not very big and Marine tries to divide it all in a way that it can also be enough for her family use. On her plot of land she also cultivates potatoes, beans, figs and persimmons, which she also sells. Since Marine’s husband is busy with his cargo transfers, the farming is fully Marine’s occupation in which she has already spent 20 years.

This loan will greatly help Marine to buy several piglets and also a lot of animal fodder for all her farm cattle, since each farmer’s concerns are connected with the storage of fodder for the cold and long winter months.

loans.use: to buy several piglets and also a lot of animal fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and drinks for business use

loans.name: Mary- Lou

texts.en:
Mary-Lou is a 57-year-old hardworking mother. She is engaged in making and selling Calamay (which means "sugar" and is a sticky sweet delicacy that is popular in many regions of the Philippines). She has been in the food vending business for more than 20 years. She has two grown children. She lives in Dulag, Leyte. She has requested a loan of 15,000 PHP to buy additional ingredients like rice flour, peanuts, sugar and empty coconut shells for storage.  With these, Mary-Lou can now continue her livelihood and hopes that it will prosper.

With the additional capital, Mary-Lou can maximize all the possibilities to expand and hopefully she can manage it well for the benefit of the whole family.

loans.use: to buy additional ingredients like rice flour, peanuts, sugar and empty coconut shells for storage

loans.name: Benjamin

texts.es:
Benjamín tiene 52 años de edad, de estado civil es Conviviente y sin carga familiar, vive en casa propia de material rustico en el distrito de Buenos Aires, es un lugar donde sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio cuenta con servicios básicos como son agua y luz. Dicho distrito está ubicado en la provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Benjamín es la venta de abarrotes al por menor (productos de primera necesidad:arroz, azúcar, café, etc.) en su domicilio, contando ya con clientela fija por lo que tiene experiencia en el rubro, siendo conocido en la zona. El destino del crédito es para comprar arroz, azúcar y abarrotes para surtir su negocio. La inversión le ayudará a obtener mejores ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia. Pues el mercado presenta buenas perspectivas debido a que los pobladores de la zona están trabajando en empresas exportadoras de banano, y otros trabajando como peones agrícolas por temporada de cosecha de arroz.
texts.en:
Benjamín is 52 years old, has a partner but doesn't have dependent children. He lives in his own home made of rustic materials in the Buenos Aires district. This is a place whose inhabitants are known for farming, livestock, and business. There are basic services of water and electricity. The district is located in Morropon province, Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Benjamin sells basic needs groceries such as rice, sugar, coffee, etc. from his home. He has a steady customer base and is very experienced in his business and known in the area. The loan will be used to buy rice, sugar, and groceries to stock his business. The loan will help him obtain greater income, increasing his earnings and thus improve his quality of life and that of his family. The market presents good possibilities as the inhabitants of the area are working in banana export businesses and others in seasonal rice harvest farming.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, and groceries to stock his business.

loans.name: Francis

texts.en:
Francis is a 51 year old man. He is married to Florence, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with three children. Francis has been operating a clothing sales business for a period of two years, earning himself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Francis was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer who is servicing his first loan of KES 30,000. Francis intends to use this amount to buy shirts, blouses, sweaters, and jackets to sell to his clients on a daily basis.

Francis plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to have a bright future with a lot of success.

loans.use: to buy shirts, trousers, blouses, sweaters, jackets, and dresses.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en: Ahmad is a 24-year-old university student majoring in finance. He is in his third year. He lives in one of Jordan's governorates called Ajloun with his parents. He also works in the evenings at a private company. Ahmad wants to support himself by finding a job in his field with a better income after graduating. Now he is applying for this loan to be able to pay for his university fees.

loans.use: To pay the fees for his upcoming semester

loans.name: Demetrio

texts.es:
Demetrio tiene 41 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por prestar servicio de albañilería y construcción. Vive en casa familiar con cónyuge e hija de 03 años recién cumplidos, su cónyuge trabaja en agrícola de zona de residencia. Demetrio es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y personales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad de clima caluroso dedicada a la agricultura, y ganadería. Ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Demetrio se dedica a prestar el servicio de albañilería y construcción, desde hace más de 20 años aproximadamente. Su servicio lo brinda en su distrito y caseríos aledaños. Él necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de un número mayor de cerdos, para engordarlos, y posteriormente venderlos. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio is 41 years old. He is in a relationship and he is known in his area for his bricklaying and construction activities. He lives in the family home with his wife and daughter who just turned 3. His wife works in agriculture in the area where they live. Demetrio has good personal and work references. His family is untied. He lives in a community with a hot climate dominated by agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the Cayaltí district in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the North Coast of Peru.

Demetrio has worked providing services as a bricklayer and in construction for more than 20 years. He works in his area and in the neighboring villages. He needs the loan to invest in a greater number of pigs to fatten and later sell. That will allow him to increase his income in the short term, increase his profits and in the end improve his family's quality of living.

loans.use: to buy a greater number of pigs to fatten and sell.

loans.name: Ana Cary

texts.es:
Ana Cary tiene de 25 años de edad, es conviviente, conocida en el medio, por su labor de venta de productos de primera necesidad y a la venta de chicha de jora en su domicilio. Vive con su conviviente, quien labora en empresa particular agrícola. Ana Cary tiene buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Saña, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Ana Cary se dedica a venta de productos de primera necesidad y a la preparación y venta de chicha de jora. El destino del crédito será para la inversión en compra de mercadería y productos de bazar y regalos por campaña navideña, pues por esta época las ventas suben un volumen considerable. Atendiendo la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, ella ampliará su cartera de clientes, contando con clientes nuevos e ingresos adicionales a la familia. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ana Cary is 25 years old, has a partner, is known for her work selling basic needs products and chicha (a traditional Peruvian beverage) from her home. She lives with her partner, who works in agriculture. Ana Cary has good personal and work references and is from a stable family. She lives in a community that works in business, farming, and livestock. The community is located in Sana District, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region in northern coastal Peru.

Ana Cary sells basic needs products and chicha (a traditional Peruvian beverage). The loan will be used to invest in buying merchandise, products, and gifts for the holiday season as during this season her sales go up considerably. Meeting the demand of her customers, she will expand the number of customers, get new customers, and new income for her family. This will enable her in the short term to increase her income and profits resulting in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, products, and gifts for the holiday season.

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, sin hijos a su cargo, vive con su familia en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Julia se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales, como patos, gallos, gallinas, pollos, cuyes con más de 20 años de experiencia en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Ella solicita préstamo para compra de un número mayor de animales, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor variedad y productividad en animales, con gran influencia en el negocio; Julia piensa incrementar su stock de animales para poder atender las diversas gustos y necesidades de los clientes de la zona. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Julia is 51 years old, married, without children to support, and lives with her family in a rural area of Oyotun district, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region on the northern coast of Peru. Members of her community work in farming, livestock, and business.

Julia raises and sells animals such as ducks, roosters, chickens, and hens. She has more than 20 years of experience in this business, and the business is located behind her home. She seeks a loan to buy a large number of animals so that she will have a greater variety and productivity of animals, thus greatly impacting her business. Julia plans to increase her animal stock in order to be able to meet the diverse needs and likes of her customers. In the short term this will allow her to improve her income, increase her profits, thus resulting in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy a large number of animals.

loans.name: Yazan

texts.en: Yazan is a 21-year-old university student majoring in marketing, and he is in his third year. He lives with his five family members in Zarqa-Jordan. His father is a retired man who currently works as an electrician. Yazan wants to support his family financially by finding a good job in his field after graduating. Now he is applying for this loan to pay for his upcoming semester fees as he doesn't have enough money to do so.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is 52 years old and married with five children and one of her children is in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Yolanda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

Yolanda has been in this business for six years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like shampoo, canned goods, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Mary Angelie

texts.en:
Mary Angelie is 32 years old and married with four children. All of her children are in school. Mary Angelie works very hard to provide for them.

Her business was devastated by Super Typhoon Haiyan that swept through the Philippines last November 8, 2013. She is taking out a bridge loan to restart her general store business.

Mary Angelie has requested a PHP 5,000 loan through NWTF to restart  her general store business.

She is using the new loan to stock up on a variety of goods to resell. 

Mary Angelie is committed to rebuilding, and in the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell like cigarettes, canned goods, and groceries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials for and to build a bathroom, septic tank, and a closet at their home to improve access to water and sanitation

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase cereal seeds

loans.name: Albanus

texts.en:
Albanus is a 42-year-old man married to Elizabeth, who adds additional income to support their family, and they are blessed with two children.  Albanus has been operating a clothing sales business stall for a period of ten years, earning himself an income of KES 15,000 every month.

Albanus was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a Credit Officer and is now servicing his first loan of KES 30,000 and intends to use this amount to buy shirts, blouses, trousers, sweaters and blazers to sell to his customers on a daily basis.

Albanus plans to use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children and hopes to provide the best education for them.

loans.use: To buy shirts, blouses, trousers and sweaters to sell to his clients.

loans.name: Patrick

texts.en: Patrick is a married man. He has five children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a strategic location. He describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him do farming. His business goal is to have a large business within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable him to do farming

loans.name: Martha

texts.en: Martha is a married woman. She has 2 children aged 3 and 6. She describes herself to be jovial and ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, cooking fat and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area with lots of customers and her primary customers are the general public. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy a cow for dairy farming. Her business goal is to expand and have a supermarket within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy a cow for dairy farming

loans.name: Balbina Del Jesus

texts.es:
Balbina de Jesús tiene 29 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia, junto a su menor hijo. Ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano ,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Balbina de Jesús es a la venta de fruta y verduras en el exterior del mercado de Morropón, actividad que realiza desde hace más de 4 años. Balbina de Jesús cuenta con clientela fija en la zona y con muy buenas referencias en la zona donde vive y donde labora, con buen comportamiento de pago. Destino del crédito será para la capital de trabajo(compra y venta de fruta al por mayor para poder venderlo a un a un precio comodo sin disminuir el margen de sus ganancias pero si en pro de aumento de las entas captando un número mayor de clientes.
texts.en:
Balbina de Jesús is 29 years old. She is single and lives in her own house with her young son. She is a native of the area. Life in this district is calm, it's inhabitants work in agriculture and raising livestock. As their form of subsistence they grow and harvest bananas, corn and beans, etc. This community is located in the district and province of Morropón, Piura region on the North Coast of Peru.

The work that Balbina de Jesús carries out is selling fruit and vegetables outside of the municipal market of Morropón, something she has been doing for more than 4 years. Balbina de Jesús has a regular clientele from the area and has very good references in the area she lives in and at her work. She has a good record of paying. The loan will be used as working capital buying and selling fruit wholesale. Then she can sell it at a good price without decreasing her margin of profit. But she will have an increase in sales which will bring her more clients.

loans.use: to increase her working capital, buying and selling fruit wholesale.

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en:
Arshaluys is 61 years old and he lives in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Arshaluys already paid back two Kiva loans on time. Arshaluys is a certified engineer with a university education and has worked in that sphere for many years.  But with the need of earning more money, he changed the profile of his work; it has already been 10 years that he has been engaged in the trade of gold jewelry in a rented place in Vanadzor market. Arshaluys sells gold chains, rings, bracelets and earrings.  He says he works every day without days off as not to miss his regular customers and newcomers who mainly visit his stall for significant events, such as engagements, weddings, birthdays and christenings. Arshaluys has a son who lives abroad with his family. This son supports his parents financially but in the last years Arshaluys has earned good money, as he is experienced in the jewelry trade. He brings jewelry from Yerevan twice a month.
This loan will be used to buy new stylish golden jewelry for his business to make his stall fashionable and more attractive for his customers.

loans.use: to buy new stylish golden jewelry for his business so to make his stall fashionable and more attractive to buyers

loans.name: Majeda

texts.en: Majeda is a 40-year old married woman living with her five family members in Irbid-Jordan. Her husband is a taxi driver, and his income isn't enough to cover his children's needs. One of their daughters is a university student majoring in Public Relations, and she is in her second year. She also works in the evenings at a KFC restaurant to help her family financially. Majeda is applying for this loan to help her daughter pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay study fees

loans.name: Urzhamal

texts.ru: Уржамал 67 лет, вдова, 2 детей живут вместе с Уржамал, остальные самостоятельные. В 1994 году, начала бизнес по разведению скота, закупив 2 коровы. Уржамал на пенсии, на сегодняшний день у нее в хозяйстве есть 7 овец, 1 бычок. Среднемесячный доход составляет чуть более 4,000 сом (KGS). Этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание детей. Уржамал обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 овец, 1 бычка и корма для скота. Доходы от кредита позволят Уржамал улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и накопить средства на свадьбы младших детей.
texts.en:
Urzhamal is 67 years old. Two children live with her and the others live on their own. Urzhamal started a business in 1994 raising livestock by buying two cows. She is now living on a pension, with seven sheep and one young bull.

Her average monthly income is a little over 4,000 KGS. This amount is really insufficient for a decent life and raising children. Urzhamal has asked micro-finance bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 50,000 KGS to buy two sheep, one young bull and cattle feed. 

She will use the income from the loan to improve her welfare, grow her business and save for the weddings of her youngest children.

loans.use: to purchase two sheep, one young bull and feed for livestock.

loans.name: Om-Basel Group

texts.en:
Om-Basel is the same group that applied for a first loan which was given by Kiva lenders. After all the members of the group finished the repayment of all the installments of the first loan, they applied for a second loan of 260,000 YER from Kiva lenders.

Joma'a is the same leader of this group. She applied for a first loan from Kiva lenders to purchase construction materials to expand her house because it was very small and not big enough for all the members of the family. The first loan helped her very much to expand her own house. Joma'a works hard to expand the house more to make it fit all the members of the family. For this reason, she has applied for a second loan of 80,000 YER from Kiva lenders to purchase iron, steel, cement and bricks to build another room. All the members of the group thank Kiva lenders warmly for their first loan and for this loan, too.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to expand her small house.

loans.name: Zulfiya

texts.ru: Зульфия, 38 лет, не замужем, 2 детей. У Зульфии среднее образование, с 2007 года в качестве основного дохода занимается торговлей женской и детской одежды на рынке, также у нее есть собственное кафе, где работают 5 человек. Зульфия известна как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. У нее есть товар в обороте на сумму более 200,000 сом (KGS). Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет в среднем 20,000 сом (KGS). Наработаны постоянные клиенты, как в магазине, так и в кафе. Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Зульфия обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку одежды для расширения ассортимента и привлечения новых покупателей. Доходы от кредита Зульфия планирует использовать для развития своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Zulfiya is a 38-year-old single mother of two children. She has a high school education. Since 2007 her main income has been from selling women's and children's clothing at the market. She also has her own cafe which employs five people.

Zulfiya is known as a principled, honest, organized and hopeful person. She has a turnover of more than 200,000 KGS. Her average monthly profit is 20,000 KGS. She has regular customers both in her store and her cafe. For the future growth of her business, Zulfiya has asked Bai-Tushum Bank for a loan of 150,000 KGS to buy a broader assortment of clothes and attract new customers. She plans to use the extra income to grow her business.

loans.use: to purchase clothes for resale in order to increase the assortment in her shop and attract new customers.

loans.name: Romana

texts.en: Hello world! Meet Romana, a mother of four from Nandi Hills, a remote town in the Rift Valley province of Kenya. She has spent the past four years of her life farming. She sells eggs, milk, and vegetables produced on her farm. She also engages in personal business, to make ends meet. Romana is a go-getter and has a great desire to succeed in life. Of all the activities she involves herself in, poultry farming is closest to her heart. She enjoys waking up every morning to go and feed her animals. She is so close with her chickens that she has nicknamed one of them “Kipara,” meaning no feathers on the head. Lydia wants to take full advantage of poultry farming as a profitable business venture. She would like to expand her poultry business, but the biggest challenge she faces is lack of capital. She is requesting a loan of KES 20,000, which she will use to buy additional chickens. With your loan, Romana will be able to expand the poultry section on her farm. This will generate enough income to repay the loan, and she will also be able to save extra money. Romana is very concerned about her children’s education, so profits from farming will go to pay their school fees. Romana dreams of a secure future for her children. Romana awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy chickens

loans.name: Alejandra

texts.en:
Alejandra is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Alejandra is 53 years old now.

Alejandra has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. Alejandra requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional vegetables to sell.

Alejandra has been in this business for 4 years. In the future, Alejandra would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional vegetables to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build a bathroom, septic tank, and closet at her home.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es:
Hilda tiene 57 años de edad, es viuda, conocida en el medio por dedicarse a la crianza y venta de animales. Vive en casa propia con 02 nietos que estudian en colegio de la zona e hijo soltero que se dedica a trabajar como peón agricola. Hilda es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y familiares, pues sus vecinos indica que su familia es unida. Vive en una comunidad de clima caluroso dedicada a la agricultura, y ganadería. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Hilda se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores como cerdos y cuyes, desde hace más de 04 años aproximadamente. Necesita préstamo para invertir en arreglo de corrales, con el cual tendrá más seguridad para la crianza de sus animales, así como mejores condiciones para criarlos con una mejor calidad, lo que le permitirá venderlos a un mejor precio; y esto a su vez le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Hilda is 57 years old. She is a widow, known in her area for raising and selling animals. She has lived in her own house with 2 grandchildren. They go to high school in the area. She also lives with an unmarried son who is an agricultural worker. Hilda is a person with good family and work references. Her neighbors indicate that it is a close family. She lives in a community with a warm climate dedicated to agriculture and livestock. It is located in the district of Lagunas, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Hilda has raised and sold small animals such as pigs and guinea pigs for more than 4 years, approximately. She needs the loan to invest in repairing pens. With it she will have security for raising animals with better conditions to raise them with better quality. This will allow her to sell them at a better price, and then in the short term she will improve her income, increase her profits and therefore improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in repairing pens.

loans.name: Raila

texts.ru: Райла, 63 года, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные. У Райлы среднее образование, с 1971 года в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она занимается животноводством и полеводством. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Райлы на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы, 2 лошади и 10 овец. Также есть 1,60 ГА собственной земли, где Райла выращивает яблони и ячмень для внутрихозяйственного потребления и реализации. Ее ежемесячная прибыль составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). В целях увеличения своего бизнеса Райла обратилась в Банк «Бай–Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита Райла планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, она хочет построить еще сарай для скота.
texts.en:
Raila is 63 years old, and married with independent adult children. She has a high school education. Since 1971 most of her income for the family has come from raising livestock and farming. 

Through hard work, she has grown her business to consist of two cows, two horses and ten sheep. She also has 1.6 hectares of her own land where she grows apples and barley to feed her livestock and sell. 

Her monthly profit is about 15,000 KGS. She has asked for a loan of 50,000 from micro-finance bank Bai-Tushum to buy a dairy cow to expand her business. She plans to use the additional income to buy more domestic animals, and want to build another barn for the cattle.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow.

loans.name: Geoffrey

texts.en:
Geoffrey is 40 years old. He has a motorcycle transport business and has been in the business for five years. He is married and together with his spouse they have been blessed with five children.

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle and expand his business. He will use the anticipated profits to buy a plot of land.

This is his fifth loan term from VisionFund Kenya and he paid back his previous loans successfully. In the future he hopes to have a successful business and provide for his family and live a good life.

loans.use: To buy another motorcycle.

loans.name: Las Comprometidas Group

texts.es:
Rocio es una mujer de 25 años de edad, vive con su pareja, no tiene hijos, y su negocio es la venta de ropa.
Ella es independiente, constante, activa, responsable, y trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el comercio en todas las áreas y el crecimiento de su población por parte de indígenas Ayoreos del lugar y mineros relocalizados del occidente del país.
Rocio es de tez morena, estatura mediana, cabello negro largo, su lengua materna es el español y habla quechua por herencia familiar (al centro atrás, con polera a rayas verde y gris). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que también se dedica al comercio y viven en una habitación alquilada que cuenta con agua y electricidad.  Su deseo de superación la llevo a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; puesto de venta de comida, venta de licores, venta de chompas, tejido de ropa de bebe, venta de papas fritas, venta de ropa deportiva y carnicería, para solicitar un préstamo y cumplir sus metas. Su negocio es la venta de ropa, específicamente venta de pantalones de hombre, de vestir y también jeans. Esta es la primera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en tres años que viene realizando esta labor. Su negocio es exitoso debido al buen trato que ofrece a sus clientes y por la variedad de tallas y telas que tiene su negocio. Su sueño es tener su tienda propia en dos mercados, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de pantalones por mayor para aprovechar las fiestas de fin de año.
Es por esos motivos que Rocio solicita un préstamo para la compra de pantalones por mayor para aprovechar las ventas de fin de año.
texts.en:
Rocio is a 25 year old woman. She lives with her spouse and has no children. Her business is selling clothes. She is independent, stable, active, responsible, and hardworking. She runs her business in the area of ‘Plan 3000’, an area characterized by commerce of every type and the growth of the indigenous population of Ayoreos from the area and miners relocated from the eastern part of the county.
  
Rocio is dark skinned, medium height, and has long black hair. Her native language is Spanish and she speaks Quechua by family heritage. She is in the back and center, wearing a green and grey striped t-shirt. She lives her life with her spouse who is also works as a merchant. They lived in a rented room  that has water and electricity. Her desire to get ahead drover her to start a bank of people with businesses such as a food stall, selling liquor, selling sweaters, knitting baby's clothes, selling french fries, selling sports clothes and a butcher shop. They did it to ask for loans and meet their goals. Her business is selling clothes, specifically men's pants, both dress pants and jeans. This is her first cycle of loans with the institution in the three words that she has had her business. Her business is successful because of the good service she offers her customers and the variety of sizes and fabrics her business has. Her dream is to have her own store in two markets. She wants to expand her business by buying pants wholesale to take advantage of the end of year festivities. 

That is why Rocio is asking for a loan to buy pants wholesale to take advantage of the end of year sales.

loans.use: to buy pants wholesale to take advantage of the end of the year sales.

loans.name: Lorena Marilu

texts.es: Lorena de 47 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con su hija, ella se dedica a la venta de ropa para damas y caballeros y a la venta de ajo, se dedica a esta actividad desde hace varios años, y tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios con que vende sus productos, Lorena esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Lorena is 47 years old and is a single mother who lives in her own home with her daughter.  She works selling men's and women's clothing and selling garlic. She has been working in this field for several years.  She has lots of customers because of her good prices.  Lorena is asking for a loan in order to purchase merchandise in bulk so that she can obtain better income.

loans.use: To purchase clothing in bulk and garlic.

loans.name: Aigul

texts.ru: Айгул, 45 лет, замужем, вместе с супругом воспитывают 4 детей. У Айгул среднее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи она более 15 лет занимается торговлей женской обуви в собственном контейнере на рынке. Благодаря упорству, целеустремленности и трудолюбию Айгул, на сегодняшний день у нее есть товар в обороте на сумму 130,000 сом (KGS), также в хозяйстве держат 15 овец. Так как цена на продаваемую Айгул обувь ниже средней на рынке, возле ее прилавка всегда много клиентов, и продукция пользуется большим спросом. Ежемесячный доход Айгул составляет в хороший сезон до 30,000 сом (KGS). Айгул обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 130,000 сом (KGS) для покупки обуви, в целях расширения ассортимента и привлечения новых покупателей.  Айгул намерена и дальше развивать свой бизнес, расширить торговую точку и накопить средства на строительство дома.
texts.en: Aigul is 45 years old and married.  She and her husband are raising four children.  She has the equivalent of a high school education.  For more than 15 years now, she has been selling women's shoes from her own container at the market.  Through perseverance, dedication and hard work, her inventory is currently worth 130,000 som (KGS).  In addition, she has a small farming business and raises 15 sheep.  Since she sells her shoes at a price lower than the average market price, many customers come to her retail outlet and her goods are in high demand.  During a good season, Aigul makes a monthly income of up to 30,000 som (KGS).  She has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 130,000 som.  She will use her loan to buy shoes in order to increase her inventory and attract new customers.  Aigul is eager to further grow her business, expand her retail outlet, and save enough money to build a house.

loans.use: to purchase shoes for resale in order to increase her inventory and attract new customers.

loans.name: Suyapa Carolina

texts.es: Suyapa, tiene 25 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre y un hermano en un sector de Cofradía, Cortes. Suyapa estuvo trabajando en una tienda y cuando quedo sin empleo decidió establecer su pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como azúcar, arroz, frijoles, harina, condimentos, papel higiénico, carnes, churros, manteca, huevos, embutidos, dulces y otros. Esta pulpería la tiene hace dos años de donde  obtiene sus propios ingresos. El préstamo que ha solicitado es por 5,000 lempiras y los va invertir en la compra de manteca, huevos, pan, embutidos, arroz, azúcar y frijoles. Así  podrá aumentar el inventario y ofrecer variedad de productos para aumentar las ventas. Su sueño es llegar a tener una abarrotería grande.
texts.en: Suyapa is 25 years old. She is single and lives with her mother and brother in the Cofradía area of Cortes. Suyapa was working in a store and when she lost her job she decided to open her own store to sell staple products such as sugar, rice, beans, flour, seasonings, toilet paper, meats, churros, lard, eggs, deli meats, candies and more. She has had this store for two years and it is where she obtains her own income. The loan she  has asked for is for 5,000 lempiras and she is going to invest it in buying lard, eggs, bread, deli meats, rice, sugar and beans. This way, she can increase her inventory and offer a variety of products to increase the sales. Her dream is to have a bigger store.

loans.use: to buy lard, eggs, bread, deli meats, rice, sugar, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Herminda Yaneth

texts.es: Herminda, tiene 25 años de edad, esta soltera, vive con su madre y tres hermanos y reside en el Municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Hace tres años ella decidió tener su propio negocio para generar ingresos y ayudar a su madre y hermanos, desde entonces elabora y vende pan casero como es la semita de maíz, torta de leche y quesadilla. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo con la institución y es por 3,000 lempiras, con el cual va comprar harina, manteca, margarina, huevos, leche,azúcar y leña para elaborar el pan y vender, esta venta la realiza de manera ambulante de casa en casa. Su idea es tener siempre capital de trabajo y continuar con el negocio porque con las ganancias va ayudar a terminar la casa a su madre.
texts.en:
Herminda is 25 years old and is single.  She lives with her mother and three siblings and they reside in the city of Morazán.  Three years ago she decided to open her own business in order to generate income and help her mother and siblings.  Since then she has been making an selling homemade foods such as "semita de maíz" (a homemade Honduran cornbread), "torta de leche" (Milk cake) and quesadillas.  

She is asking for her second loan from Kiva and it is for 3,000 lempiras (Honduran currency).  She will use it to buy flour, butter, margarine, eggs, milk, sugar and firewood in order to make and sell her breads and foods.  She sells her items from a cart and goes house to house.  Her ideas is to have capital for her business and to continue to grow since her income will help her finish her mother's home.

loans.use: to buy flour, butter, margarine, eggs, milk, sugar and firewood in order to make and sell her breads and foods.

loans.name: Ederlyn

texts.en:
Ederlyn is 49 years old and has four children. She is a married woman with two children who are in school.

Ederlyn is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines and requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Ederlyn has been raising pigs for nine years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Ederlyn would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia is a married woman. She has two children, who are 3 and 8 years old. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells onions, cabbages, potatoes, tomatoes, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area. She will use the 50,000 KES loan to buy more inventory of groceries. Her business goal is to be a supplier of green groceries within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy groceries to resell so she can pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Selfa

texts.en:
Selfa is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house with neither electricity nor running water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past seven years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuffs of maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbors and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Selfa dreams of establishing a wholesale shop in the future.

With the Kshs 50,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Klara

texts.ru: Клара, 54 года, замужем, есть пятеро детей. У Клары среднее образование, с 1994 года она занимается сельским хозяйством. У нее в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 12 овец, 2 лошади, 6 коз. Ежемесячный доход Клары составляет около 7,000 сом (KGS). Она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 40,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Клара планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса, так же она мечтает освоить новый вид деятельности - открыть шашлычную.
texts.en:
Klara is a married 54-year-old woman with five children. She has a high school education, and has been farming since 1994. She has three cows, 12 sheep, two horses and six goats. 

Her monthly income is about 7,000 KGS. Klara has asked micro-finance bank Bai-Tushum for a loan of 40,000 KGS to buy ten sheep to increase the number of livestock. She plans to use the income from her business to invest in its further growth. She also dreams of starting a new venture: a kebab business.

loans.use: to buy ten sheep.

loans.name: Phanna

texts.en:
Sovan (shown in the photo) is 19 years old, single and living with his family. 

He is a student, now in the first semester of his second year towards earning a bachelor's degree at the Royal University of Law and Economics in Tourism. He would like to apply for a loan for pay his school fees.

Sovan will graduate November 25, 2017. He hopes that after graduation, he will become a manager of a hotel in the future.

loans.use: To pay for his school fees.

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 19-year-old single man from Gaza City. He lives with his family in a very simple house. His father is a teacher in a public school where he earns a low income. This income barely covers all the family's needs. 

Mahmoud is a student in his second year where he studies Information Technology. He would like to get a BA degree and find a job in the future. 

Mahmoud took a loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy a new laptop for his studies. By taking this loan, Mahmoud will be able to do his homework and write papers easily. Mahmoud appears in the photo.

loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his studies.

loans.name: Kalbuu

texts.ru: Калбуу 49 лет, замужем, мать 3 детей. У Калбуу - средне-специальное образование, с 2010 года занимается животноводством. Благодаря упорному труду Калбуу, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 2 коровы и 8 овец. Она очень трудолюбивая и отзывчивая, знает, как использовать средства по назначению и как правильно развить свой бизнес. Ежемесячный доход Калбуу составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Калбуу обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 12 овец и сена для скота. Кредит поможет Калбуу увеличить поголовье скота и получить здоровый приплод. Доходы от кредита Калбуу будет вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kalbuu is 49 years old, married, and the mother of three children.  She has a specialized secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry since 2010.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently owns two cows and eight sheep.  She is very hardworking and responsible, and she knows how to invest her money properly and how to grow her business.  She makes a monthly income of close to 10,000 som (KGS).  Eager to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 100,000 som (KGS).  She will use her loan to buy 12 sheep and some hay for her livestock.  This loan will enable Kalbuu to increase her cattle headcount and breed more healthy animals.  She will reinvest her income from this loan into further developing her farming business.

loans.use: to purchase 12 sheep and some hay to feed her livestock.

loans.name: Gagik

texts.en:
Gagik is 50 years old and he lives with his nice family in the city of Vanadzor in the Lori region. His wife is unemployed and his two sons are still school-age. Gagik is highly educated and for 7 years he worked as an engineer-programmer.

Six years ago, Gagik tried his luck in the (gold) jewelry trade. As a result, he has been busy with his business in Vanadzor’s jewelry market at a rented stall. He sells rings, bracelets, and earrings. He also sells crosses and medallions, which he buys from the local jewelers in the city of Yerevan. One of his business challenges is seasonality. For example, there are fewer weddings at the end of autumn and more during the New Year’s holidays. So there are periods when he has very little income from his business, which results in him being unable to keep his stall full of stylish and fashionable jewelry.

He is now seeking this loan through Kiva in the amount of $1,500. With the loan proceeds, he plans on purchasing new, fashionable gold jewelry to expand his stall’s assortment of jewelry.

loans.use: to increase his stall's inventory by purchasing new, fashionable gold jewelry

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah is a 20-year-old university student majoring in Religion Assets, and she is in her third year. She lives with her family that consists of six members in Mafraq, Jordan. Her father is a retired man. Sarah is seeking to expand her studies until she gets her Master's degree in the future. Because she currently doesn't have enough money to pay for her upcoming semester fees, she has applied for this loan.

loans.use: To pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Rafael Edgardo

texts.es: Rafael de 30 años de edad posee un taller de costura desde hace 6 años ubicado en su lugar de residencia, cose especialmente forros para instrumentos musicales y ya tiene clientes establecidos que lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo y los buenos precios, vive en casa propia con su esposa y su madre, el esta solicitando un crédito para la compra de variedad de tela y espuma para continuar con su trabajo y asi poder tener mejores ingresos y una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en: For 6 years, Rafael, who is 30 years old, has had a sewing workshop in his residence. He especially sews covers for musical instruments, and he already has established customers who seek him because of the quality of his work and his good prices. He lives in his own house with his wife and his mother. He is applying for a loan to purchase a variety of fabric and foam in order to continue with his work and thus be able to have better income and a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fabric and foam

loans.name: Violet

texts.en:
Violet is a 42-year-old woman married to Dominic, who adds additional income to support their family and they are blessed with four children. Violet has been operating a retail business shop for a period of six years, earning herself an income of KES 10,000 at the end of every month.

Violet is now servicing her second loan of KES 20,000 and intends to use the entire amount to buy sugar, rice, milk, bread, wheat flour, maize flour and detergents to add to the current stock which is running out.

Violet plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and hopes to have a bright future and maintain a stable family.

loans.use: To buy sugar, rice, milk, bread, wheat flour, maize flour and detergents

loans.name: Leyli

texts.en:
Leyli lives in the frontier village of Azatamut in the Tavush region. She now lives alone, since her husband and daughter temporally live and work in the Russian Federation. For a long time, Leyli worked as an engineer, then as a mathematics teacher at the village school. Now her only occupation is her small shop where she sells a great assortment of food and household goods. She likes her business, which greatly developed after her first deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon, and thanks to which she managed to solve many financial needs of her family.

This will be Leyli’s second Kiva loan. The first loan she had three years ago, for which she is thankful, and she hopes her second loan will bring as much profit as the first one. By selling a great range of beverages, food, sweets, confectionery and many household goods in her shop over several years, Leyli managed to keep her regular customers and also made a number of new customers.  

Leyli asks for a loan in an amount of 600,000 Armenian drams (AMD) in order to refresh her shop’s assortment so to buy new assortment of candies and sweets, juices, sausages and also household products.

loans.use: to buy a new assortment of candies, sweets, juices, sausages and also household products

loans.name: Ma. Teresa

texts.en:
Ma. Teresa is 50 years old and married. She has three children and works very hard to provide for them.

Ma. Teresa has been raising pigs for nine years in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 7,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. This is her third loan from NWTF.

In the future, Ma. Teresa would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Joice

texts.en:
Meet Joice, a 25-year-old woman from Nandi hills, Kenya. She has two lovely children: one cute boy and one adorable girl.

To earn a living, she works as a dairy farmer She has been a dairy farmer for seven years now. Her primary source of income is milk, eggs, tea and veggies.

Joice is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders via Juhudi Kilimo to pay for poultry. This new venture will enable her to diversify her product portfolio and to help her manage the risks resulting from her single (dairy) product line. With poultry, she will be able to sell eggs and other poultry products in the market to boost her income. The income will help her pay the high costs of inputs that have given her sleepless nights in the past. She loves farming and she aspires to keep growing her business. She appreciates Juhudi Kilimo and its partners for being supportive to small farmers like her and for making financial loans to farmers affordable. She plans to keep leveraging her business to grow her farm and improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: To expand her business by purchasing poultry

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 21-year-old single man living with his eight family members in Irbid, Jordan. 

He is a university student majoring in Computer Science, now in his third year. His father works at a dessert shop with one of his brothers. Mohammad is looking for a job in his field after getting his bachelor's degree to support his family. 

Now he needs to buy books and to pay for his upcoming semester fees. But because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.name: Urinsa

texts.ru: Уринса, 56 лет, вдова, есть 3 детей. У Уринсы - средне-специальное образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, она с 1998 года занимается животноводством и полеводством. У Уринсы в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 5 овец и 1,0 Га собственной земельной доли, где Уринса выращивает пшеницу, кукурузу и чеснок для реализации. Благодаря упорному труду Уринсы и ее дружных детей, бизнес приносит ежемесячную прибыль в размере примерно 10,000 сом (KGS), однако этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь и содержание семьи. Поэтому, в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Уринса обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Увеличение поголовья позволит развить ее бизнес и увеличить доходы семьи. Доходы от кредита Уринса планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Urinsa is 56 years old, a widow, and the mother of three children.  She has a specialized secondary education and has been involved in animal husbandry and crop farming since 1998.  These two activities constitute her family's main source of income.  She currently owns four cows, five sheep and one hectare of land on which she grows wheat, corn and garlic for resale.  Thanks to her very hard work and to her children's help, her farming business brings her a monthly income of about 10,000 som (KGS).  However, this amount of money is not sufficient for a decent living and to provide for the family.  For this reason, and eager to further develop her farming business, Urinsa has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy livestock.  An increase in her livestock headcount will allow her to grow her business and to increase the family's income.  Urinsa is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock in order to increase her herd and her income.

loans.name: Nachiro

texts.en:
Nachiro is a married woman, and she has three children. She describes herself to be God-fearing. 

Nachiro operates a retail business where she sells snacks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are loyal. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transportation. 

Nachiro will use the KES 35,000 loan to buy more ingredients for preparing snacks. Her business goal is to own a hotel within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of ingredients.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients for preparing snacks

loans.name: Nelia

texts.en:
Nelia is a 55-year-old, married woman from Dulag, Leyte. She is a mother of five children. Her youngest child is 16 years old.

To earn a living, for three years now, she has been operating a sari-sari (variety) store. At her store, she sells basic household commodities, such as sugar, canned goods, rice, soft drinks, biscuits, cooking oil, eggs, and beverages. Aside from that, she raises and sells hogs as an additional source of income.

Nelia is seeking a loan in the amount of 15,000 PHP to buy a variety of goods for the store, two additional pigs, and pig feed. With these additional goods and animals, she could better satisfy her customers' needs, which in turn will enable her to raise and sell more pigs in the future. Nelia is hoping that the loan proceeds will help her have a more profitable business so that she can send her youngest child to college.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing a variety of goods for her store, two additional pigs, and pig feed

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Catherine is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself as someone who is very focused and who is a visionary.

To earn a living, she operates a farm, where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile and productive place and her primary customers are individuals. She explains that her biggest business challenge is price fluctuation.

She is seeking this loan in the amount of 40,000 KES to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to be a more successful farmer within five years. She hopes that, in the future, she will be very successful. She will use the anticipated profits resulting from this loan to reinvest in the business.

loans.use: to expand and improve her farming operations by purchasing farm inputs

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 32 years old and has five children. Four of her children are in school.

Gina is in the agricultural business in the Philippines.

Gina is requesting a loan in the amount of 9,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs. Gina has been a member of NWTF for one year now, and has borrowed two loans from NWTF in the past to sustain her business. In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to expand and improve her business by purchasing feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Ruth, 29 years of age, a very hardworking, honest, and dedicated farmer who lives in Nyakoe, a remote village in Kisii. She is happily married and is blessed with three adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last five years and has gained so much experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and varieties of food crops from her farmland. 

To make ends meet and to make extra cash, Ruth has been engaging in another small personal business. The Kisii area is very populated, and the demand for poultry products and eggs is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds poultry farming very enjoyable, and she stated that the most enjoyable part about poultry farming is “the increased profits.” Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand that is really high. She lacks funds to increase her poultry farming, and she is seeking a loan of 15,000 KES to buy poultry. 

Being a woman accessing funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, Ruth feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more poultry. As a result of the loan, she will sell eggs and poultry products to her neighbors and to the local market, which will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and to expand her poultry market to other markets, which will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently changing her living conditions and securing the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy poultry

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase more home appliances, furniture and other retail goods to resell to her customers door to door.

loans.name: Mwanamwaka

texts.en:
Mwanamwaka is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has operated a food kiosk business, selling food stuff like maize flour and cooking fat to her neighbours and passersby. She mentioned the high cost of seasonality as her major challenge. Mwanamwaka dreams of establishing a restaurant in the future.

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase maize flour, rice, beans, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Kulmairam

texts.ru: Кулмайрам, 57 лет, замужем, дети взрослые, самостоятельные, только младший сын живет с Кулмайрам. У Кулмайрам среднее образование, она на протяжении многих лет занимается сельским хозяйством, начав этот бизнес в 1998 году почти с нуля. На сегодняшний день прибыль Кулмайрам составляет около 20,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. У нее в хозяйстве есть 1 корова, 2 теленка, также на земельном наделе мерою 3,0 ГА она выращивает картофель и фасоль, экологически чистую, вкусную продукцию, она реализует оптовым покупателям. Помимо этого Кулмайрам занимается швейным производством национальной одежды и одеял. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кулмайрам обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку удобрения для обработки земли, где посажена фасоль и топлива на полеводческие нужды. Доходы от кредита Кулмайрам планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulmairam is 57 years old and married.  Her children are adults and living independently.  Only her youngest son still lives at home.  Kulmairam has the equivalent of a high school education and she has been involved in agriculture for many years, having started in 1998, practically from scratch.  She currently makes an income of about 20,000 som (KGS) per month.  She owns one cow and two calves, and she also grows potatoes and beans on three hectares of land.  She harvests organic and delicious crops and sells them to wholesale buyers.  In addition, Kulmairam also sews traditional Tajik clothes and blankets.  Eager to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 50,000 som (KGS).  She will use this loan to buy fertilizers to prepare her land for the cultivation of beans and to purchase fuel needed for farm work.  She is planning to reinvest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and fuel needed for farm work, in order to grow organic beans.

loans.name: Rasoa

texts.en:
Rasoa is 26 years old, married and together with her spouse they have been blessed with four children. She runs a retail shop and has been in this business for five years. Right now her monthly income is KES 30,000.

She will be using this loan to buy more stock of sugar, cooking oil, flour and cereals to sell in her business. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children and also expand her business.

This is her second loan term with VisionFund Kenya and she paid back her previous loan successfully. Her future hopes are to expand her business and get more income.

loans.use: to buy cereals, sugar and cooking oil to sell.

loans.name: Martha

texts.es: Martha de 48 años de edad y vive en casa propia con su compañero de vida y sus dos hijos, ella posee desde hace 5 años una pequeña tienda ubicada en su lugar de residencia, tiene muchos clientes por los buenos precios y la amabilidad que tiene a la hora de vender, ella está solicitando un crédito para poder comprar más sopas, huevos, granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, pan dulce, etc. y así poder tener mejores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Martha, 48 years old, lives in a house she owns with her life companion and their two children. She has had a small store in her home for five years. She has many customers due to her good prices and her friendly demeanor as a salesperson. 

She is requesting a loan to purchase soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet buns, etc. Thus she will be able to earn more income for a better quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase more soups, eggs, basic grains, soft drinks, candy, sweet buns, etc.

loans.name: Gumercindo

texts.es:
Gumercindo, tiene 39 años de edad, es casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en una comunidad del Municipio de  Gracias, Lempira.
Gumercindo se dedica a la agricultura, especificamente, a la produccion y venta de cafe. El cual comercializa en pergamino y seco en el mercado local, y se lo pagan a buen precio. Tiene once años dedicado a esta actividad que desde entonces le ha generado los ingresos que ha necesitado para el sostenimiento de su familia.Lleva 4 prestamos consecutivos con Odef, y solicita el quinto ciclo para compra de fertilizante y pago de mano de obra para siembra de manzana y media de café. Esta inversion le ayudara a mantener sus cultivos libre de plagas mejorando así la cosecha y los ingresos. El plan a futuro que tiene es primero terminar una casa que esta haciendo para su hijo mayor y ayudar a los otros dos hijos con sus estudios.
texts.en:
Gumercindo is 39 years old, married and has 3 children. He lives in a community in the municipality of Gracias, Lempira.

Gumercindo earns his living in agriculture, specifically, the production and sale of coffee. He sells the coffee dried and in the husk at the local market, and he gets a good price for it. He has been in this business for 11 years and during that time, it has generated the income he's needed to support his family. 

He has had 4 consecutive loans with Odef, and is applying for a fifth in order to buy fertilizer and pay the laborers to plant a "manzana" and a half of coffee. This investment will help him to maintain his crops pest-free and will improve his harvest and income. 

His plan for the future is to first finish the house he is building for his eldest son and to help his other 2 children with their studies.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to plant a "manzana" and a half of coffee.

loans.name: Oliver

texts.es:
Oliver es un joven muy alegre y entusiasta, tiene 20 años de edad, es soltero y vive en Lima junto a su familia. Desde hace varios años trabaja como promotor de ventas en una empresa. Él cree que le está yendo bien porque siempre se esfuerza en todo lo que hace y sobre todo porque lee bastante, temas en ventas para poder mejorar cada día. También está estudiando la carrera de Administración porque más adelante quiere convertirse en un excelente profesional
Oliver tiene muchas ganas de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, por ello piensa utilizar el crédito para arreglar la fachada de su casa y así su familia se sienta más cómoda viviendo en ella. Él está muy agradecido con los prestamistas Kiva por su generosidad, ya que con esto brindará mayor bienestar a sus seres queridos  y seguirá trabajando tranquilo y así más adelante espera graduarse con honores.
texts.en:
Oliver is a very cheerful and enthusiastic young man of 20. He is single and lives in Lima with his family. He has worked for several years as a sales marketer at a company.  He believes things are going well because he always does his best in everything he does and especially because he reads quite a lot–books about selling so that he can improve every day. He is also studying for degree in administration because someday he wants to become an excellent professional. 

Oliver is very eager to improve his family's quality of life and that is why he intends to use the loan to fix the façade of their home so his family can feel more comfortable living in it. 

He is very grateful to the Kiva lenders for their generosity, as this way he will provide greater well-being for his loved ones and will continue working with peace of mind. Someday he hopes to graduate with honors.

loans.use: To do finishing work on his house.

loans.name: Nelly Priscila

texts.es: Nelly, tiene 30 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene una hija, reside en una aldea del Municipio de Quimistán, Santa Bárbara junto a su hermana y su hija. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio con la venta de mercadería. Hace 6 meses que ella estableció una pequeña pulpería para vender productos de la canasta básica familiar como es arroz, azúcar, pan, huevos, pastas, salsina, galletas, churros, dulces, harina, café, sal y otros abarrotes. También vende ropa para damas y caballeros. Ha decidido solicitar un préstamo por 21,000 Lempiras para surtir de productos como arroz, azúcar, manteca, huevos, margarina, refrescos, pan, productos de aseo, cereales, sal, café, harina, dulces, galletas, churros y otros, además compra de blusas, jeans y camisetas para vender. Tiene como plan mantener siempre su negocio estable para tener estabilidad económica con su familia.
texts.en: Nelly is 30 years old. She is a single mother with a daughter. She lives in a village in the township of Quimistán, Santa Barbara, along with her sister and her daughter. She has always worked in business by selling merchandise. Six months ago she established a little grocery store to sell products for the basic family food basket, such as rice, sugar, bread, eggs, pastas, salsas, crackers, churros (fried-dough pastries), sweets, flour, coffee, salt, and other groceries. She also sells clothing for women and men. She has decided to apply for a loan of 21,000 Lempiras in order to stock products such as rice, sugar, lard, eggs, margarine, soft drinks, bread, cleaning products, cereals, salt, coffee, flour, sweets, crackers, churros, and other items. In addition, she will buy blouses, jeans, and T-shirts to sell. She has as a plan to always keep her business stable in order to have economic stability with her family.

loans.use: to stock her store with basic grains, sugar, lard, eggs, margarine, soft drinks, bread, cleaning products, cereals, salt, coffee, flour, candies, and clothing to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 24 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de ropa de forma ambulante por los diferentes mercados tiene muchos clientes fijos por la calidad de la ropa y los buenos precios, la joven vive en casa propia con su madre, ella esta solicitando un crédito para la comprar de mas ropa por mayor para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi poder tener mejore ingresos.
texts.en:
This young woman sells clothing as a street vendor in the various markets. Her face is obscured in the photo because she is 24 years old and lives in a high-risk area. She has many steady customers because of the quality of the clothing and the good prices. She lives in her own home with her mother. 

She is requesting a loan so that she can buy more clothing at wholesale, be able to continue with her sales and have better income.

loans.use: To buy more clothing at wholesale.

loans.name: Nilo

texts.en:
Nilo is a fisherman from Dulag, Leyte. He catches fish and sells them to the people to the nearby towns. He is 46 years old and has seven children. The oldest child is 18 while the youngest is 3. 

Aside from fishing, he offers  boat rental  services. These are his sources of income. Despite the hard work, Nilo is still in need of capital to re fuel his livelihood. Nilo has requested a loan of 30,000 PHP to buy fishing net and to have additional capital for boat maintenance like paint  and fuel.  With these materials, he can now start his operation and improve his volume of catch.

Nilo dreams of expanding both of his  businesses to improve his living condition and also support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and pay for boat maintenance items like paint and fuel

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria has six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 50 years old and has two children who are in school.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Gloria requested a PHP 8,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy used clothes to sell like t-shirts, shorts, etc.

Gloria has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy used clothes to sell like t-shirts, shorts, etc.

loans.name: Estela De Jesus

texts.es: Estela, tiene 36 años de edad, esta casada, tiene 5 hijos y reside en el Municipio de Tocoa, Colon. Hace un año tres meses que inicio su propio negocio de pulpería donde vende productos de la canasta básica como es manteca, arroz, harina, huevos, frijoles, productos de aseo, Azúcar, refrescos, condimentos, churros, jabón, etc. Ha solicitado un préstamo por 15,000 lempiras para comprar mas productos como frijoles, arroz, manteca, huevos, refrescos, golosinas, churros, harina, productos de aseo, azúcar, pastas y otros abarrotes y mantener surtida la pulpería para obtener mejores ingresos. Su meta es hacer crecer el negocio, ayudar con la educación de sus hijos y tener mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Estela is 36 years old, married with 5 children and lives in the municipality of Tocoa, Colon. One year and 3 months ago, she started her own convenience store business where she sells basic pantry items, like lard, rice, flour, eggs, beans, cleaning products, sugar, soft drinks, condiments, donuts, soap, etc. 

She has requested a loan of 15,000 lempiras to buy more products, such as beans, rice, lard, eggs, soft drinks, sweets, donuts, flour, cleaning products, sugar, pasta and other groceries, to keep the convenience store well-stocked so she can get more income coming in. 

Her goal is to grow her business, help with the education of her children and have a better quality of life.

loans.use: To buy beans, flour, lard, rice, sugar, eggs, sweets, soft drinks, cleaning products and other groceries to sell.

loans.name: Erick Anibal

texts.es:
Erick de 32 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 1 hijo de 2 años de edad, logró estudiar hasta bachillerato, actualmente vive con su pareja y su hijo y solo ellos depende de él.

Erick es comerciante, tiene una panadería desde hace dos años, aprendió mientras estuvo en el extranjero y cuando regreso busco trabajar en lo que había aprendido, pero desde hace dos años fue que tomo la decisión de poner su propio negocio y con su pareja lo han sacado adelante.

El préstamo será utilizado para iniciar otro negocio de venta de frutas y verduras, la iniciativa nace de ver que en la ruta donde vende pan no hay mucha venta de estos productos, por lo que espera que le dé buenos resultados. Erick sueña con que su panadería le dé mejores ingresos junto al negocio que quiere iniciar,  para darle a su hijo el estudio completo.
texts.en:
Erick, who is 32 years old, has a partner and a two-year-old son. He was able to go to school through secondary school. He now lives with his partner and their son, and they are the only ones who depend on him.
