Erick is a businessman. He has had a bakery for two years. He learned this work while he was out of the country, and when he returned, he looked for work using what he had learned, but two years ago he decided to set up his own business, and with his partner they have made progress.

The loan will be used to begin another business of selling fruits and vegetables. The initiative came from seeing that on the route where he sells bread, there isn't much selling of these products. For this reason, he hopes that it will give him good results. Erick dreams that his bakery will give him better income, along with the business that he wants to begin, in order to give his son a complete education.

loans.use: to begin a business of selling fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a single woman. She has one child. She describes herself to be patient and tolerant. 

She operates a retail business where she sells rice, flour, sugar, milk, and fruits. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a shopping centre. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of funds. 

She will use the KES 75,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, fruits, and other items. Her business goal is to own a transport van within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own land. 

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour, fruits, and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study

loans.name: Dhe Ann

texts.en:
Dhe Ann is 22 and is still single. She resides at Dela PAz, Clarin with her family. 

She has been doing business for five years and is now starting in this retailing  of grocery goods in her new retail store. She took a new loan recently to purchase goods for her new store. 

While she is in the office, her mother looks over her store to take the responsibility of improving it. Her store is yet small as of now, but she wants to increase her sales by having more inventory stocks. She is hoping the with the help of GDMPC, her plan would be successful.

loans.use: to purchase goods for her new store

loans.name: Menge

texts.en:
Menge is a married man. He has seven children with ages ranging from 7 years to 25 years. He describes himself to be optimistic. 

He operates a retail business where he sells drinks. He has been involved in this business for 25 years. His business is located in a productive area and his primary customers are other business people. He describes his biggest business challenge to be limited space. 

He will use the KES 40,000 loan to rent more business space. His business goal is to own a depot within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: rent more business space

loans.name: Victor

texts.en:
Victor does motorcycle transport business in Eldoret town and has been in the business for two years now. He is 26 years old, married, and together with his spouse,  blessed with two children. 

He will use this loan to buy another motorcycle. He will use the anticipated profits to improve the business.

This is his first loan term from VisionFund Kenya. In future Victor hopes to have a prosperous business and live a good life.

loans.use: To buy another motorcyle.

loans.name: Marife

texts.en:
Marife is a 38-year-old married woman with three children who are all in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Marife has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Marife requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy containers of coconut wine to sell.

Marife has been in this business for 12 years. In the future, Marife would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
Mohammad is a 23-year-old university student majoring in law, and he is in his last year. He lives with his six family members in Baqaa-Jordan, and his father works at a governmental entity. 

Mohammad is seeking to improve his studies until he gets his bachelors' degree so that he will find a job with a good income. Now he is applying for this loan to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay  his study fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new laptop for his study.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.es:
Josefina de 53 años de edad, es viuda desde hace 15 años y tiene 2 hijos de 30 y 28 años de edad, por ser una familia de escasos recursos solo pudo estudiar hasta 5° grado de educación básica. Actualmente solo vive con una nieta de 10 años de edad.

Josefina tiene una granja de pollos con la venta de los animales puede solventar los gastos del hogar, per solicita el préstamo para iniciar una venta de tortilla y una tienda, comprara maíz, leña, cal hidratada, frijol, azúcar, arroz, productos de cocina e higiene personal para la tienda y demás, 
para tener ingresos más estables, continuos y generar más clientes. Su sueño, es que su nieta termine una carrera universitaria y no pase por las dificultades que paso ella.
texts.en:
Josefina, who is 53 years old, has been a widow for 15 years. She has two children, ages 30 and 28. Because she was from a family of scarce resources, she was only able to go to school through the 5th grade of basic education. She now lives with a 10-year-old granddaughter.

Josefina has a chicken farm. With the sale of the animals, she can pay the household expenses, but she is applying for the loan to begin selling tortillas and to set up a store. She will buy corn, firewood, hydrated lime, beans, sugar, rice, kitchen products, personal hygiene products, and other items for the store in order to have more stable and continuous income and to generate more customers. Her dream is to have her granddaughter complete a university program and not go through the difficulties that she went through.

loans.use: to buy corn, firewood, hydrated lime, beans, sugar, rice, kitchen products, personal hygiene products, and other items for her store

loans.name: Al- Assa'ar Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al- Assa'ar. It consists of four women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 200,000 YER from AMB.

Fathia is a 31-year-old married woman and a mother of two children, living in their own house. She lives with her family in a miserable condition. Fathia has an elementary education and works as a beautician in her house with small equipment and cosmetics. The profits from her business are not enough to cover the necessary expenses of her home, and she wants to enlarge her business, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. Therefore, she applied for a loan of 50,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase more cosmetics to work better and to attract a lot of customers.

Fathia looks forward to opening a beauty salon and to becoming a famous beautician.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics to attract more customers to her business

loans.name: Alma Aurora

texts.es:
La señora Alba, madre dedicada, casada, labora como docente en un colegio publico, con el apoyo de su esposo buscan la manera de salir adelante.
ella solicita este crédito para la compra de materiales de construcción, bloques, arena, cemento, hierro, para construir un cuarto ya que donde habita actualmente esta en pésimo estado, tiene revuelto la cocina con los cuartos y la sala y ella desea tener mejores condiciones para ella y su familia, Agradece a Kiva y Afodenic por este su primer crédito y desea que en el futuro seguir contando con el apoyo de nosotros.
texts.en:
Alma, dedicated mother and wife, works as a teacher in a public school. She has her husband's support, and together they are looking for a way to get ahead. She requests this loan to purchase construction materials such as blocks, sand cement and iron to build a room. The place where they are currently living is in terrible shape, the kitchen and rooms and living room are all jumbled together, and Alma wants better conditions for herself and her family.

She thanks Kiva and Afodenic for this first loan, and hopes to continue receiving our support in the future.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a variety of clothing items.

loans.name: Carmelo

texts.es:
El señor Carmelo de  47  años de edad, vive con su esposa, tiene  03 hijos  que depende de él y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 06 años  al negocio de la venta de maíz, maicillo.
Don Carmelo sus clientes son las pulperías y personas que se dedica a la venta de estos productos, es un hombre trabajador y con deseos de salir adelante, también renta un carro para vender verduras de Tegucigalpa a los lugares de afuera de la ciudad.
Don Carmelo está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de maíz, frijoles, arroz, etc. con el apoyo de este crédito desea salir adelante y poder seguir apoyando a su familia, es un buen cliente con varios ciclos de trabajar con Prisma, uno de  sus sueño es mejor su casa y tener un mejor negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Carmelo is 47 years old. He has his own home and lives with his wife and has three dependent children. They live in the community of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. 

For the past six years he has been in the business of selling corn and sorghum. His clients are the people who sell such items and the small neighborhood stores. Carmelo is a hardworking man and, with ambitions to get ahead, also rents a car to sell vegetables from Tegucigalpa to the areas around the city.

He requests this loan to purchase corn, beans, rice and other products. With the support of this loan he hopes to get ahead and continue supporting his family. Carmelo is a good client and has been working with Prisma for various loan cycles. One of his greatest dreams is to improve his house and to have a larger business.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras -  October 2014.

loans.use: to purchase items such as corn, beans and rice.

loans.name: Felix

texts.es:
Félix de 44 años de edad, solo pudo estudiar hasta 3° grado de educación básica, por problemas económicos en su familia tuvo que dejar la escuela. Está casado y tiene 4 hijos de 22, 20, 16 y 13 años de edad, los dos mayores trabajan y los dos menores estudian bachillerato y 7° grado de educación básica  respectivamente.

Félix a los 16 años tomo la decisión de ingresar a la fuerza armada, ya se retiró hace 11 años, actualmente trabajo como chofer de una ruta de buses, y en sus tiempos libres hace viajes con su vehículo. También se especializo en mecánica automotriz, con su esposa tienen una pupuseria pero que la abren eventualmente porque él tiene problemas de salud.

El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para hacer unas reparaciones a su vehículo con el que hace viajes para seguir dando este tipo de servicios y tener algún ingreso para la familia. Félix sueña con tener su propio taller de mecánica automotriz para dedicarse completamente a este negocio.
texts.en:
Félix, 44 years old, was only able to attend school to the third grade due to his family’s economic problems, which forced him to leave school. He is married and has four children, who are 22, 20, 16 and 13 years old. The two older ones work and the two younger ones are in high school and the 7th grade, respectively.

When Félix was 16 he decided to join the armed forces and retired 11 years ago. Currently he works as a driver for a bus route.  In his free time he makes longer trips in his vehicle.  He also specializes in auto mechanics. Moreover, he and his wife have a small store,  however they only open  occasionally because he has health problems.

The loan that he is requesting will be used to make some repairs to his vehicle so that he can continue making trips and continue providing this type of service and earning more income for his family. 

Félix dreams of having his own auto mechanic shop so he can dedicate himself completely to this business.

loans.use: to make some repairs on his vehicle.

loans.name: Reynaldo

texts.en:
Reynaldo is a fish vendor residing in Dulag, Leyte. He is  53 year old and a father of four children who are 19, 16,12 and 8 years old. He sells fresh fish to earn  a living. Because of limited capital to fully operate his business, Reynaldo has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP to buy a variety of  fresh fish and pedicab (a pedal-operated tricycle). With the additional capital, he can buy and sell more fish and cater to more customers. It is also a big help especially in transporting his stock to his customers.

In the future, Reynaldo would like to expand his business to support the education of his children.

loans.use: to buy a variety of  fresh fish and a pedicab (a pedal-operated tricycle)

loans.name: Nilda

texts.en:
Nilda is 51 years old and has three children. She is a married woman.

Nilda is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Nilda has been in this business for three years now, and has borrowed 10 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Nilda would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Rosaline

texts.en: As a mother of two children, the great desire to see them all grow up to be professionals is what fills Rosaline with enthusiasm and inspiration. Rosaline is 37 years old and works tirelessly to raise animals. Through these humble tasks, she aspires to offer all of her children a university education. Rosaline learned to do farm work at a young age, thanks to her parents. She has a tiny plot of land to live off – just under half an acre – and has always struggled to support her family. She has developed the farm in the sloping undulating terrain by successfully adopting suitable soil and water conservation methods such as stone pitched bench terracing and digging rain water storage pits. For over five years, her income source has been from selling milk and poultry. She supplements the meager income by doing other business. Rosaline passionately loves dairy farming. Milking and feeding her own cow is the most enjoyable part about farming. She is very appreciative that dairy farming has been able to sustain farmers in her village. Profits from milk sales have enabled her to take care of her family, and she wants her cows to produce more milk. That is why she is seeking a loan to buy animal feed. With this animal feed, her cows will be able to increase milk production, which will translate to increased income. She believes that through careful selection and the application of the strict standard of excellence in keeping her dairy cow, she will have more income, which will improve her living standards.

loans.use: to buy animal feed

loans.name: Angela

texts.en:
Angela is 35 years old and married with six children. With four of her children currently in school, Angela works very hard to provide for them.

Angela runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, etc. to sell.

She has been in this business for six years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, cooking oil, etc. 

In the future, Angela would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like detergent soap, shampoo, candies, biscuits, noodles, and cooking oil to sell

loans.name: Basilia

texts.en:
As a married parent of six children, Basilia works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and earns additional income from her general store and fishing.  Basilia is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food vending business.

Basilia has been sustaining her business activities through her past 10 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Rosalina

texts.en:
Rosalina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Rosalina is 25 years old and has three children who are in school.

Rosalina has a coconut wine vending business in the Philippines. Rosalina requested a PHP 6,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell.

Rosalina has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rosalina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional containers of coconut wine to sell

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Ana Maria is 37 years old and both of her children are in school.

Ana Maria has a buy and sell of scrap materials business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more scrap materials to sell.

Ana Maria has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more scrap materials to sell

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Riza

texts.en:
Riza, age 28, is a merchant running a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells basic household commodities like bread, sugar, eggs, soap, toothpaste, cooking oil, and canned goods. She has been operating her variety store for just six months now. She has a seven-year-old son. She lives with her family in Dulag, Leyte. Her husband works as a laborer. 

In order to meet the family's daily expenses, Riza has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP to buy a refrigerator and assorted stock for the store. With these, Riza can improve her livelihood and support the education of her child.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator and assorted stocks for the store

loans.name: Cattleyas Group

texts.es:
Ruthi es una mujer de 48 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene tres hijos de 27, 23  y 14 años, y su negocio es la venta de gaseosas.
Ella es emprendedora, buena madre, trabajadora y responsable. Su trabajo lo realiza en la zona ‘plan 3000’ un sitio caracterizado por el crecimiento de su población por tribus ayoreas del lugar y mineros relocalizados de occidente que se asentaron en el lugar, de clima tropical con una temperatura constante entre 27-32 grados centígrados durante todo el año.
Ruthi es de tez morena, cabello negro corto, su lengua materna es el español y habla quechua por herencia familiar (segunda de la izquierda, vestido floreado). Su vida la realiza con su pareja que se dedica a la construcción y sus dos hijos menores, el mayor ya es independiente, vive en una casa  de ladrillo  alquilada que cuenta con electricidad y agua potable. Su deseo de superación la llevó a formar una banca de personas con negocios como; tienda de videos, venta de sándwiches, artesanía en yeso, venta de refrescos, librería y venta de productos cosméticos, para solicitar un préstamo y ampliar sus negocios. Su negocio es la venta de gaseosas en puesto fijo, debido al clima del lugar sus gaseosas tiene mucha demanda, actualmente ella compra hielo a diario y mantiene fresco su producto en una conservadora. Esta es la tercera secuencia de préstamos con la institución en cuatro años de experiencia en el negocio. Su sueño es abrir una agencia de gaseosas para vender por mayor y menor. Ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una heladera, donde pueda tener sus productos frescos para satisfacción del cliente y ahorraría en la compra de hielo, tiempo y dinero. 
Es por esos motivos que Ruthi solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para ampliar su negocio y complacer a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Ruthi is 48 years old. She lives with her partner and has three children who are 27, 23, and 14 years old. She has a business selling soft drinks.

She is enterprising, a good mother, hardworking, and responsible. She works in the "Plan 3000" neighborhood, an area characterized by the growing population of indigenous Ayorea people and relocated miners from the west that have settled in the area. The climate is tropical, with an average temperature of 27-32 degrees centigrade year round. 

Ruthi has short black hair. Her first language is Spanish and she speaks Quechua because of her family's heritage (she is the second from the right, in the dress with flowers on it). She lives with her partner, who works in construction, and their two younger children. The oldest is already independent. She lives in a rented brick house that has electricity and running water. Her desire to get ahead led her to start a communal bank with members who have businesses such as: a video store, selling sandwiches, plaster artworks, soft drinks, stationary store, and cosmetics sales. She did this so they all could request loans and and expand their businesses.

Her business sells soft drinks from her store. Because of the climate of the area, there is a lot of demand for her soft drinks. She currently buys ice every day and keeps her products cold in a cooler. This is her third loan cycle with the institution in four years of experience with the business. Her dream is to open a soft drink distribution business so she can sell wholesale. She wants to grow her business through the purchase of  a refrigerator, where she can keep her products cool so her customers will be satisfied and so she can save money from not buying ice, and have more time and money.

It is for these reasons that Ruthi is requesting a loan, to buy a refrigerator to expand her business and keep her clients happy.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator to expand her business and keep her clients happy.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.en:
Carlota is a 31-year-old married woman with three children, two of whom are currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carlota has a general store business in the Philippines. Carlota has requested a loan of 18,000 PHP through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store. Carlota has been in this business for 15 years. 

In the future, Carlota would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
Jessica is a resident of Carles, Iloilo. She is a young mother of two children aged five and two. 

For a few years now she has helped her husband in their fishing business. They work hard together to provide for their family. 

Jessica is asking for a loan to buy an engine, fishing nets, plywood, nails, adhesive and crab traps. She hopes to have a better and more stable income so she can prepare for her children's future needs. 

Any profit will be used to buy food for her family, pay for school fees and reinvest in the same business.

loans.use: to buy an engine, fishing nets, plywood, nails, adhesive and crab traps

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 50 years old. He is married to Gladys and together they have been blessed with six children aged between 20 and 6 years old.

George sells cereals, and this is a business he has done for the last 10 years, earning a monthly income of KES 20,000.

George has requested his first loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 20,000 which he will use to buy different kinds of dried cereals like maize, beans, cow peas and lentils to sell. Most of these cereals are dried and then ground in his posho mill for clients who prefer them as flour. 

With the anticipated profits from his business, George will be able to expand his business further as well as repay his loan.

His hope and dream for the future is to grow his business.

loans.use: to buy cereals

loans.name: Fabiola

texts.en:
Fabiola's family live in Carles, Iloilo. In this town, seafood is abundant and most people find their source of livelihood through fishing and catching crabs.

Fabiola and her husband have been working in this same business for 37 years now. Fabiola is asking for a loan to buy a motor engine and four bundles of fishing nets, and to pay for hired help. 

Fabiola is 57 years old and she hopes that her fishing business will allow her to continue supporting her two children's schooling. They are aged 13 and 17. 

In addition, she dreams of saving for her old age.

loans.use: to buy a motor engine and four bundles of fishing nets, and to pay for hired help

loans.name: Divina

texts.en:
Divina hails from a town called Carles in Iloilo. She is 32 years old and married with two children aged six and eight. 

Divina has owned and operated a sari-sari (variety) store business to provide for her family for nine years now. In her store she sells basic household goods like canned goods, rice, soft drinks, gasoline, condiments, seasoning and toiletries. 

She is requesting a loan to buy crude oil, gasoline, biscuits, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and condiments. Divina knows the value of on-time stock replenishment so she can maximize her profit, and the loan will serve this purpose. 

Any income will be used for school fees, food and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy crude oil, gasoline, biscuits, canned goods, toiletries, seasoning and condiments

loans.name: Rhea

texts.en:
Rhea is the wife of a fisherman. She and her family are from the municipality of Carles in Iloilo. 

Rhea learned fishing and she has been helping her husband in their business for seven years now. She is asking for a loan to buy bamboo, ropes and crab traps to further improve their source of livelihood. 

She works hard for her children who are aged 1, 3 and 6, and any income will be used for their schooling and healthy diet.  

Rhea hopes to see her children successful someday.

loans.use: to buy bamboo, ropes and crab traps

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Issa est né vers1970 à Nimporodioula, père de 11 enfants, marié, il réside chez lui-même avec son épouse dans une famille traditionnelle à Médine un quartier populaire de la ville de Sikasso. 
Monsieur Issa mène des activités d’achat et de vente de céréales  il ya plus de 16 ans, il s'approvisionne dans les marchés des localités environnantes de Sikasso.
Il est à son dixième prêt  individuel avec l’Institution de micro-finance Soro Yiriwaso dans le souci de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante. Tous les neuf prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés.  
Ce nouveau prêt lui permettra de faire l’achat de 41 sacs de 100 kg de céréales, après l’achat il les stocke durant un moment dans son magasin à domicile avant la revente. La vente s’effectue au marché à une clientèle composée d’homme et de femme au comptant et à crédit. 
Il envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 105 000 francs CFA. Ce bénéfice lui permettra de payer le prêt et son intérêt et investir le reste dans son activité.
texts.en:
Monsieur Issa was born around 1970 in Nimporodioula. He is married and the father of 11 children. He lives with his spouse in a traditional family in Médine, a working-class neighborhood in the city of the Sikasso.

Monsieur Issa has been buying and selling cereals for over 16 years. He buys his supplies in the markets around Sikasso. 

This is the tenth individual loan he's received from the microfinance institution, Soro Yiriwarso, in the hopes of better satisfying his ever-growing clientele. All of his previous loans have been repaid. 

This new loan will allow him to buy 41 100kg bags of cereals. After buying his supplies, he briefly stores them in his home before reselling them. He sells in the market to a clientele comprised of men and women who buy with cash and by credit. 

He would like to earn an average monthly profit of 105,000 Central African CFA francs. This profit will allow him to pay his loan and interest and to invest the rest in his business.

loans.use: buy cereals.

loans.name: Berniño

texts.en:
Twenty-eight-year-old Berniño fishes for a living. This has been his business for 10 years now to support his four children who are 2, 4, 6 and 9 years old. He requested additional capital to buy ropes, nylon and fishing nets that are necessary for his business. 

Berniño is determined to work hard and find the means so he can give his children a better future by supporting their education. In the future, he hopes to expand his business and have another stable source of income.

loans.use: to buy ropes, nylon and fishing nets

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy various products such as toys, clothes and decorations.

loans.name: Jonathan

texts.en:
Jonathan is from the town of Carles, Iloilo. He is 36 years old, married and has two children ages one and six years old. For a year now, he has been engaged in a sari-sari (variety) store business and also in fishing. He is asking for a loan to buy fishing nets, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, seasoning and toiletries.

Jonathan dreams of having a stable business with enough income to rely on for his family. As a father, he is determined to do everything so his children can have a good education.

loans.use: to buy fishing nets, canned goods, eggs, cooking oil, seasoning and toiletries

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy glue, nylon string and more.

loans.name: Nely Suyapa

texts.es:
La señora Nely Suyapa de 40  años de edad, vive con su esposo e hijos en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 10  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Nely Suyapa es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos para surtir la pulpería,  como pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, azúcar, harina, huevos, etc. con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente  con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Nely Suyapa is 40 years old and lives with her husband and children in her own house in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras.  She has made a living for 10 years selling groceries.  Her store sells soft drinks, chips, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, and other groceries.

Nely is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to get ahead and fights every day to improve her life.  She is asking for a loan to buy products to stock her grocery store such as chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, lard, soap, sugar, flour, and eggs.  With the support of this loan she intends to improve her profits and also her quality of life.  She wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a successful business that is well-stocked and at the same time to improve her family's future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras
October 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, lard, soap, soft drinks, sugar, flour, and eggs, etc., for her business

loans.name: Xiomara Antonia

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Antonia de 36  años de edad, vive con su hijo y sus padres  en su casa propia, se dedica desde hace 2  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. vive en una aldea de San Lorenzo,  al sur de Honduras.
Doña Xiomara Antonia es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como pollo, arroz, frijoles, maseca, manteca, jabón, frescos, etc. para surtir su pulpería con el apoyo de este préstamo pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Xiomara Antonia is 36 years old and lives with her son and her parents in her own house in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. She has made a living for 2 years selling groceries. Her store sells soft drinks, chips, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, and other groceries.

Xiomara is an entrepreneurial woman who wants to get ahead and fights every day to improve her life. She is asking for a loan to buy products such as chicken, rice, beans, lard, soap, and soft drinks to stock her grocery store. With the support of this loan, she intends to improve her profits and also her quality of life. She is a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

Her dream is to have a successful business that is well-stocked and at the same time to improve her family's future.

San Lorenzo, Honduras
October 2014

loans.use: to buy chicken, rice, beans, corn flour, lard, soap, soft drinks, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jorge Alberto

texts.es:
El señor Jorge Alberto de 45 años  de edad, vive en su casa propia junto con su esposa y su hijo, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de leña,  los clientes de don Jorge llegan todos los días a su casa para comprarle su producto, sus clientes son todos sus vecinos y demás personas de la zona.
Don Jorge Alberto vive en la ciudad de San Lorenzo al sur de Honduras,  es un hombre emprendedor  con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida. 
Esta solicitando el préstamo para surtir su negocio con la compra de más leña ya que se acerca la temporada buena de diciembre y las personas necesitan  comprar este tipo de producto. Es un cliente nuevo con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es  crecer con su negocio para mejorar su calidad de vida. 

San Lorenzo valle, Honduras  - Octubre del  2014.
texts.en:
Jorge Alberto is 45 years old and lives with his wife and son in their own house in the town of San Lorenzo in southern Honduras. He has made a living for 5 years selling firewood.  His clients are all of his neighbors as well as other people from the area.  They come to his house every day to buy his firewood.

Jorge is an entrepreneurial man who wants to get ahead and fights every day to improve his life. He is asking for a loan to supply his business with more firewood since the good season of December is approaching and his product is in high demand. He is a new client who wants to work with Prisma.

His dream is to grow his business to improve his quality of life.  

San Lorenzo, Honduras
October 2014

loans.use: to buy firewood for his business

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Fe is 34 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Fe has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional gear and materials for her business.

Fe has been in this business for three years. In the future, Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional gear and materials for her business

loans.name: Wemma

texts.en:
Wemma goes fishing and sells fresh fish to earn a living. She is 39-year-old married woman from Carles, Ilo-ilo. She and her husband have eight children. The oldest is 13 while the youngest is 2 years old. She has been into that kind of business for more than 10 years. Wemma has requested a loan of 20,000 PHP to purchase fishing materials like fishing net and crab traps. With the aid of these materials, her livelihood will improve and can help her earnings grow.

Wemma hopes to have a stable income that will help her send her children to school for a bright future.

loans.use: to purchase fishing materials like fishing net and crab traps

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to maintain a pineapple and coffee crops

loans.name: Darwin Omar

texts.es:
El señor Darwin Omar de 43 años de edad, vive con su esposa y tiene tres  hijos  que dependen de él, radica en la comunidad de san Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, tiene casa propia  y se dedica desde hace 20 años  a la venta de ropa usada y nueva.
Don Darwin Omar su venta es de manera ambulante en los barrios y colonias de San Lorenzo esto lo realiza en su motocicleta,  sus clientes le prefieren por sus buenos precios y variedad en sus productos, es un hombre trabajador y muy dado a su familia quiere salir adelante y mejorar sus ingresos,  también tiene un coche acarreado por caballo en donde vende otros productos.
Está solicitando el préstamo para la  compra de blusas, faldas, vestidos, camisas, pantalones, etc.ropa nueva y ropa usada, con el apoyo de este préstamo el pretende mejorar su negocio y su economía y aumentar su mercadería ya que viene la época de navidad  y desea mejorar sus ingresos. Su sueño es mejorar su casa y tener  salud.

San Lorenzo, Honduras -  Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Darwin Omar is 43 years old. He lives with his wife and his two dependent children in the community of San Lorenzo, in Valle department in the south of Honduras. He has his own house and for the past 20 years has been working selling new and used clothing.

Darwin Omar's method of sales is going door-to door in the neighborhoods and communities of San Lorenzo. He does this by motorcycle and his clients prefer him due to his good prices and his variety of products. He is a hard-working man and very committed to his family. He wants to get ahead and improve his income. He also has a cart that is pulled by horses where he sells other products.

He is requesting a loan to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc both new clothing and use. With the help of this loan he hopes to improve his business and increase his merchandise. Christmas is approaching and he wants to improve his income. His dream is to improve his house and stay in good health.
San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to buy blouses, skirts, dresses, shirts, pants, etc. for his business.

loans.name: Christine

texts.en: Hello lenders, meet Christine. The 47-year-old mother of four is a smallholder farmer based in Kapsowar, found in the North Rift region of Kenya. The secondary-educated entrepreneur runs a mixed farm in which she keeps three fairly productive dairy cows that produce milk for both consumption and sale. Christine started farming in 1998. She farms on a 1/4 acre piece of land that belongs to her husband, whose professional activities have very little to do with agriculture. She was doing it for subsistence but recently switched to commercial produce. The income she made from this transition greatly improved her income status to enable her to afford her children a better education at standard private schools. Christine has one employee to help her run the farm business when she is attending her day job or doing her side job, which involves selling cosmetic products for extra income. Christine is seeking a loan to purchase a chaff cutter and animal feed. She places more premiums on animal health and nutrition in her dairy business than other factors. Animal feed has a lot to do with the proper composition of the animal products that she sells to her customers. She is seeking this loan to ensure that her animals have the proper feed composition that they require. The chaff cutter is handy during feed preparation to ensure that hay is evenly cut into appropriately small pieces that cows will enjoy to ingest and easily digest. Returns from this investment will enable Christine to pay for her children's education expenses. She wants nothing but the best foundation for her children's future.

loans.use: To buy a chaff cutter and animal feed

loans.name: Maritza Del Carmen

texts.es:
Maritza del Carmen es una señora de 41 años, madre soltera de dos niños los cuales estudian en primaria, es originaria del municipio de El Sauce, un poblado ubicado al occidente de Nicaragua.
Se considera pinolera de corazón y se siente muy orgullosa de ser nata de este pueblo maravilloso lleno de hermosas costumbres.
Estudió la carrera de administración de empresas y trabaja para una Institución de la localidad donde tiene varios años de laborar.
Uno de sus grandes sueños ha sido llegar a tener una vivienda con todas las condiciones adecuadas para tener una vida digna al lado de sus hijos, por este motivo se ha sacrificado y ha luchado con su salario y con la ayuda de los préstamos la que ha mejorado poco a poco.
En este momento tiene la necesidad de un préstamo para la compra de cemento, cerámica, bondex, pintura y pago de mano de obra con lo que piensa mejorar la apariencia de su casita, ya que es muy agradable vivir en lugar limpio y fresco.
Se siente agradecida con Kiva y Ceprodel por el apoyo que le han brindado a lo largo de estos años y espera seguir contando con ellos para préstamos futuros.
texts.en:
Maritza del Carmen is a 41-year-old single mother of 2 children who are in primary school.  She is originally from the town of El Sauce in western Nicaragua.  She considers herself to be Nicaraguan at heart and she is proud to have been born in this marvelous town full of beautiful customs.  She studied business administration and she has worked for a local enterprise for several years.  

One of her greatest dreams has been to have a home in adequate condition to live a dignified life with her children.  Towards this aim, she has sacrificed and done what she can with her salary and assistance from loans, and she has improved her home little by little.  

At the moment, she needs a loan to buy cement, tiles, Bondex, paint, and pay for manual labor in order to improve the appearance of her little home, since it would be nice to live in a home that is clean and fresh.  She is grateful to Kiva and Ceprodel for the support that they have provided throughout the years and she hopes that she can continue to count on them for future loans.

loans.use: to buy cement, tiles, Bondex, and paint and pay for labor

loans.name: Fidel Angel

texts.es:
Fidel, cultiva maíz y frijol, es casado, con su esposa comparten la responsabilidad de sacar a sus 4 hijos adelante, su negocio lo realiza desde hace 30 años, el oficio lo heredo de su familia, en el negocio colaboran sus hijos.
Comprará insumos agrícolas para obtener una mayor productividad de maíz y frijol, sus objetivos son incrementar las ganancias, contar con clientes satisfechos y alimentación para su familia.
Fidel sueña con seguir trabajando para cancelar su deuda, remodelar su vivienda y que sus hijos estudien nivel superior.
texts.en: Fidel grows corn and beans. He is married and with his wife he shares the responsibility of bringing up his 4 children. He has done this business for 30 years. It was inherited from his family and his children help him with it. He will buy agricultural inputs to obtain greater productivity for his corn and beans. His objective is to increase his profits, keep his clients satisfied and feed his family. Fidel dreams of continuing to work to pay off his loan, remodeling his house and seeing his children study higher education.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs to increase his production of corn and beans.

location.town: San Rafael de Oriente, San Miguel

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia is a married woman. She is engaged in fishing. She is 57 year old and sells fish to the people in her community. She has been fishing for almost 20 years.  Together with her family, she live in Carles, Ilo-ilo. She and her husband have 12 children. Three of her children are still attending school. Lucia is asking for a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a motorboat engine and materials needed for construction of a new boat. This is a big help for Lucia and her family to improve her catch and provide her family with proper diets and most especially, to continue to support the education of her children.

In the future, Lucia hopes that she will expand her fishing business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy a motorboat engine and materials needed for construction of a new boat

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is a 40-year-old married woman and a mother of three children from Dulag, Leyte. She is engaged in a fishing business with her husband for more than 15 years now. This is the source of their income.

Rowena is asking for a loan to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and other items. With this, Rowena and her husband will be able to improve their catch, thus giving them more fish to sell in the market. Rowena hopes to makes their fishing business more stable and profitable in the future. Moreover, she wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy materials for fishing like nets, lead weights, hooks and other items

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 45 years old and married with five children. With four of her children currently in school, Gina works very hard to provide for them.

Gina runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stocks to sell in her general store.

Gina has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as noodles, canned goods, cooking oil, vinegar, snack foods, soft drinks, etc. 

In the future, Gina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more stocks to sell in her general store

loans.name: Bahia

texts.en:
Bahia is a 19-year-old married lady from Nablus city. She lives with her husband and his family in a very simple house. Her husband is an employee in a public firm where he gets a low income. This income barely covers all the family needs. Bahia is a student who studies science. She would like to take a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Bahia took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Bahia will be able to complete her studies faster and improve herself 

Bahia appears in the photo

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena 57, has been engaged in fishing for almost 20 years now. She sells fish to the locals in her place. She lives in Carles Ilo-ilo. She is married and  has seven children. The youngest child is 18 years old. In addition to fishing, she is engaged in a dried fish vending business. These are her sources of income. Due to the increase in present commodities,  Elena is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy fishing net and additional capital to buy dried fish. This is beneficial for her day-to-day living as it will help her purchase more stock and create higher improvement of her daily catch.

With the additional capital, Elena hopes she will make it a success for a better way of living in the coming future.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and use the additional capital to buy dried fish

loans.name: Jose Juan

texts.es:
José, ha formado su propia familia, la cual está integrada por su esposa y su hija de 4 años de edad, desde hace 9 meses inicio a vender comida, en un horario de 6:00 a.m. a 2:00 p.m., como una manera de tener ingresos para dar a su familia mejores condiciones de vida. Hasta el momento no representa dificultades en desempeñar estas actividades.
Comprará arroz, frijoles, verduras, condimentos, aceite, carnes, etc., serán de ayuda para preparar la comida que ofrece en su negocio, espera ir mejorando la popularidad, tener nuevos clientes y dar un buen servicio. Los riesgos son la competencia y los precios variables de la materia prima.  
Los sueños que José desea cumplir son establecer mejor su negocio, cancelar su deuda y tener mejores ingresos para dar a su familia una vida cotidiana más digna.
texts.en:
José has his own family which consists of his wife and their 4-year-old daughter. Nine months ago, he started selling food. He works from 6 a.m. to 2 p.m. in order to have the income he needs to provide his family with better living conditions.

Until now, he has not encountered any problems with his business. He wants to buy rice, beans, vegetables, condiments, oil, meat, etc. This will help him to prepare the food which he sells in his business. He hopes to increase his popularity, to attract new clients and to offer a good service. The risks to his business are his competitors and the unstable prices of supplies.

It is José's dream to improve his business, to pay back his debt, and to increase his income in order to give his family a daily life with more dignity.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, vegetables, condiments, oil, meat, etc. in order to prepare food for selling in his business.

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion is a 39-year-old married woman and a mother of three children who are 18, 8 and 7 years old. Salvacion makes a living through her fish vending business. She has been in the business for more than 13 years now. Salvacion is a hardworking woman.

As of now, she needs additional capital for her business. For this, she requested a loan to buy more fish to sell. Salvacion believes that this loan will help her in augmenting her fish stock, allowing her to sell more to her customers. In the future, Salvacion dreams of making her business more profitable and sustainable. She also wants to save money for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell

loans.name: Emelda

texts.en:
Emelda is engaged in fishing. She catches and sells fish to earn a living. She is a 49-year-old married woman from Carles, Ilo-ilo. She and her husband have two children ages 13 and 10 years old, respectively. She has been in that business for almost 15 years. Due to financial problems, Emelda has requested a loan of 40,000 PHP to buy fishing net and materials for the acquisition of a new motorboat.  She will be able to go back again to normal operations, which could create a larger catch and generate higher earnings. 

In the future, Emelda hopes that she can improve and maximize all the tools that help her livelihood to prosper.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and materials for acquisition of a new motorboat

loans.name: Elder Danilo

texts.es:
Elder, es un joven que está soltero, no tiene hijos, vive con su padre y dos hermanos de  17 y 16 años de edad, tiene como responsabilidad cubrir sus gastos personales y apoyar a su familia económicamente, de su padre aprendió a cultivar maíz y pipían, ha tomado esta actividad como negocio desde hace 4 años, sus hermanos trabajan junto a él, con el paso del tiempo ha adquirido más experiencia y ya cuenta con muchos clientes a los que le distribuye el producto.
Invertirá en herbicidas, insecticidas, abono y semilla, estos insumos están destinados a preparar la tierra para cultivar maíz y pipían, con lo que mantendrá su negocio funcionando en época de verano, espera tener una mejor cosecha e ingresos, los  riesgos son algunos problemas de plagas que se de en lo largo del desarrollo de los cultivos.
Elder sueña con tener un negocio más rentable para cancelar su deuda y ayudar a sus hermanos a finalizar sus estudios.
texts.en:
Elder is a young man who is single, has no children and lives with his father and two brothers, who are 17 and 16 years old. He is responsible to cover his own personal expenses and to help with the household economy. His father taught him how to grow corn and pipian squash, and Elder set up in this business 4 years ago. His brothers work with him. Over the time, he has gathered more experience and already has many customers whom he supplies with his produce.

He wants to invest the loan in the purchase of herbicides, insecticides, compost and seeds. He needs these supplies to prepare his land for the planting of corn and pipian squash and to keep his farm in order over the summer. He hopes to improve his harvest and his income. The risks he faces are some problems with pests which can affect his plantation during the growth period.

Elder's dream is to have a more profitable business in order to be able to repay his debt and to help his brothers to complete their studies.

loans.use: to buy herbicides, insecticides, compost, and seeds to use them to prepare his land for the planting of corn and pipian squash.

loans.name: Jose Alberto

texts.es:
José de 54 años de edad, está acompañado y tiene 2 hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad solo el mayor estudia. No pudo estudiar debido a que la escuela más cercana le quedaba muy lejos y sus padres no tenían la capacidad económica para mandarlo a estudiar. Con él viven solo su esposa y sus hijo y dependen directamente de él.

José es agricultor, actividad que aprendió desde pequeño trabajando con su padre, todos los días camina cerca de 3km desde su casa al lugar donde tiene sembrado el cultivo. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar fertilizante para su cultivo y un molino de nixtamal, en la zona donde vive no hay ninguno cerca y pretende dar servicios de molienda para aprovechar la demanda.

José sueña con que sus hijos se preparen académicamente para que tengan mejores oportunidades en la vida.
texts.en:
Jose, 54, is married and has two children, ages 8 and 5.  The eldest attends school.  Jose was unable to get an education because the closest school was too far away and his parents did not have the resources to send him to school.  His wife and children are his direct dependents.

Jose is a farmer and learned the trade working with his father.  Every day Jose walks nearly three kilometers from hom to his cropland.  The loan he is requesting is to buy fertilizer for his crops and a mill for limed corn.  Where he lives there is no one near who can offer mill services, so he wants to take 
advantage of demand.

Jose dreams of his children developing academically so they will have better opportunities in life.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and a limed corn mill.

loans.name: Ana Yasari

texts.es:
La señora Ana Yasari  de 24  años de edad, vive con su mamá  en su de habitación, se dedica desde hace 5  años al negocio de venta de abarrotería, en su negocio vende  frescos, churros, frijoles, arroz,  lácteos, jabón, pollo,  etc. vive en la cuidad de San Lorenzo, al sur de Honduras.
Doña Ana Yasari  es una mujer emprendedora con deseos de salir adelante y lucha día con día para mejorar su calidad de vida, está solicitando el préstamo para compra de productos como arroz, azúcar, frijoles, queso, leche, huevos, pan, etc. para surtir su pulpería con el apoyo de este crédito pretende mejorar sus ingresos y también su calidad de vida, es una buena cliente con deseos de trabajar con Prisma.
Su sueño es tener un buen negocio y bien surtido y al mismo  tiempo mejorar su futuro junto a su familia.

San Lorenzo, Honduras – Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Ana Yasari is 24 years old and live with her mother in an apartment. For 5 years, she has had a store selling groceries. She sells soft drinks, churros, beans, rice, dairy products, soap, chicken, etc. She lives in the city of San Lorenzo, in the south of Honduras.

Ana Yasari is an enterprising woman who wants to get ahead and who strives every day to improve her quality of life. She is asking for a loan to buy products like rice, sugar, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, and bread, etc. in order to stock her grocery store. With the help of this loan, she wants to increase her income and also her quality of life. She is a good client and wants to work with Prisma. It is her dream to have a good and well-stocked business and, at the same time, to improve the future of herself and her family. 

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, beans, cheese, milk, eggs, bread, etc. for her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy blouses, pants and skirts.

loans.name: Maria Luz

texts.es:
María de 33 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos de 13 y 10 años de edad ambos estudian en la escuela de la comunidad. Ella solo estudio hasta 9° grado, su esposo es mecánico y solo él y sus hijos viven con ella.

María tiene un restaurante de comida mejicana desde hace 5 años, se asoció con su tía y ambas lo administran. El préstamo será utilizado para comprar productos como condimentos, tortillas de maíz, carne de res, pollo y cerdo, vegetales y demás para esta r abastecidos debido a que se acercan las festividades en el pueblo y quieren estar preparados.
María sueña con expandir su negocio a tal grado de abrir locales en otras partes de su comunidad.
texts.en:
María, 33, is married and has two children, ages 13 and 10, who attend the community school.  She only has a 9th grade education.  Her husband is a mechanic and he and the children are the only ones who live with María.

María runs a Mexican restaurant which she has been managing for five years together with her aunt.  The loan will be used to buy products such as condiments, corn tortillas, beef, chicken, pork, vegetables and other items to be ready for the upcoming village holidays.

María dreams of expanding her business by opening stalls in other parts of the community.

loans.use: To buy condiments, corn tortillas, beef, chicken, pork, vegetables and other items.

loans.name: Ricardo Josael

texts.es:
Ricardo de 19 años de edad, es soltero y no tiene hijos, solo estudio hasta 6° de educación básica, él tomó la decisión de dejar la escuela y empezar a trabajar para apoyar a sus padres económicamente. 

Ricardo es mecánico, trabajaba en un taller de reparación de motocicletas pero debido a que salía muy tarde y no encontraba transporte tuvo que renunciar. También es agricultor de granos básicos. 

El préstamo que solicita será utilizado para comprar una motocicleta para facilitarle la movilización ya sea a su trabajo o a donde tenga que estudiar porque Ricardo sueña con conseguir un trabajo que le permita mantener sus estudios y tener una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Ricardo is 19 years old, he is single and has no children. He only went to school until the 6th grade of primary education. Then he took the decision to leave school and to start working in order to help his parents financially. 

Ricardo is a mechanic, he worked in a garage which repairs motorbikes, but he had to give notice because he always left work very late and could not find a way to get home then. He is also a farmer or basic grains.

He will use the loan to buy a motorbike in order to be able to get around, be it to work or to school, because it is Ricardo's dream to find a job which will allow him to take up his studies again to get a better education.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike.

loans.name: Cecilia Elizabeth

texts.es:
Cecilia de 27 años de edad, es casada y no tiene hijos, su esposo es agricultor y juntos cuidan una sobrina de 3 años de edad, solo ellos 3 viven en la casa.

Cecilia es comerciante, administra una tienda junto a su madrastra, el préstamo lo necesita para apoyar a su esposo en la siembra de 7,000 mts cuadrados de pipián comprando fertilizantes, pesticidas, herbicidas, pago de maquinaria y mano de obra para sembrar.

Cecilia piensa volver a trabajar en la agricultura, pues en ocasiones se ven mas ganancias con el cultivo que con la tienda.
texts.en:
Cecilia, 27 years old, is married and doesn't have any children. Her husband is a farmer and together they look after their 3 year old niece. The three of them live together in a house. 

Cecilia is a shopkeeper and she runs a shop together with her stepmother. The loan is needed to help her husband plant 7,000 square metres of pipián (a type of squash), and will be used for the purchase of fertilisers, pesticides, herbicides, and paying for equipment and labour needed to plant the fields. 

Cecilia thinks about going back to working in agriculture, as on occasion it brings in more income than the shop.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, pesticides, herbicides, and to pay for equipment and labour needed to plant the fields.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets, essences and general home products

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase various items for his shop

loans.name: Norma Elizabeth

texts.es:
Norma, ha logrado fortalecer mejor la tienda con la inversión de créditos, hoy en día oferta más y nuevos productos a sus clientes, la situación económica está mejorando, su familia mantiene el mismo núcleo y mantiene su buen record crediticio.
Como una manera de mantener surtido su negocio y ahorrar en la compra al por mayor está solicitando un nuevo préstamo para comprar granos básicos, azúcar, sal, aceite, cereales, bebidas, golosinas, etc., para continuar teniendo clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Norma has achieved her aim to have a more stable business through her loans. Today, she offers more and new products to her customers and her economic situation is improving. She lives with her family as before and maintains her good credit record.

As a way to keep her business well stocked and to save money by purchasing wholesale, she is asking for a new loan to buy staple grains, sugar, salt, oil, cereals, soft drinks, sweets, etc., in order to continue having satisfied customers.

loans.use: to buy staple grains, sugar, salt, oil, cereals, soft drinks, sweets, etc. to continue having satisfied customers.

loans.name: Lais

texts.en:
Lais is a specialist in acupuncture and Pilates and works in two clinics. Lais realized in her day-to-day work that the cost of visits is very expensive for clients, and she therefore decided to create a new business: one clinic for people from the base of pyramid.

Lais has a dream: to provide base of the pyramid customers with access to good services at fair prices. She displays some important behaviors: she is generous, focused and strong.

She heard about Banco Pérola through social media, and needs the loan money to buy some machinery and equipment to start her Physiotherapy clinic for base of the pyramid clients.

loans.use: To buy furniture, tools, and equipment

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Felicita Maria

texts.es:
La señora Felicita María  de 40  años de edad, es madre soltera,  tiene dos  hijos  que dependen de ella y vive en una comunidad de San Lorenzo, valle al sur de Honduras, no tiene casa propia y vive en casa de una hermana.
Doña Felicita María se dedica desde hace 04 años a la venta de ropa y detergentes de forma ambulante,  sus clientes le prefieren por su buen trato y sus precios sus muy buenos, es una mujer que lucha día con día para sacar adelante a sus dos hijos que tiene en la escuela y colegio, es un buen ejemplo de lucha para la demás personas actualmente por estar la época de lluvia en la zona ella emprendió el negocio de tortillas y le va bien.
Doña Felicita María está solicitando el préstamo para la maíz, leña y cal y también quiere invertir en la compra de ropa interior, blusas, vestidos, camisas, etc. que es otro de sus negocios,  tiene varios pedidos de ropa nueva para esta época de navidad, con el apoyo del préstamo espera suplir sus necesidad es su segundo préstamo que solicita,  uno de sus sueños es mejorar su negocio.

 San Lorenzo, Honduras - Octubre del 2014.
texts.en:
Felicita María, 40, is a single mother. She has two children who depend on her and lives in San Lorenzo, a community located in a valley in Southern Honduras. She does not have a house of her own, so she lives with her sister.

Felicita María has been selling clothes and detergents for four years as a street vendor. Her customers like her because she is kind and offers good prices. She fights every day to get ahead with her two children, who go to school. She is a role model when it comes to working hard. She recently started selling tortillas because of the rainy season and is doing well.

Felicita María is requesting a loan to buy corn, firewood and lime, and also underwear, blouses, dresses, shirts, etc. Her customers have already placed some orders for Christmas. With this loan, she hopes to cover her needs. This is her second loan and one of her dreams is to improve her business.

San Lorenzo, Honduras - October 2014.

loans.use: to buy underwear, blouses and shirts to sell, and corn, firewood and lime for her tortillas business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy window tinting, shelves, and tools

loans.name: Israa

texts.en:
Israa is a 19-year-old single lady from Nablus city. She lives with her family in a very simple house. Her father works in selling fruits and vegetables in the local market. His income barely cover all the family needs. 

Israa is a student. She would like to take a BA degree and find a job as a teacher in the future.

Israa took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help her to pay the university installments for this semester. By taking this loan, Israa will be able to complete her study faster and improve herself

loans.use: to pay the university installments for this semester.

loans.name: María Cristina

texts.es:
María de 32 años de edad, está acompañada y tiene 3 hijos, su pareja trabaja cuidando una granja de cerdos, desde temprano se despiertan todos, ella hace el desayuno los oficios de la casa y lleva a los niños a la escuela. Únicamente ellos 4 viven en la casa.

María es comerciante, tiene una tienda en la que vende productos de primera necesidad, granos básicos, golosinas y demás, tiene 4 años administrándola. Además los fines de semana vende enchiladas, tostadas de plátano, agua en bolsa y bebidas a la cancha de futbol de su comunidad.

Necesita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción, arena cemento y ladrillos para reparar urgentemente su casa. María sueña con tener un mini súper que logre abastecer toda la comunidad.
texts.en:
María is 32 years old. She is married and has 3 children. Her spouse works caring for a pig farm. All of them get up early, she makes breakfast and does the housework and takes the children to school. Only the 4 of them live in the house. 

María is a merchant. She has a store where she sells staple products such as basic grains, snacks and more. She has been running it for 4 years. In addition, on weekends, she sells enchiladas, plantain chips, bags of water and beverages on a soccer field in her community. 

She needs the loan to buy construction materials such as sand, cement and bricks to do urgent repairs on her house. María dreams of having a mini-market that can supply the whole community.

loans.use: to buy sand, cement and bricks to repair her home.

loans.name: Lesver Miguel

texts.es:
Lesver Miguel es un señor de 39 años, casado, padre de familia de tres hijos dos de ellos a su cargo.
Habita en el municipio de El Sauce donde nació y creció con las costumbre y tradiciones de este pueblo pinolero como generalmente le dicen a Nicaragua.
Estudió la carrera de medicina y con el esfuerzo propio se especializó como médico pediatra ya que le gusta y se siente bien atender y mejorar la salud de los niños que son los más bellos en este mundo y el futuro de toda nación.
El ejerce su profesión en el Hospital de la localidad pero por las noches atiende en su consultorio que lo tiene ubicado en su casa de habitación donde es muy considerado sobre todo con las personas de escasos recursos.
El crédito lo solicita para la compra de insumos médicos para su consultorio como es gasas, algodón, alcohol, palillos, papelería con el fin de brindar un buen servicio a sus clientes.
Espera que Kiva y Ceprodel le sigan apoyando como lo han hecho durante estos años donde se siente muy agradecido y contento por el buen servicio.
texts.en:
Lesver Miguel is a 39 year old man. He is a husband and father of three children, two of whom he is still raising. He lives in the town of El Sauce, where he was born  and raised with the customs and traditions of this Pinolero town, as Nicaraguans are generally called.  

He studies medicine and on his own initiative specialized in pediatric medicine because he likes it and because it feels good to treat and improve the health of children who are the most beautiful think in this world and the future of the whole nation. He practices his profession in the local hospital but nights he works in his office located in his house, where he is much respected especially by people of low income.

He is asking for the loan to buy medical materials for his office, such as gauze, cotton, tongue depressors, and paper products, so that he may offer a good service to his patients.   

He hopes that Kiva and Ceprodel will keep supporting him as they have done in the last few years. He feels very grateful and happy with the good service.

loans.use: to buy medical supplies for his office.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en:
Zena is married and blessed with four children who attend school. They live at their own house, which has electricity and piped water

Zena operates a clothes-selling business, selling women's and gent's suits in a shop. She cites seasonality and stiff competition from other clothes dealers as her major challenge. 

With the KES 20,000 she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale at her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing for children and adolescents.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.en:
Virgilio is a 54-year-old married man from Dulag, Leyte. 

He operates a small vulcanizing shop in his place. For more than four years now, Virgilio has been making an income through his business.
 
Virgilio is asking for a loan to buy a new compressor for his shop. With this, he will be able to cater to more customers in his shop.

In the future, Virgilio hopes to make his business a success.

loans.use: to buy a new compressor for his shop.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.en:
Oscar is a fisherman from Carles, Ilo-ilo. He is married and has a one grown child. He has been in the fishing business for almost 14 years. He sells fresh fish to the local community.  

Due to limited capital to pursue his day-to-day living, Oscar requested a loan in the amount of 30,000 PHP to buy fishing net and a motorboat engine.This will help increase his on-going catch and probably will result in higher earnings so that he can now provide his family with a nutritious diet. 

Oscar would like to expand his fishing business for a sustainable livelihood.

loans.use: to buy fishing net and a motorboat engine.

loans.name: Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio tiene 49 años de edad, es soltero, vive con su madre, en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en el distrito de Cayaltí, goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales por parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Antonio se dedica a la actividad de crianza de cerdos, cuenta con más de 2 años de antigüedad en el negocio, en su propio domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de alimento de engorde balanceado para sus cerdos. Así poder mejorar la calidad de crianza de sus cerdos para poder venderlos a un mejor precio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Antonio is 49 years old. He is single and lives with his mother in his own house in a large community in the district of Cayaltí. He has good personal and work references from his neighbors. His community is basically dedicated to agriculture, raising livestock and commerce. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region, northern coast of Peru.

Antonio works raising pigs. He has had this business for more than 2 years and it is located at his home. He is asking for the loan to buy balanced feed to fatten up his pigs. This way, he can improve the quality of his pigs so that he can sell them at a better price. This will allow him to increase his income in the short term, increase his profits and there fore his and his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed to fatten up his pigs.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en:
Priscah is 30 years old, married and together with her spouse she has been blessed with three children. 

She runs a mobile money transfer business and has been running it for four years. Right now her monthly income is KES 20,000. 

She will be using this loan to add more money float to her business so she can serve more customers. She will use the anticipated profits to expand her business. 

This is her fourth loan with VisionFund Kenya, and she repaid her previous loans successfully. Her future hopes are to have a successful business and live a comfortable life with her family.

loans.use: To add more money float to her mobile money transfer business.

loans.name: Hira

texts.en:
Hira is 29 years old and married with three children.

Hira works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been running the general store for six years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing. 

Hira requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store. Hira has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Hira aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Leny

texts.en:
Leny is a married woman. She is 48 year old. Together with her family, she lives in Carles, Ilo-ilo. She has three children, ages 24, 23 and 18.

She engages in fishing. She sells fresh fish, crabs and clams to the people in the community. She has been fishing for more than 20 years. 

Due to financial problems, Leny is requesting a loan of PHP 40,000 to buy a motorboat engine and fishing net. With these materials, Leny could have a sufficient catch and probably create higher earnings, thus providing her family with a proper diet and good living conditions.
 
Leny hopes that she will expand her fishing business for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy a motorboat engine and fishing net.

loans.name: Cresmin

texts.en:
Cresmin, 62, raises sheep, goats and ducks  for a living. She has been engaged in this kind of business for 10 years now. 

She is married and has ten children. Her youngest child is 19. 

Because of a shortage in capital, Cresmin has requested a loan in the amount of 25,000 PHP to purchase additional goats and materials to built a goat shelter. This will help Cresmin raise and sell more goats and will eventually make her livelihood steady and at ease.

Cresmin hopes that someday, she could expand her livelihood and set aside some savings for her old age.

loans.use: to purchase additional goats and materials to build a goat shelter.

loans.name: Yajaira Sayuri

texts.es:
Yajaira Sayuri tiene 22 años de edad, es conviviente, vive con su madre, esposo, e hijo en casa propia, en una comunidad grande en el distrito de Cayaltí y goza de buenas referencias personales y laborales de parte de sus vecinos. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Yajaira Sayuri se dedica a la venta de verduras y frutas en mercado de Cayaltí, cuenta con más de 2 años de antigüedad en el negocio, el mismo que está ubicado en el mercado del distrito. Ella solicita préstamo para para invertir en una canitdad mayor de verduras y de esa manera incrementar sus ventas diarias. Haciendo crecer su negocio, pues los podrá vender a un mejor precio ya que estan siendo criados con mayor cuidado y calidad. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Yajaira Sayuri is 22 years old. She is in a relationship and lives with her mother, husband and son in her own house. She lives in a large community in the district of Cayaltí and she has good personal and work references from her neighbors. Her community works mainly in agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on the north coast of Peru.

Yajaira Sayuri works selling fruits and vegetables in the market in Cayaltí. She has more than two years in the business. She is requesting a loan to invest in a greater quantity of vegetables and in this way increase her daily sales. Making her business grow, she can sell at a better price as they are being grown with better care and quality. In the short term this will allow her to increase her sales, increase her profits and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in a greater amount of vegetables, in this way increasing her daily sales.

loans.name: Matilde

texts.es:
Matilde tiene 53 años de edad, es soltera, vive en casa propia, junto a su menor hija. Ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería, como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Matilde es la crianza de animales y venta del mismo,ademas de la venta de comida al paso en las afueras del colegio primario del caserío, actividad la realiza desde hace más de 3 años, con experiencia en el negocio, con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de calaminas y cambiar techo de su vivienda, pues ya se acerca temporada de lluvias y ella desea asegurar su techo para poder darle seguridad a toda su familia, mejorando de esta forma su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Matilde is 53 years old. She is single and lives in her own home with her daughter, who is a minor. She is from the area. Life in the district is peaceful. Its residents work in agriculture and raising livestock as their main support. They plant and harvest bananas, corn, cowpeas, etc. Her community is located in the district of Buenos Aires, province of Morropón, Piura region, northern coast of Peru.

Matilde's activity is raising and selling animals. She also sells food as a street vendor outside the primary school of her community. She has done this for 3 years and has experience in the business with very good personal and work references in the area. The loan will be used to buy corrugated metal panels and change the roof on her house. Rainy season is coming and she wants to secure her roof so her family can be safer. This way, she can improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to buy corrugated metal panels and change the roof on her house.

loans.name: Gregoria

texts.en:
Gregoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for four years. Gregoria earns additional income from food vending.

She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.
