Gregoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She hopes to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Joselor

texts.en:
Joselor is a married woman with eight children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Joselor is 39 years old, and has six children who are currently in school.

Joselor has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Joselor has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries

loans.name: Josie

texts.en:
Josie is 37 years old and has five children. She is married, and has four children who are currently in school.

Josie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs.

Josie has been in this business for two years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase vaccines, feed, and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 21-year-old single man from Nablus city. He lives with his parents and five brothers and sister in very poor conditions. He started his own business six years ago, when he opened a furniture making workshop. He had experience from his previous job. 

Ahmad took a USD loan from FATEN. This loan will help him to buy new tools for his furniture making workshop. This will increase his productivity and also his work quality. 

Ahmad appears in the photo in his workshop.

loans.use: to buy new tools

loans.name: Judith

texts.en:
Judith is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judith is 44 years old, and has four children who are currently in school.

Judith has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Judith has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials like fishing net, gasoline

loans.name: Kristine

texts.en:
Kristine works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

Kristine requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her business.

She has been in this business for one year now.

Kristine would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc

loans.name: Maria Cristina

texts.en:
Maria Cristina is 35 years old and married with four children.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maria Cristina has borrowed and paid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for five years, and also earns an income from fishing.

Maria Cristina aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries

loans.name: Isolina

texts.es:
Isolina tiene de 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, conocida en el medio, por su labor de crianza y venta de aves de corral tales como cuyes, conejos, pollos, etc. Vive con su su padre, quien es pensionista y sus 02 hijas de 14 y 05 años de edad. Ella es una persona de buenas referencias personales y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería. Y está ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú.

Isolina se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales de corral (patos, pollo y pavos, cerdos y cuyes, etc). El destino del crédito es para la inversión en compra de animales Cerdos específicamente, pues existe mucha demanda insatisfecha de la compra de está carne, por lo que ella pretende atender la demanda insatisfecha en el lugar, lo que le permitirá ampliar su cartera de clientes, Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Isolina is 39 years old. She is a single mother, known in her area for her work raising and selling farm animals like guinea pigs, rabbits, chickens, etc. She lives with her father and two daughters aged 14 and 5 years old. She has good personal and work references and a united family. She lives in a community devoted to commerce, agriculture and raising livestock. It is located in the district of Cayaltí, in the province of Chiclayo, Lambayeque region on the north coast of Peru.

Isolina works raising and selling farm animals like ducks, chickens, turkeys, pigs, guinea pigs, etc. The loan will be used to invest in the purchase of animals, specifically pigs as there is a lot of un-met demand for this product in the area. So she wants to met the unfilled demand in the zone which will allow her to expand her portfolio of clients. In the short term this will increase her income and increase her profits and in the end improve her quality of living and that of her family.

loans.use: to invest in buying animals, specifically pigs.

loans.name: Ma. Lina

texts.en:
Ma. Lina is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ma. Lina is 42 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Ma. Lina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials and gears for her fishing business.

Ma. Lina has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials and gears

loans.name: Marianit

texts.en:
Marianit is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Marianit is 33 years old, and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Marianit requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase materials and more fish for her business.

Marianit has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase materials and more fish

loans.name: Marivic

texts.en:
Marivic is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a direct selling Avon products business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy more stock of Avon products like bags, deodorant, body spray, lipsticks, lotion, etc. to sell for her direct selling Avon products business.

Marivic has been in this business for five years. She earns more income from a general store.

Marivic has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of Avon products, like bags, deodorant, body spray, lipsticks, lotion, etc.

loans.name: Modesta

texts.en:
Modesta is 44 years old and has five children. She is married, and has three children who are currently in school.

Modesta is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins for her business.

Modesta has been in pig fattening for six years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Modesta would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy an additional piglet, feed, and vitamins

loans.name: Nenita

texts.en:
Nenita is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nenita is 40 years old, and has two children who are currently in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Nenita requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more materials like a fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Nenita has been in this business for 20 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more materials like a fishing net, fish containers, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Nyormo Jormo Group

texts.en:
The Nyormo Jormo group consists of four ladies whose individual efforts and struggles encouraged them to join ID-Ghana for their second loan. They sell African wax-prints, foodstuff, perming creams and wigs. 

Margaret (standing second from right in the photograph) is the group's representative borrower; she has been selling African wax-prints for eight years. She is applying for this loan to buy more African wax-prints to sell to customers. This will help her to finalize her business plan, and thus improve her income. 

The group members have received an orientation about loans and microfinance, so they are aware of the work and effort expected from them and required to ultimately be successful and provide a better life for their families. There is continuous training and verification provided that encourage the women to fight to escape poverty. 

The group needs a total amount of GHS 2,800 to improve their businesses.

loans.use: To buy African wax-prints

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rebecca is 40 years old, and has four children who are in school.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines. Rebecca requested a PHP 11,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy additional materials like fish containers, fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her business.

Rebecca has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like fish containers, fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Rodjelin

texts.en:
Rodjelin works hard to support her family. She is married, and has a ready to wear selling business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy more stock of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Rodjelin has been in this business for five years now.

She would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ready to wear

loans.name: Taliko

texts.en:
Taliko is 31 years old. She is married, and lives with her husband, sister, and pensioner mother in Terjola district. The family is involved in agricultural activities. Specifically, they have a vineyard and three cows. 

Taliko milks the cows every day and produces dairy products to sell locally. Taliko's husband gets an invalid pension of 100 Gel per month, but it is for medicines. As the income is only seasonal and not enough for family, Taliko decided to build a greenhouse behind their house. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of $3,000 to build a greenhouse. As the greenhouse is built, she will grow cucumbers and tomatoes there twice in a year to sell and increase the family income.

loans.use: to build a greenhouse and grow tomatoes and cucumbers

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stocks of sugar, flour, bread and other items

loans.name: Salvacion

texts.en:
Salvacion, who is single, has operated a food-vending business in the Philippines for 14 years now. She is requesting a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy more ingredients for her enterprise.

In the future, Salvacion would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
A married mother of four, Mary describes herself as determined. For 10 years she has been operating a tailoring shop where she makes clothes. Her business is located in a vibrant location, and her primary customers are from all walks of life. Mary describes her biggest challenge to be inadequate capital. 

Her previous loans repaid, Mary is now requesting her fourth loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank for Kes 100,000. She will use it to buy more stocks of tailoring materials, with the anticipated profits going toward business expansion.

May's goal is to own a tailoring school within five years.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of tailoring materials

loans.name: Agustina

texts.es:
Agustina tiene 36 de años de edad, soltera, vive en casa propia, junto a su familia. Ella es natural de la zona. La vida en el distrito es tranquila, sus pobladores se dedican a la agricultura y ganadería como sustento principal, siembra y cosecha de banano,maíz, fréjol caupí. Etc. Su comunidad está ubicada en el distrito de Buenos Aires, provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que realiza Agustina es la compra y venta de granos, además de la siembra del mismo, así como también brinda el servicio de carga de hormigón, actividad que realiza desde hace mas de 3 años, Agustina es conocida en la zona, cuenta con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona donde vive y con buen comportamiento de pago. Destino del crédito será para mejora de su vivienda pues desea darle mayor comodidad y seguridad a la casa de sus padres que es donde ella también vive.
texts.en:
Agustina is 36 years old, single, and lives in her own home with her family.  She is native to the area.  Life in the district is calm; its inhabitants work in agriculture and livestock as their main livelihood, growing and harvesting bananas, corn, and black-eyed peas.  The community is located in the Buenos Aires district, in the Morropón province of the Piura region on the northern coast of Peru.

The work Agustina does is buying and selling grains, in addition to planting them.  She also transports concrete, work she has done for more than three years.  Agustina is known in the area, she has many good personal and work references in the area where she lives and has good payment performance.  The loan will be used to improve her home.  She wants to provide more comfort and security to her parents' house, since she lives there too.

loans.use: to improve her home.

loans.name: Benita

texts.en:
Benita is 62 years old and widowed with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Benita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell.

Benita has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items. 

Benita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, soft drinks, beer, noodles, diapers, sanitary pads, etc. to sell

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana's business benefited from financial assistance KIVA provided last time: her income increased which allowed Tatyana's family to undertake a small makeover in their apartment. Tatyana's son went to school this year which implies additional expenses for the family as a result. 

Tatyana needs additional 22,000 Grivnyas to buy additional seasonal merchandise: men's coats, jackets, sweaters and pullovers that are in high demand and will sell really well now.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en:
Tamer is a 22 years old university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his third year. 

Tamer wants to start applying for a job that will help him gain a good income in order to support his family. But because he currently doesn't have enough money to pay for his study fees, he is asking for your help by applying for this loan.

loans.use: to pay his study fees

loans.name: Carolina

texts.en:
Carolina works hard to support her family. Carolina is married and has a paper bags and Christmas decorations business in the Philippines.

Carolina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell to her customers.

Carolina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Carolina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell to her customers

loans.name: Maram

texts.en:
Maram is a 22 year old university student majoring in Health Services Management, and she is in her last year. Her father is a retired man, and her mother is a nurse. 

Maram wants to help her family improve their living conditions after the financial crisis they have been facing, and she wants to find a job in her field after graduating. Now she is asking for this loan to pay for her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: to pay for her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Shera

texts.en:
Shera is a married woman. She operates a retail business where she sells fish. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are local residents. 

Shera describes her biggest business challenge to be delay in stock delivery. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of fish. Her business goal is to own a retail shop within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of fish

loans.name: Samwel

texts.en:
Samwel is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal. He has been involved in this business for four years. 

Samwel's business is located in a good area and his primary customers are local residents. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inflation. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of charcoal

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to do remodeling of her two-room apartment, replacing plumbing pipes, flooring and doors

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es:
Rosa tiene 34 años de edad, es casada, conocida en el medio por dedicarse a la crianza y venta de carneros. Vive en casa propia con esposo y 02 hijos de 19 y 05 años respectivamente y su padre, cónyuge trabaja en empresa Cayaltí, padre percibe pensión de jubilación. Rosa es una persona con buenas referencias familiares y laborales. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Cayaltí, provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad de clima caluroso dedicada a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería.

Rosa se dedica a la crianza y venta de carneros, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Su negocio se encuentra en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Necesita préstamo para invertir en arreglo de corrales donde cría sus animales, para poder criarlos en un mejor ambiente y con mejor calidad. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Rosa is 34 years old, married and is well-known in her local area for raising and selling sheep. Rosa lives with her husband and two children - ages 19 and 5 - in a house that the family owns. Rosa's husband works for a business. The family also lives with Rosa's father, who has an income from his pension. Rosa has good personal and professional references. Rosa lives in a community in the Cayaltí district of Chiclayo province, Lambayeque region, on Peru's northern coast. The climate is hot here and the inhabitants work in farming, cattle-raising and trade.

Rosa has been making a living raising and selling sheep for over two years. Her business is located at the back of her house. She needs this loan in order to invest in fixing pens in order to raise her animals in a better and higher quality space. This loan will, in the short term, allow Rosa to increase her income, earn higher profits and, as a result, improve her and her family's quality of life.

loans.use: to invest in fixing pens in order to raise her animals in a better and higher quality space.

loans.name: Kennedy

texts.en:
Kennedy is a 51-year-old man married to Margaret, who adds additional income to support their family. They are blessed with two children. Kennedy has been operating a transportation business for a period of eight years, earning himself an income of 15,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) at the end of every month.

Kennedy was introduced to VisionFund Kenya by a credit officer and is now servicing his first loan of 25,000 KES. He intends to use this amount to service his taxi and repair his seat belts, which are worn out.

Kennedy plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for his children and hopes to provide the best education to his children.

loans.use: to service his taxi and repair his seat belts, which are worn out.

loans.name: Desire

texts.en:
Desire is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Desire is 36 years old and has five children who are in school.

Desire has a ready-to-wear business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,500 loan  through NWTF to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers.

Desire has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of ready-to-wear to sell to her customers

loans.name: Stella

texts.en:
“Kenya’s farmers are generally small-scale farmers who cannot afford to follow industrialized conventional production. What they have is access to land, farmyard manure, and manpower,” Stella says. What they are missing, she says, is the know-how to create a productive farm. “The biggest aspect that is missing in this sector is information.” 

Stella is a very honest, hardworking, and dedicated farmer who is 40 years of age and lives in Litein, Kenya, an area known to have the best weather patterns that favor crops and animal farming. Stella has so much experience in farming, which she has been doing for 10 years. She is considered one of the best farmers in her village. 

Stella’s primary sources of income are selling tea, milk and eggs and crop farming. She is a very dedicated dairy farmer, and she has nicknamed her cow “Chebois” (cool cow). Dairy farming is close to her heart, and every day she wakes up to milk her cow, and that makes her very proud. 

Although Stella makes profits through milk selling, she is faced with the problem of feeding her cow. She is requesting a loan to buy a chaff cutter. A chaff cutter is a mechanical device used to cut hay into small pieces before being mixed with other forages. Through the loan, her cows will not reject any part of the food, hence increasing milk production and Stella's income level. All that Stella waits for is the lenders' goodwill and kindness.

loans.use: to buy a chaff cutter

loans.name: Larisa

texts.en:
Larisa is an entrepreneur from Zaporozhye. In 2011, she bought a vending kiosk at a big local marketplace to sell men's clothing merchandise, i.e., T-shirts, shirts, sweaters and jackets, as well men's and women's knitted wear, socks and tights. Her vending location has a nice layout. Larisa tracks down all new trends and always pays attention to details. 

Larisa needs 10,000 Grivnyas to restock her fall and winter merchandise and purchase additional pajamas, underwear and thermal layered underwear, which sells really well in the cold season. Larisa is a focused entrepreneur. She is planning to invest her additional profit in the further development of her trade and business.

loans.use: to restock her winter merchandise and purchase additional pajamas, underwear and thermal layered underwear,

loans.name: Oksana

texts.en:
Oksana invested financial resources she received from Kiva last time into additional merchandise which she managed to sell at a profit. Oksana used a portion of that profit to install new plastic windows that help keep warmth inside, which is very critical in this cold season in Ukraine when there are many issues with heating in the country.

Oksana divorced her husband and now lives with her mother. It has been a challenge having to deal with many problems all by herself now. However, Oksana doesn't want to give up and tries to concentrate on her work. She needs 10,000 Grivnyas to purchase household chemicals, detergents and makeup merchandise. Additional merchandise will help Oksana increase her sales turnover, and income as a result.

loans.use: to buy household chemicals, detergents and cosmetics

loans.name: Maria Asuncion Group

texts.es:
Maria Asuncion es un grupo formado en la ciudad de Caaguazú, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, que a través de la encuesta de los 50 indicadores podrán ir mejorando.
Todas son muy trabajadoras y emprendedoras, quien se destaca es la Sra. Sonia, mujer muy sacrificada, que lucha por su familia y sus seres queridos. Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de limpieza, y por medio de ello tiene los medios para dar a su familia lo que necesitan para el día a día.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de productos de limpieza para la venta, ya que así podrá seguir con su trabajo, luchando por un mejor destino.
texts.en:
Maria Asuncion is a group formed in the city of Caaguazú, and is part of a poverty elimination program, which through the 50 indicators poll they can keep improving. 

They are all very hardworking and entrepreneurial, and who stands out here is the Sra. Sonia, a very sacrificing woman who fights for her family and her loved ones. She works selling cleaning products, and from this has the means to give her family what they need from day to day. 

She asks for this loan to be able to invest in the purchase of cleaning products to be sold, since this way she can continue working, fighting for a better future.

loans.use: to buy cleaning products to be sold.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a single woman. She has two children with ages 3 years and 5 years. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in an area good for business. She also sells  phones and mobile phone accessories. 

She will use the 85,000 Kenyan shillings loan to buy more stock of clothes and mobile phones. Her business goal is to own a large shop within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes and mobile phones

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
Maria Elena, vive en casa propia con su cónyuge. Aproximadamente más de 20 años. Buenas referencias personales y familiares. De familia unida. Vive en una comunidad dedicada al comercio, agricultura y ganadería; ubicada en el distrito y provincia de Morropón, región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

Maria Elena se dedica al alquiler de máquinas para que jueguen Play Station, en el distrito de Cayaltí desde hace 05 años aproximadamente. El destino del préstamo es para la compra de videojuegos, sillas, mesas,estantes, entre otros accesorios para mejorar su servicio y hacer crecer su negocio. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena has lived in her own home with her husband for more than 20 years.  She has good personal and family references, and she is from a very united family.  She lives in a community where the people work in agriculture, commerce and animal husbandry.  This area is located in the Morropon district, in the province of the same name.  This is in the Piura region of northern coast of Peru. 

Maria Elena has a business in the Cayalti district renting Play Station video game consoles.  She's had the business for about 5 years.  She will use this loan to buy video games, chairs, tables, shelves, and other accessories to improve her business and make it grow.  In the short term, this will enable her to increase her income and earnings, and thereby improve her quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy video games, chairs, tables, shelves, and other accessories for her business

loans.name: Jonah

texts.en:
Jonah is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 10 years. Jonah earns more income from food vending.

Jonah is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store. She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Discipline Group

texts.en:
The members of this group are part of Discipline group from Teshie-Accra, Ghana. The group is composed of three members who earn their living by selling yam, turkey tail and waakye (cooked rice and beans). They need additional capital to maintain, enhance or expand their businesses and decided to apply for a loan from ID Ghana. They are excited and full of hope to begin this new loan with solid goals and dreams. 

Mary is a 48-year-old married woman. In the picture, she is standing second from the left. She completed six years of formal education, but due to the poor economic condition of her family, had to leave her education behind. Mary is engaged in the selling of waakye (cooked rice and beans). She is applying for her third loan from ID Ghana. The requested funds will be used to purchase rice, beans, fish, cooking oil and other ingredients to prepare waakye to sell to her customers. On behalf of her colleagues, Mary expresses gratitude and appreciation for the support from Kiva investors throughout the world who lend such necessary and vital support.

loans.use: To purchase rice, beans, fish, cooking oil and other ingredients to prepare waakye to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Loma Florida Group

texts.es:
El comité se llama Loma florida es un grupo de 18 mujeres trabajadoras y emprendedoras, con sentido de cooperación y solidaridad. 
Entre estas señora se destaca a Adriana dueña de  una despensita donde ofrece diferentes alimentos y productos de las necesidades básicas del hogar, como se encuentran un alejados de la cuidad, ella abastece a todos los vecinos de esa zona. 
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, enlatados, frutas, productos a granel y demás. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Loma Florida committee is a group of 18 hardworking and entrepreneurial women who have a sense of cooperation and solidarity.

Among these women is Adriana, the owner of a little store which offers different foods and basic necessary products for the home. As they are located in the outskirts of the city, she supplies all of the neighbours in that zone. 

She asks for this loan to be able to buy various products for her store, such as vegetables, meat, canned goods, fruits, bulk products, and more. She is thankful for this opportunity, which will be very helpful to her.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, meat, canned goods, fruits, bulk products, and more.

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is 45 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Esmeralda works very hard to provide for them.

Esmeralda runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like candies, canned goods, noodles, sugar, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Esmeralda has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items. 

In the future, Esmeralda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like candies, canned goods, noodles, sugar, biscuits, detergent soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase many different kinds of foods and other items to be able to meet all the demand of her customers

loans.name: Harun

texts.en:
Harun is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be experienced. He operates a general store business where he sells flour, sugar, eggs and other items. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a viable location and his primary customers are local residents. 

Harun describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour and other items. His business goal is to be successful within five years. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: buy more stock of sugar, flour and other items

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 54 years old and married with four children currently in school. She works very hard to provide for them. Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Maribeth has been in this business for 20 years and sells a variety of items such as coffee, detergent soap, shampoo, juice, soft drinks, beers, etc.  In the future, Maribeth would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 52 years old. She is married to Evans, and together they have been blessed with two children of 18 and 12 years, respectively.

Florence sells firewood, as well as maize. She has been running this business for the last 16 years, earning a monthly income of KES 2,000.

Florence has requested her fifth loan from VisionFund Kenya of KES 25,000. She will the funds use to add to her stock of firewood and maize to sell.

With the anticipated profits from her business, Florence will be able to expand her business as well as pay school fees for her children. Her husband is not working hence does not provide additional income for the family.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to own a shop and to see her children educated to the levels they desire.

loans.use: to add stock of firewood and maize

loans.name: Joyce

texts.en:
Joyce is a 42-year-old, single woman who is taking care of three children and has been operating a retail business shop for a period of six years, earning herself an income of KES 15,000 at the end of every month.

Joyce is now servicing her ninth loan, in the amount of KES 35,000, with VisionFund Kenya and she intends to use this amount to buy sugar, bread, milk, wheat flour, maize flour, and detergents to sell to her customers on a daily basis.

Joyce plans to use the anticipated income to pay school fees for her children and she hopes to have a bright future with a successful life.

loans.use: to buy sugar, rice, wheat flour, maize flour, and detergents.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tables and chairs so she can serve all her customers in front of her house, because demand is growing every day

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to build more rental house.

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is 63 years old and widowed with five children. She sells groceries and fruits, a business she has done for the last 14 years, earning a monthly income of KES 7,000. Ruth has requested her 4th loan term with VisionFund Kenya for KES 30,000, which she will use to purchase a stock of vegetables to sell.

With the anticipated profits, Ruth will be able to improve the living standards of her family. Her hopes and dreams for the future are to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is 31 years old. She is married to Benson and together they have been blessed with three children of 8, 4 and 2 years respectively. Getrude runs a salon, a business she has done for the last three years, earning a monthly income of KES 18,000.

Getrude has requested her 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of KES 22,500 that she will use to buy salon equipment like a blow dryer, as well as hair products like relaxers, hair shampoo and different hair oils. With the anticipated profits from her business, Getrude will be able to build rental houses as a way of increasing her source of income. Her hopes and dreams are to have a stable source of income and to educate her children for life.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy more stock of drinks, flour, sugar and other items

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy and sell vehicle business in the Philippines.

Vilma requested a PHP 29000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicles. She has been in this business for 20 years now.

Vilma would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts and tools for the maintenance of her vehicles.

loans.name: Anarkan

texts.ru: Анаркан очень дисциплинированная, она успешно погасила предыдущий кредит, без просрочек, использовав его по назначению. Анаркан очень благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Анаркан  есть 5 коров и 2 телят.  В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Анаркан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 6 телят для откорма и реализации. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Anarkan is very disciplined and has successfully repaid her previous loan without any delays, and using it as directed. Anarkan is very grateful to the Kiva Fund and everyone, who had helped her with the financing. Today, Anarkan's business contains 5 cows and 2 calves. In order to further develop her business, Anarkan requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy 6 calves for fattening up and resale. Anarkan plans to invest the earnings from the loan into continuing to increase her livestock quantities.

loans.use: to buy six calves for fattening up and resale

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Rutchel is 19 years old and is second of the five children in the family. Her mother Cheryl, a member of NWTF, supports the family through her fish vending business in the Philippines.

Rutchel is studying Hotel and Restaurant Management and is currently in the fourth year of this 4-year course.

Cheryl is borrowing PHP 6000 to pay the tuition fees of her daughter Rutchel for the first semester of the school year 2014-2015.

Rutchel plans to graduate and be gainfully employed.

loans.use: to pay for tuition fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy a quality breed of sheep

loans.name: Josphat

texts.en:
Josphat is a married man. He has two children who are 12 and 9 years old. He describes himself as focused. He operates a barber shop where he shaves hair. He has been involved in this business for 10 years. His business is located in urban area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be competition. 

Josphat will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy furniture for his barber shop. His business goal is to open more branches within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy furniture for his barber shop

loans.name: Edwina

texts.en:
Edwina is 58 years old and married with five children.

She earns a living by having a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Edwina is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Edwina has been in pig fattening for four years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Felipa

texts.en:
As a married mother of 7 children, Felipa works hard to provide for her family.

Felipa has a food vending business in the Philippines. However, she also earns additional income from pig rearing. Felipa is requesting a 12,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation so she can purchase ingredients such as flour, yeast, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for making the food she sells.  

Felipa has been sustaining her business with help from her past 6 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to be able to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, yeast, cooking oil, sugar, etc. for her food production business.

loans.name: Zhumabek

texts.ru: Жумабек, 53 года, женат, есть пятеро детей, они все взрослые и самостоятельные, проживают отдельно, двое младших - студенты. У Жумабека среднее образование, с 1991 года он занимается сельским хозяйством. В хозяйстве есть 7 коров, 11 овец, 8 коз и 3 лошади. Жумабек обратился в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от ведения бизнеса Жумабек планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие его бизнеса и хочет накопить средства на постройку нового дома.
texts.en: Zhumabek is 53 years old, married and has five children, all of whom are grown and independent, living separately, and two of his youngest are students. Zhumabek has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 1991. His business contains 7 cows, 11 sheep, 8 goats and 3 horses. Zhumabek requested a loan in the amount of 150,000 som (KGS) from the "Bai-Tushum" Bank to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount. Zhumabek plans to invest the earnings from the loan into further developing his business and wants to save money to build a new house.

loans.use: to buy calves in order to increase livestock headcount

loans.name: Frida

texts.en:
Frida is a 41-year-old mother of two, living in Kiungone, a remote village in the Nkubu area of Kenya. Like many smallholder farmers in Kenya, she owns a tiny inherited plot of land to live off of, just under half an acre, and has always struggled to support her family. Her primary source of income has been crops and some small personal business she engages in to supplement her meager income. 

Frida passionately loves dairy farming, but one challenge she has been facing is lack of water for home consumption and irrigating her farm. Most of the rainwater goes to waste and therefore Frida is seeking a loan from Kiva lenders to buy a water tank. With the water tank she will be able to harvest and store rainwater in the tank. This loan will be of much help because Frida will not be walking for long distances in search of this precious commodity. The tank will assist her in irrigating her farm, hence increasing productivity and income levels. All that Frida waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a water tank.

loans.name: Ana Maria

texts.en:
Ana Maria is 37 years old and married. She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. Ana Maria is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

Ana Maria has been in this business for five years and also earns additional income from food vending. She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy vitamins and other supplies for her livestock.

loans.name: Sakabi-Dia 1 Group

texts.fr: Melanie est une femme battante qui fait du soumbala à base de grain de neeré pour vendre. Le soumbala est un produit  local burkinabé utilisé dans la préparation de différents repas. Le soumbala est très bien pour la santé puisqu'il est conseillé pour les personnes qui ont l’hypertension artérielle. Avec ce prêt, Melanie va acheter les grains de neeré pour fabriquer le soumbala pour vendre. En plus de la vente du soumbala, cette brave dame fabrique du savon aussi pour vendre. Ce prêt sera vraiment utile pour Melanie. En ce qui concerne le remboursement, le problème ne se posera pas puisque Melanie et les autres membres respectent toujours leurs engagements. les bénéfices permettront à Melanie de prendre soins de ses 6 enfants et de renforcer son commerce.
texts.en: Melanie is a fighting woman who makes "soumbala", a dish made from neeré grains, and sells it. Soumbala is a local Burkina Faso product and is used in the preparation of various dishes. It is very good for the health and is recommended for people with high blood pressure. With this loan Melanie is going to buy neeré grains to make up soumbala to sell. As well as selling soumbala, this good woman makes soap which she also sells. This loan will be very useful for Melanie. As far as repayment of the loan is concerned there will be no problems since Melanie and the other group members always fulfil their commitments. The profits Melanie makes will enable her to take care of her six children and boost her business.

loans.use: to buy neeré grains to make soumbala which she will sell.

loans.name: Vainega1 Group

texts.fr: Vainega 1 est un groupe de 8 femmes battantes qui travaillent dans divers domaine d'activité. Sarata, emprunteur représentatif est mariée et vend le bois de chauffe depuis 9 ans. Avec ce prêt, Sarata pourrait payer un chargement de bois stocker pour vendre. Elle pourrait également demander le service de 2 à 3 personnes pour fendre le bois afin de facilité l'utilisation au ménage. Le bénéfice permettra à Sarata de contribuer aux dépenses de sa famille et de continuer son activité.
texts.en: Vainega 1 is a group of eight fighting women who work in various fields. Sarata, who is the representative borrower of the group, is married and has been selling firewood for the past nine years. With this loan she will be able to pay for a load of wood to stock and then sell. She will also be able to ask for two or three people to chop the wood for her so that it is easier to use. The profit will enable Sarata to contribute to her family's outgoings and continue her business.

loans.use: to buy firewood to sell.

loans.name: Tatyana

texts.en:
Tatyana is 42. She is married with two sons. Tatyana lives in Zaporozhye. She has worked as a private entrepreneur since 2003. She owns three nice kiosks where she sells small wares like wallets, bags, suitcases. Being a determined entrepreneur, Tatyana has always tried to re-invest her profit in her business, growing her sales and clientele.

Tatyana is planning to expand her business: she wants to start selling bread in addition to her regular business operations. She needs 30,000 hrivnyas (UAH) to buy a kiosk – a small facility for retail bread and bakery sales. She also needs to find a good employee who would work in her bread kiosk selling merchandise. Tatyana believes her new startup will bring her additional income, because bread always sells well and people will come for it again and again.

loans.use: to open a vending kiosk selling bread and baked goods as part of her business expansion

loans.name: Emmanuel

texts.en:
Emmanuel is a single man. He describes himself to be determined. He operates a retail business where he sells drinks, sugar, bread, beauty products and other items. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in an urban area and his primary customers are locals. 

Emmanuel describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy more stock of drinks, sugar, bread and other items. His business goal is to excel within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will prosper. He will use the anticipated profits to expand the business.

loans.use: buy more stock of drinks, sugar, bread and other items

loans.name: Nehemias

texts.es:
Nehemias tiene 24 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por su labor de ayudante de albañilería y construcción. Vive en casa familiar con cónyuge y 02 hijos de 03 años y 01 año respectivamente, hijos se quedan al cuidado de suegra, cuando ambos salen a trabajar, cónyuge trabaja como jornalera agrícola. Nehemias es un persona con buenas referencias laborales y familiares. Vive en una comunidad ubicada en el distrito de Lagunas, provincia de Chiclayo, región de Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Comunidad de clima caluroso dedicada a la pesca, a la ganadería y agricultura, habitada por gente sencilla y amable.

Nehemias se dedica a prestar servicio como ayudante de albañilería y construcción, desde hace más de 02 años aproximadamente. Adicionalmente trabaja cuando está en temporada como pescador artesanal. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de mercadería (ropa) pues desea invertir en este rubro por campaña navideña, y esto genera un ingreso adicional a su unidad familiar. Lo que le permitirá en un corto plazo mejorar sus ingresos, aumentar sus ganancias y por ende mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Nehemias, 24, is known in the area for his work as a bricklayer and construction assistant.  He lives in the family home with his wife and two children, ages 3 and 1, who are cared for by his mother-in-law when he and his wife go to work.  His wife works as an agricultural day laborer.

Nehemias has good work and family references.  He lives in the Lagunas district of the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque region on Peru's northern coast, an area with a warm climate.  The people there are modest and friendly, and they work in fishing, ranching, and agriculture.

Nehemias has earned a living for more than about two years offering services as a bricklayer and construction assistant.  He also works as a small-scale fisherman during the season.

He needs a loan to buy clothing merchandise because he wants to invest in that area for the Christmas season to earn additional income for his family.  In the short term this will allow him to improve his income and increase his profits, and his quality of life and his family's will improve as a result.

loans.use: to buy merchandise (clothing) to invest in the Christmas season

loans.name: Simon

texts.en:
Simon is a married man. He has 2 children with ages ranging from 5 years to 13 years. He describes himself as honest. He operates a retail business where he sells cups, basins, plates, and other items. He has been involved in this business for 15 years. His primary customers are the general public.

Simon will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock. His business goal is to expand within 5 years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cups, basins, plates, and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Sakabi-Dia 2 Group

texts.fr: Sakabi-Dia regroupe des femmes dynamiques qui se battent au quotidien pour réussir et prévoir un avenir meilleur pour leur famille. Ce groupe fait des remboursements correctes et à la bonne date. Marcelline est un vendeuse de légumes et cela fait 10 ans qu'elle fait cela. Elle est mariée et mère de 10 enfants dont le seul qui a été scolarisé travaille dans l'armée burkinabé. Les autres enfants font de petit métier pour pouvoir se prendre en charge dans l'avenir.Ce prêt permettra à Marcelline de s'approvisionner en légumes de bonnes qualités pour satisfaire à la demande de sa clientèle.  le bénéfice permettra à Marcelline de continuer son activité et de s'occuper de sa famille.
texts.en: Sakabi-Dia is a group of dynamic women who battle on a daily basis to succeed and provide a better future for their families. The group repays its loans fully and on time. Marcelline sells vegetables and has been doing this for the past ten years. She is married and mother to ten children, the only one of whom has been educated is in the Burkina Faso army. The other children have small jobs in order to be able to take care of themselves in the future. This loan will enable Marcelline to get fresh supplies of good quality vegetables to satisfy customer demand. The profit Marcelline makes will enable her to continue her business and take care of her family.

loans.use: to get fresh supplies of good quality vegetables to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 44 years old. She is married and has 5 children.

Marilyn earns her living with her pig fattening business in the Philippines. She has requested a loan of 10,000 PHP through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation in order to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Marilyn has been in the pig fattening business for 3 years now. She also earns additional income from running a general store.

Marilyn works tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream: to build and expand her business so she can secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Benkadi Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Benkadi est composé des femmes mariées vivant avec leurs maris et leurs enfants dans des familles traditionnelles. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de parenté, de voisinage et d’amitié.Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (choux  pommes), oignons, macaroni, yaourt et  habits. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Mamou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une réputation dans la vente des condiments. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 10 sacs de chou pomme en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à  Kalaban-coura et en ambulant à une clientèle constituée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Mamou espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 85 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinjecté dans l’activité et subvenir aux petits besoins des enfants.
texts.en:
The Benkadi group is made up of married women who live with their husbands and children in traditional families. They average 40 years of age with four children each. They all live in Kalaban-coura, a district of Bamako, and they got to know each other as relatives, neighbors and friends. The group members have small businesses selling condiments (cabbage hearts), onions, macaroni, yoghourt and clothing. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses and are on their second group loan. 

Mamou (who is standing on the far right of the photo) has a reputation for selling condiments. She is planning to use her loan to buy ten sacks of cabbage hearts wholesale in Médine. She resells her goods in Kalaban-coura and on a door-to-door basis to a primarily female customer base. Mamou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 85,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profit to reinvest in her business and provide for her children's small needs.

loans.use: to buy condiments.

loans.name: Dambe Group

texts.fr:
Mariées majoritairement dans des ménages monogamiques, les huit membres du groupe Dambé ont en moyenne 36 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, tubercules(ignames), friperies, industriels et alimentation. Dans le but d’augmenter leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème  cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Safiatou (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de tubercules. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 5 sacs  d’ignames en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban coura à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Safiatou compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 80 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
The majority of the eight members of the Dambé group live in monogamous families and they average 36 years of age with five children each. They all live in Kalaban-coura, a district of Bamako, and they got to know each other as neighbors and through their income-generating activities in Kalaban-coura. The group members have small businesses selling tubers (yams), second-hand clothing, industrial products and food. They decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso in order to expand their businesses and are on their second group loan.

Safiatou (who is standing on the far right of the photo) is a significant seller of tubers. She is planning to use her loan to buy five sacks of yams wholesale in Médine. She resells her goods on a retail basis in Kalaban-coura to a primarily female customer base. Mamou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 80,000FCFA with this loan and will use the profit to reinvest in her business and provide for the household's small needs.

loans.use: to buy tubers.

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene 36 años, es conviviente, conocido en el medio, por prestar servicio de construcción. Vive en casa familiar con conyuge e hija de más de 02 años de edad; conyuge realiza labores domesticas. Emilio es una persona con buenas referencias laborales y personales y de familia muy unida. Vive en una comunidad habitada por gente amable y respetuosa, que se dedicadan a la agricultura y ganaderia; y está ubicada en el distrito de Pacanga, provincia de Chepén, región La Libertad, costa norte de Perú.

Emilio se dedica a la cría y venta de animales, como cuyes y cerdos, desde hace tres años. Además también se dedica a prestar servicio como maestro en construcción, por zona de residencia y alrededores, desde hace más de 10 años aproximadamente. Su negocio está ubicado en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Necesita préstamo para invertir en compra de tablas, andamios y otros, los cuales le servirán para poder trabajar en obras mas grandes, y a la vez podrá alquilarlas; lo que también le permitirá darle un valor agregado a su servicio el cual lo mejorará con todas estas herramientas; y de esta forma podrá captar a un número mayor de clientes, mejores ganancias y por ende una mejora en su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Emilio is 36, married, and lives with his wife and their son, who is just over two years old. Emilio, his wife, and daughter have formed a strong family  in a community of kindhearted and respectful people in Pacanga District in Chepén Province in the La Libertad region along the northern coast of Peru. Emilio is well-known around his community for providing construction services and has excellent business and personal references. 

Emilio has made a living by raising and selling animals, such as guinea pigs and pigs, for three years and also works as a master builder in his community and nearby towns for approximately 10 years. His business is located in the rear of his home. He needs a loan to purchase planks, scaffolding, and other building materials that will allow him to work on larger projects. He could also generate income by renting these materials to other builders, thus adding value to his business as well as strengthening it. With this loan and the investments he can make with it, Emilio can gain more clients, boost his income, and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase planks, scaffolding, and other building materials that will allow him to work on larger projects

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is a married woman with 3 children. She describes herself as self-reliant. 

Beatrice operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 6 years now. Her business is located in an urban area, and her primary customers are large-scale buyers. 

Beatrice describes her biggest business challenge to be the lack of capital. Thus Beatrice will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy more clothing inventory.

Beatrice hopes that, in the future, she will be able to boost her living standards. She will use her anticipated profits to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more inventory of clothing.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
Marites is 40 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marites has borrowed and paid 2 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and earns additional income from pig fattening and selling electronic reloads for mobile devices. She aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Percelina

texts.en:
Percelina is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a general store business in the Philippines.  She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

Percelina has been in this business for six years. She also earns more income from pig fattening. Percelina has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional items to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Benson

texts.en: Benson is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be God fearing. He operates a barber shop where he shaves hair. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are loyal. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy barber shop equipment. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved living standards. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy barber shop equipment.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is 43 years. He is married to Lydia and together they have been blessed with three children of 14, 12 and 8 years old. Lydia sells groceries, therefore provides additional income for the family.

Daniel is a welder, a business he has done for the last 13 years, earning a monthly income of 10,000 KES.

Daniel has requested for his 2nd loan with VisionFund Kenya of 25,000 KES which he will use to purchase more steel for welding. He had successfully repaid his previous loan.

With the anticipated profits from his business, Daniel will be able to expand his business further by getting more steel and iron materials for welding.

His hope and dream for the future to see his children educated for life.

loans.use: to purchase more steel for welding

loans.name: Rowena

texts.en:
Rowena is 27 years old and has six children. She is married and has four children who are currently in school. Rowena is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Rowena has requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed, vaccines and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Rowena would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed, vaccines, and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 50 years old and married with three children.

She earns a living by raising livestock in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business.

She has been raising livestock for 10 years and also earns additional income from a general store.

Zenaida is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feeds and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Tehrane

texts.en:
Tehrane is 28 years old. She is single and lives in the Absheron region of Azerbaijan with her lovely family.  

Tehrane began her business two years ago when she decided to open a shoe store and rented a shop.

Today she is requesting a loan of 2,300 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat) so she can buy a new order of shoes for the winter season. Tehrane gives a big thank you to the Kiva organization and its lenders for all their support. 

In the future, Tehrane would like to buy her own store so she can increase her monthly income and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy a new order of shoe stock for the winter.

loans.name: Oktay

texts.en: Oktay is 39 years old. He is married with two children. His elder son is 18 years old and studies at University. His other child is 17 years old and studies at eleventh class at school. Oktay has been in the tailoring business for a long time, and he sews clothes for men and children. Today he is planning to buy new materials to increase and improve his business. For this reason, he is requesting a loan amount of 1,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). He says he is thankful to Kiva organization for the loan. In the future, he wants to open his own studio, because he rents the area for now.

loans.use: to buy materials for his business.

loans.name: Phyllis

texts.en:
Phyllis is 45 years old and a single mother of 5 children. She sells potatoes and has been in this business for the last 12 years. Right now she gets a monthly income of KES 10,000 and her business has been profitable. 

Phyllis has requested her first loan with VisionFund Kenya which she will use to purchase more stock of potatoes to sell. With the anticipated profits, she will be able to pay school fees for her children. 

Her future hopes and dreams are to grow her business and make more income to be able to live a comfortable life.

loans.use: To buy more stock of potatoes to sell.

loans.name: Hussien

texts.en: Hussein is a 22-year-old single young man living in Baqaa, Jordan. He lives with his family that consists of five members. He is a Diploma student majoring in Air Conditioning Engineering, and he is at the beginning of his study journey. Hussein is seeking to expand his studies and get his Bachelor's degree. He has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay for his upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Najah

texts.en:
Najah is a 37-year-old single lady living in Madaba, Jordan with her family. 

Sewing was at first just one of Najah's interests, but over time she has made this hobby a source of income that is helping her to support her family financially. She started this business three years ago, and she is seeking to expand it in the future by opening her own sewing workshop. 

Najah is now seeking a loan to be able to purchase raw materials such as thread and fabric to raise her productivity and profit.

loans.use: To purchase more thread and fabric for her sewing business

loans.name: Anas

texts.en:
Anas is a 26-year-old, single man who has always depended on himself, not to put pressure on his family who has been facing financial problems. His father is a truck driver, and his income isn't enough to cover his family’s needs. 

Anas is a university student majoring in Accounting, and he is in his second year. He also works in the evening at a private company. Now he needs to pay for his upcoming university fees, but because he doesn't have enough money to do so, he has applied for this loan.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Mohammed

texts.en: Mohammed is a 24-year-old, single man with an elementary education, living with his parents in the capital city of Sana'a. He is from a poor family and works as a solider with a small salary, which is not enough to cover the necessary needs of his family. Over time, Mohammed saved an amount of money and built his own house. That business cost him a lot of money. Now, he needs financial support to make a roof for his house, but he doesn't have enough money to do. For this reason, he applied for a Youth loan of 100,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase building wood and cement to make a roof for his house to make it ready for living. Mohammed looks forward to opening any commercial business that will help him in provide his family with a better future.

loans.use: to purchase building wood and cement to make a roof for his house to make it ready for living.

loans.name: Sakabi-Dia 3 Group

texts.fr: Maïmouna est marié et mère d'un enfant scolarisé. Elle fait le commerce du charbon de bois et cela fait 5 ans qu'elle le fait. Etant donnée que beaucoup de ménage utilise encore le bois ou le charbon pour faire la cuisine, le commerce de Maïmouna est rentable donc elle pourra faire les remboursement sans problème. le bénéfice lui permettra de faire plus d'approvisionnement et de contribuer à la charge familiale.
texts.en: Maïmouna is married and the mother of a school-going child. She sells charcoal and has been in that business for five years. Since many households still use wood or charcoal for cooking, Maimouna's business is profitable so she will be able to reimburse the loan with no problem. The profit will allow her to stock up further and to contribute to supporting her family.

loans.use: to buy at least 15 sacks of charcoal for resale

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is 35 years old. She is a widowed mother blessed with 3 children aged 19, 15 and 10 years.

Hellen sells french fries, but she also recently diversified to selling second-hand coats. She has been making and selling french fries for the last 5 years, earning a monthly income of 15,000 KES.

Hellen has requested her first loan of 15,000 KES with VisionFund Kenya, which she will use to buy supplies of potatoes for making her french fries.

With the anticipated profits from her business, Hellen will be able to expand her business further by being able to also cover the school fees for her children.

Her hopes and dreams for the future are to see her children educated, to have her business remain stable, and to realize consistent profits.

loans.use: to buy supplies of potatoes for making french fries.

loans.name: Tamer

texts.en: Tamer is 20 years old and lives with his four family members in Irbid, Jordan. He is a student at university majoring in genetics science, and will seek a job in his field after graduating from university. Now, Tamer is applying for this loan to pay his upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay his study fees

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a married father of two children. He describes himself as honest and hard working. He operates a tailoring shop where he makes clothes. He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in an area with potential for growth and his primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be financial constraints. He will use the KES 98,000 loan to buy more tailoring materials. His business goal is to expand within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have improved his living standard. He will use the anticipated profits to buy more stock of tailoring materials. He also does farming to earn additional income.

loans.use: to buy more tailoring materials

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy seed, fertilizer and other items

loans.name: Salome

texts.en: Salome is a married mother of one child. She describes herself as polite. She operates a restaurant where she sells food and drinks. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are individuals. She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a big hotel within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved her living standard. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: David

texts.en: David is a married father of three children, ages 3 to 12 years. He describes himself as a go-getter. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for eight years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are individuals. He will use the KES 100,000 loan to buy more clothes to sell. His business goal is to have wholesale business within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will own a big shop. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes.

loans.name: Manolo

texts.en:
Manolo, who works alongside his business partner, Lucho (pictured at left), is an artisan from Peru who specializes in leather work. He would like to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood and leather.

Manolo has been selling through NOVICA since 2005. This is his story:

"I was born in Cuzco on May 25, 1945. I come from a family with a background in art. The work is an artistic creation. We've worked together since 1994, and find it a source of great personal satisfaction and we strive to transmit beauty and culture. My designs are created and crafted with originality, beauty, quality and affection. They are made by artisans who really love their work."

"Thanks to this microcredit, I will be able to create new designs and styles, and move to the cutting edge of our craft without losing sight of the artisanal essence and origins of our work."

Use the link below to view Manolo's leather work on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5069

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of raw materials, including wood and leather

loans.name: Armie

texts.en: Armie, 34 years old, is married and has three children, one currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Armie has had a paper mache making business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to buy more materials such as parers, paste, etc. for her business. Armie would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to buy more materials such as parers, paste, etc. for her business

loans.name: Thaer

texts.en: Thaer is a 25-year-old ambitious young man. He is single and lives in Irbid, Jordan with his four family members. Thaer is a student in university majoring in electronics engineering and is in his final year of study. He wants to work in his field after graduating to support himself and to help support his family financially. Thaer has applied for this loan to pay his study fees.

loans.use: To pay his study fees

loans.name: Yasmin

texts.en: Yasmin is a 24-year-old university student majoring in special education and is in her final year. She is living with her six family members. Yasmin wants to work in her field of study after getting her bachelor's degree to help her parents improve their living conditions. Now she is applying for this loan to pay her upcoming semester fees.

loans.use: To pay her upcoming semester fees

loans.name: Teodoro

texts.en:
Teodoro is a Peruvian artisan who creates hand-crafted silver jewelry with his family. Pictured here with his sister, Ruth (at left), he would like to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for his designs.

Teodoro has been selling through NOVICA since 2012. This is his story:

"My artistic formation came from my dad during his work as an archeologist in pre-Hispanic sites, and later as the curator of a museum. That's when I became inspired to craft jewelry with designs and motifs unique to ancient Peru. One of my most cherished moments was when I had a small workshop and my children, Carlos and Alicia, where with me while I was cutting gems by hand. Then we put them through a little machine to perfect the contours. I love the idea that foreigners can get to share part of our history through my designs, where I try to replicate with both metals and gems."

"I plan to use this microcredit to craft more pieces ahead of the busy holiday season. I'm hoping this will lead to big sales this year."

Use the link below to view Teodoro's sterling silver and gemstone jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/8651

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of silver and gemstones for his designs

loans.name: Adriana

texts.en:
Adriana is an artisan in Peru who specializes in hand-crafted jewelry. She would like to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver and leather for her creations.

Adriana has been selling through NOVICA since 2006. This is her story:

"I began crafting jewelry as a hobby, something to do in my free time when not looking after my daughters. But it snowballed and today I dedicate all my time to this craft. It's an enormous satisfaction when someone asks me to make a piece and I can see the happiness on her face. This fills me with pride and makes me look for better designs and craft better pieces day after day. To see people contented with my jewelry… my designs are an expression of art and I need to feel inspired the entire time so that each one comes out the way I want it to."

"I am grateful to everyone who is supporting me through this microcredit at a time when I really need the capital. As a way of saying thanks, I promise to always craft my pieces with great dedication and love, so that the final piece received by my customers will be of the highest quality possible. Many thanks and God bless."

Use the link below to view Adriana's handcrafted jewelry on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/5991

loans.use: to invest in a bulk purchase of sterling silver and leather for her creations

loans.name: Shatha

texts.en: Shatha is a 32-year-old married mother of two children who lives in a governorate of Jordan called Irbid. Her husband runs a clotheing store. Shatha is studying finance in university. Seeing that her husband's income isn't enough to cover her children's needs, she is aiming to graduate and find a job in her field of study to help him improve the family's living conditions. She is applying for this loan to pay her upcoming semester fees,

loans.use: To pay her university fees

loans.name: Salomon

texts.en:
Salomon is an artisan from Peru who specializes in ceramic masks. He would like to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including clay, paint and molds.

Salomon has been selling through NOVICA since 2000. This is his story:
