"I am a self-taught artist, dedicating myself to ceramics since my youth. I specialize in masks influenced by the Vicus, Moche, and Nazca cultures. I focus largely on the mix of form and color. Despite a lack of formal training, I have created a unique, personal style. I hope to improve my work with each passing day and achieve a style that is gratifying for me and that will resonate in people's hearts and minds."

"I am very thankful for this microcredit. It will allow me to continue crafting pieces in this unique style that I have been perfecting over the years. For artisans of my age, continuing with our craft keeps us busy, and it means so much to see our effort and dedication rewarded."

Use the link below to view Salomon's ceramic masks on the NOVICA site:
http://www.novica.com/kiva/810

loans.use: to invest in a purchase of raw materials, including clay, paint and molds

loans.name: Artia

texts.en:
Artia, 29 years old, is married and has three children. She works hard to provide for her family. For the past 5 years, Artia has run a general store in the Philippines. She also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing. 

Artia has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock such as candies, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell. Artia has previously borrowed and repaid 9 loans from NWTF. She aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock such as candies, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Hayde

texts.en:
Hayde is 49 years old and married with five children, one currently in school, Hayde works very hard to provide for her family

Hayde runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Hayde has been in this business for 15 years and sells a variety of items such as detergent soap, shampoo, body soap, toothpaste, canned goods, and noodles. 

Hayde would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Helen

texts.en:
Helen is 48 years old, married and has six children, four currently in school.

Helen is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines. Helen requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business.

Helen has been raising livestock for 12 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Helen would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock, feed and other supplies for her business

loans.name: Belinda

texts.en: Belinda, 50 years old, is widowed and has four children. She works very hard to provide for them. For the past 5 years, Belinda has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, sugar, detergent, soap, shampoo, etc. She has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her store. In the future, Belinda would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her store

loans.name: Conchita

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Conchita works hard to support her family.

She has a chainsaw service business in the Philippines, and earns additional income from buying and selling lumber.  Conchita is borrowing PHP 45,000 through NWTF to purchase gasoline and other tools for her chainsaw service business.

Conchita has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline and other tools for her business

loans.name: Emelina

texts.en:
Emelina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. Emelina is 37 years old and has two children who are currently in school.

Emelina has a rice grains business in the Philippines. Emelina requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more sacks of rice to sell.

Emelina has been in this business for five years. In the future, Emelina would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice to sell

loans.name: Esmeralda

texts.en:
Esmeralda is a 56-year-old married mother of one child who is still in school.

Esmeralda is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Esmeralda requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Esmeralda has been in pig fattening for 15 years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Esmeralda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria works hard to support her family. Gloria is married and has a food-vending business in the Philippines.

Gloria requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients and items for her food-vending business.

Gloria has been in this business for 20 years now.

Gloria would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and items for her food-vending business

loans.name: Heronica

texts.en:
Heronica is a 49-year-old married woman with five children, one still in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Heronica has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. Heronica requested a PHP 12,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Heronica has been in this business for 10 years. Heronica would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Thùy

texts.en:
Thùy works in agriculture farming food and has been involved in this business for five years..

Thùy is 24 years old and is married with one child.
She lives and works in Thanh Hoa city, a urban area in Thanh Hoa province.

This is Thùy's first loan with Thanh Hoa Fund for Poor Women.
.
The main hardship that Thùy faces in her life is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a hygienic latrine.

With her business profit, Thùy hopes for her family to be healthy and happy, for her business to do well, and for her children to do well in school.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement and brick to build a hygienic latrine.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan is 41 years old and lives in the Dong Kor district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia. He had been married since 1996 and has two sons and one daughter. Two of this children are attending school.
Chan is a farmer who raises cows and has also been a motor taxi driver for 12 years. His wife has been a garment factory worker for 10 years He would like to apply for a loan to buy a motorbike to transport his wife to work.

loans.use: To buy a new motorbike

loans.name: Estrellita

texts.en:
Estrellita is 49 years old and married with two children, both currently in school, Estrellita works very hard to provide for her family.

Estrellita runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, beers, and sugar to sell.

In the future, Estrellita would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft-drinks, noodles, beers, and sugar to sell

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en: Jocelyn, 55 years old, is married and has five children, two currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 15 years, Jocelyn has operated a fish vending business in the Philippines. Jocelyn has requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fish to sell to her customers. In the future, Jocelyn would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell to her customers

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine, 42 years old, is married and has eight children, five of them currently in school. Josephine is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Josephine has been raising pigs for 4 years and has previously borrowed 4 times from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Hamza Al- Sonina Group

texts.en:
Hamza Al-Sonina is a group which consists of four women from Sana'a city, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER from Al-Amal Microfinance Bank.

Elham is the leader of the group. She is a 25-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, living in an old house which needs a renovation. Elham's husband is an employee and also a soldier with a small salary. That salary is not enough to cover the necessary needs of the family and to pay for the renovation of the house. Elham decided to help her husband, and for this reason, she turned to AMB and took out a loan of 80,000 YER to purchase new windows, doors, and flagstones for the floors of the rooms.
 
Elham looks forward to make her house more comfortable and spacious.

loans.use: to purchase new windows, doors, and flagstones for the floors

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
Lourdes is 68 years old and married with five children.  

Lourdes is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lourdes requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Lourdes has been in pig fattening for 30 years now, and has borrowed 13 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Lourdes would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Ludivica

texts.en:
Ludivica is 40 years old and married with two children, both currently in school. Ludivica works very hard to provide for her family.

Ludivica runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Ludivica has been in this business for five years and sells a variety of items such as shampoo, sanitary pads, bath soap, hair conditioners, fabric conditioners, and candies. 

In the future, Ludivica would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Marifel

texts.en:
Marifel is a 32-year-ld married woman with three children, two currently in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Marifel has a general store business in the Philippines. Marifel requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Marifel has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, Marifel would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina works hard to support her family. Merlina is married and has a buy-and-sell dried coconut meat business in the Philippines.

Merlina requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell.

Merlina has been in this business for 10 years now.

Merlina would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of dried coconut meat to sell

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en: Josephine, 48 years old, is married and has five children, two of them currently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. For the past 10 years, Josephine has operated a business buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. Josephine has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell. In the future, Josephine would like to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Lilian

texts.en: Lilian, 45 years old, is married and has five children, one currently in school. Lilian works very hard to provide for her family. For the past 10 years, Lilian has run a general store in the Philippines, selling a variety of items such as cereals, coffee, shampoo, juice, milk, noodles, cooking oil, bread, etc. She has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more stock of these items. Lilian would like to build and expand her business to secure her family's future.

loans.use: to purchase more stock such as cereals, coffee, shampoo, juice, milk, noodles, cooking oil, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Maricel

texts.en:
Maricel is 33 years old, married and has three children, two currently in school.

Maricel is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Maricel requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Maricel has been in pig fattening for 12 years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Maricel would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Miguelita

texts.en:
Miguelita is 41 years old and married with five children, all currently in school, Miguelita works very hard to provide for her family.

Miguelita runs a general store in the Philippines. She has been in this business for two years and sells a variety of items. Miguelia requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like candies, snack foods, creamer, milk, noodles, cereals, and beer to sell.

In the future, Miguelita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like candies, snack foods, creamer, milk, noodles, cereals, and  beer to sell

loans.name: Norma

texts.en:
Norma is 49 years old and married with two children.  

Norma is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Norma requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Norma has been in pig fattening for 20 years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

Norma would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Perlita

texts.en:
Perlita is a 31-year-old married mother of three children who are all in school. She is a very hard-working entrepreneur. 

Perlita has a general store business in the Philippines. Perlita requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Perlita has been in this business for five years. In the future, Perlita would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosita

texts.en:
Rosita is 71 years old and married with five children. Rosita works very hard to provide for her family.

Rosita runs a general store in the Philippines. Rosita has been in this business for 14 years and sells a variety of items. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, cooking oil, and vinegar to sell.

Rosita would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional items like canned goods, snack foods, soft drinks, coffee, cooking oil, and vinegar to sell

loans.name: Rufina

texts.en:
Rufina works hard to support her family. Rufina is married and has a general store business in the Philippines.

Rufina requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store.

Rufina has been in this business for 11 years now.

Rufina would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Rosalinda

texts.en:
Rosalinda is 43 years old and married with one child.

Rosalinda works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, diapers, shampoo, sanitary pads, bread, etc. to sell.

Rosalinda has borrowed and paid back two loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for nine years and also earns an income from electronic mobile load retailing.

Rosalinda aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional items like canned goods, cooking oil, diapers, shampoo, sanitary pads, bread, etc. to sell

loans.name: Nientaga Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Nientaga  est composé de six femmes mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 40 ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont  connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce d’ustensiles plastiques, bananes plantains, ignames et friperies. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Kadiatou  (femme arrêtée à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des ustensiles plastiques de meilleures qualités. Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  60 pièces d’ustensiles plastiques  en gros à Bamako. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura à une clientèle majoritairement composée de femmes. Madame Kadiatou  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Nientaga group is made up of six women who are all married and living in polygamous households. On average they are 40 years old with five children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of the districts in Bamako, and met through living in the same neighbourhood. The members of this group, sell plastic utensils, banana plantains, yams and secondhand clothing. Hoping to be able to purchase their stock by cash payment, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their second solidarity loan.
Mrs. Kadiatou (the woman on the extreme right in the photo) has a very good reputation for the quality of her plastic utensils. She plans to use her loan to buy 60 units of plastic utensils from the wholesalers in Bamako. She sells the product retail in Kalaban-Coura to a mainly female clientele. Mrs. Kadiatou hopes to make an average monthly profit of 95 000 FCFA which she will use to reinvest in her business. Her ambition in this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso is to buy a plot of land for lodgings.

loans.use: To buy plastic utensils.

loans.name: Yousef

texts.en:
Yousef is a 21-year-old, ambitious university student. He is studying Law in his third year and he is seeking to be a professional lawyer in the future. Yousef also works in the evenings at a shopping mall since he is also trying to depend on himself financially. He is seeking to work in his field after getting his bachelors' degree. 

Now, Yousef has applied for this loan to be able to pay for his upcoming tuition fees.

loans.use: to pay for his university fees.

loans.name: Remedios

texts.en:
Remedios works hard to support her family. She is married and has a vegetable vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Remedios requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more vegetables to sell to her customers.

Remedios would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 43 years old and married with five children. With two children currently in school, Lydia works very hard to provide for them.

Lydia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional stock like rice, canned goods, chocolate drinks, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Lydia has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as rice, canned goods, chocolate drinks, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc.

In the future, Lydia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock like rice, canned goods, chocolate drinks, sugar, shampoo, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.en: Nieves works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Nieves has requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers. She has been in this business for seven years now. Nieves would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fish to sell to her customers.

loans.name: Anie

texts.en:
Anie is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 11,500 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of blouses, shorts, pants and other ready to wear items to sell for her buy-and-sell ready to wear business.

Anie has been in this business for seven years. She earns more income from direct selling Avon products.

Anie has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of blouses, shorts, pants and other ready to wear items to sell.

loans.name: Laboriosas Group

texts.es:
Laboriosas se llama este grupo, justamente ya que ellas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, que con empeño y esfuerzo están logrando crecer. Están en su octavo ciclo del programa de comités, a la vez que hacen la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza.
Una de las integrantes, la Sra. Luisa, se dedica a la Costura, es decir tiene un pequeño taller en su casa, hace tiempo se dedica a esta actividad por lo tanto tiene mucha clientela y que siempre le llevan mucho trabajo. Según su primera encuesta se encuentra mejorando su línea de la pobreza, pero de igual manera ella invierte todo su esfuerzo para poder crecer y mejorar cada día.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos en cantidad de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo como lo viene haciendo, además de poder cumplir con la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The name of this group is Laboriosas (hard-working). These are all hard-working women. They have been able to thrive with determination and effort.

This is the eighth cycle of the committee program. They also do the survey on poverty fighting.
 
One of the members, Luisa, is a seamstress. She has a little workroom in her house. She has been doing this for some time. She has many customers, and they all bring her a lot of work. 

According to the first survey, she is improving her poverty line, at the same time she invests all her efforts to grow and improve every day.

She is requesting the loan to buy big amounts of fabrics and thread, so she can keep working as she's been doing, an also fulfill her clients' requests.

loans.use: to buy big amounts of fabric and thread to sew.

loans.name: Ninakanou Group

texts.fr:
Mariées uniquement dans des ménages monogamiques, les cinq membres du groupe Ninakanou ont en moyenne 40 ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, condiments (oignons) et pommes de terre. Dans l’intention d’accroitre leurs fonds de commerce, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 3èmecycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa     (femme arrêtée à l’extrême  gauche sur la photo) est une grande vendeuse de condiments (oignons). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter   5 sacs d’oignons en gros à Médine. La revente se fait en détails à Kalaban-coura en ambulant à une clientèle composée majoritairement de femmes. Madame Aminata compte avoir avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 95 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et satisfaire les petits besoins du foyer.
texts.en:
Married and all living in monogamous households, the five members of the Ninakanou group are on average 40 years old with four children. They all live in Kalaban-Coura, one of the districts of Bamako, and met through living in the same neighbourhood and their income making activities in Kalaban-Coura. The members of this group, sell condiments (onions) and potatoes. Hoping to be able to increase their business assets, the members of the group decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and this is their third solidarity loan.
Mrs. Awa (the woman on the extreme left in the photo) is a very good condiment seller. She plans to use her loan to buy five sacks of onions wholesale in Medine. She sells her products retail in Kalaban-Coura as an itinerant saleswoman to a mainly female clientele. Mrs. Aminata hopes to make an average monthly profit of 95 000FCFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business, and to buy small necessities for her household.

loans.use: To buy condiments.

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace is 36 years old and married with four children who all attend school.

Grace earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Grace has been raising pigs for five years and also earns additional income from food vending.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Danilin

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Danilin works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Danilin is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Danilin has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is 39 years old and married with three children. With one child currently in school, Maribeth works very hard to provide for them.

Maribeth runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional items like bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

Maribeth has been in this business for three years and sells a variety of items such as bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc.

Maribeth would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy additional items like bread, canned goods, coffee, sugar, soft drinks, detergent soap, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen has a backyard business raising cattle to earn a living. She uses the benefit of having a few hectares of land at her home to raise large cattle. Her previous loan has been repaid successfully for she also has another source of income from her farm products.

Carmen took a new loan recently to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her farm to have a good harvest.

In the future, Carmen plans to buy two more cattle to raise. She wants to have more cattle as her savings for the future needs of her family.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to fertilize her farm to have a good harvest

loans.name: Damas Unidas Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Damas Unidas está en su ciclo número 4 del programa de comité de mujeres, es de la ciudad de Concepción, la cual es una zona un poco alejada de la zona céntrica y aun se encuentra en crecimiento, es eminentemente rural.
La Sra.  Maria es una de las integrantes, quien todos los días sale a vender a sus comidas ya sea dulce o salado, y por la tarde trabaja como limpiadora en un lugar público. Es una mujer muy luchadora que se esta esforzando por mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia que siempre está con ella.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para hacer sus comidas dulces y saladas, como ser dulces, harina, verduras, condimentos y demás. Agradecen todas por esta oportunidad que reciben.
texts.en:
The group called Damas Unidas (Ladies United) is in its fourth cycle of the women's committee programme. The group comes from Concepcion city, which is a rather remote area of the central zone and although still growing, is largely rural.

Maria is one of the members. Every day she goes out to sell her sweet and savoury meals and snacks, and in the evening she works as a cleaner in a public building. She  is a very determined woman who is striving to improve her quality of life and that of her family who are always with her.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy supplies to make her sweet and savoury foods, such as sweets, flour, vegetables, condiments and more. 

They are all very grateful for having this opportunity

loans.use: to buy sweets, flour, vegetables, condiments and more

loans.name: Roldan

texts.en: Roldan, 41, is married with two children, settled for living in Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. He manages his own farm for a living. His farm is doing well and he had a better income from this and was able to buy a secondhand motorcycle. Recently, he took  a new loan from GDMPC microcredit to cover motorcycle repair costs for safe services. He wants to have a comfortable house and improved living situation for the entire family in the near future.

loans.use: to cover motorcycle repair costs for safe services.

loans.name: Myrna

texts.en:
A married mother of two children, Myrna works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines and also earns income from a general store. Myrna is borrowing PHP 18,000 through NWTF to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

Myrna has been sustaining her business activities through her past three loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream: to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy kitchenware and ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Juanita

texts.en:
Juanita is 54 years old and married. She is in the agricultural business, raising livestock in the Philippines.

She has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock.

Juanita has been raising livestock for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase vitamins, feeds and other supplies for her livestock

loans.name: Linalyn

texts.en:
Linalyn is a married woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 36 years old and has two children who are in school.

Linalyn has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more items like sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

Linalyn has been in this business for two years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more items like sugar, soap, noodles and other groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for products and equipment for her grocery store

loans.name: Bernadith

texts.en:
Bernadith is 48 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Bernadith has borrowed and repaid 21 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from e-loading (mobile prepaid load).

Bernadith aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina is 49 years old and has five children. She is married and has three children who are still in school. She is in the agricultural business of pig fattening in the Philippines. Marcelina has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

She has been in pig fattening for five years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Marcelina would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El señor Pedro tiene 50 años, vive en pareja con la señora Manuela quien se dedica a la compra-venta de bebidas, tienen 2 hijos ya mayores de edad e independientes quienes viven con él y lo ayudan a la manutención del hogar que ya trabajan como empleados.
El señor Pedro es de profesión taxista, realiza esta actividad hace mas de 2 años, anteriormente trabajaba como chófer de una empresa de transporte por mas de 19 años, luego lo indemnizaron y compro un vehículo con el cual realiza su actividad actual.
El préstamo que el señor Pedro solicita es para la compra de bebidas en general para la bodega que su esposa administra, dicha actividad ayuda a la familia ya que le generan buen ingreso, agradece a la Fundación Paraguaya y a Kiva por la oportunidad recibida.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro is 50 years old and in a relationship with Sra. Manuela, who buys and sells beverages. They have two grown children who are independent, but they live with them. His children help with sustaining the household since they work as employees.

Sr. Pedro has worked as a taxi driver for more than two years. He previously worked as a driver for a transportation company for more than 19 years. After he was compensated upon leaving that job, he purchased a vehicle for starting his current business.

The loan Sr. Pedro is requesting will be used to buy beverages for the store that his wife manages. This business helps his family and generates a good income. He is grateful to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva for the opportunity he has received.

loans.use: to buy beverages to sell in his wife's store.

loans.name: Prokoros

texts.en:
This is the story of Mircloue, son of Prokoros:

Mircloue is my name. I come from a poor family. My father works as a farmer. His income is uncertain, because the harvest comes only 2 times a year, just from my parents' paddy fields. For daily needs, my father works odd jobs and sometimes does building work. Anyway, if there is a job, my father participates. My mother does not work because my young sister is 1 year old.

loans.use: to pay for education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en:
Ruth is a 23-year-old married woman with two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Ruth has a pottery business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

Ruth has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials for her pottery business.

loans.name: Gantumur

texts.en:
Gantumur, 46 years old, lives with her son and daughter-in-law in Kherlen, the easternmost town of Mongolia. She has been working as an equipment operator since 2006. Her son works at a construction site. Using her previous loan, she has renovated her house.

Now she is requesting a loan of 4,000,000 MNT to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, planks and fiberglass so that she can build an extension onto her house. The extension will make the house more energy efficient and will provide more space for her family.

loans.use: to build an extension onto her house in order to conserve energy

loans.name: Balbina

texts.es:
La Sra. Balbina tiene 31 años esta casada, su marido es empleado, tienen un hijo por quien esta luchando para poder darle todo lo que ellos no pudieron tener.
La señora con su marido viajaron a España, con los ahorros que obtuvieron decidieron volver a su país y dedicarse a la compra y venta de ropas, actualmente cuenta con varios clientes, que siempre les hacen muchos pedidos.
En el futuro le gustaría abrir para su local propio en el centro de la ciudad y que su marido le ayude en el negocio. Pide este préstamo para la compra de remeras, short, camisas, vaqueros, etc., y de esa manera poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Sra. Balbina is 31 years old and married. Her husband is employed. They have a child who they support, so they are striving to provide him everything that they were not able to have.

Sra. Balbina and her husband traveled to Spain. With the money they had saved, they decided to return to Paraguay and she began buying and selling clothes. She currently has several customers who always place many orders.

In the future, she would like to open her own shop in the central part of the city. Her husband would help with the business. Balbina is requesting this loan in order to buy T-shirts, shorts, shirts, jeans, and other garments so that she can continue her sales.

loans.use: to buy T-shirts, shorts, shirts, jeans, and other garments to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy raw materials, like hair embellishments and cotton

loans.name: Cheryl

texts.en:
Cheryl is 43 years old and married with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. 

Cheryl has a fishing business in the Philippines. Cheryl requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Cheryl has been in this business for five years. In the future, Cheryl would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Thorn's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Speu province, Thorn is 31 years old and single. To support her living, she earns an income to improve her family's condition via rice cropping. She can earn about 25,000 KHR income per day. 

For Thorn, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In the group of three, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Primitiva

texts.es:
La Sra. Primitiva es madre soltera, tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 de ellos están en la Argentina trabajando y los restantes aún son menores que son el motivo de su lucha de todos los días, procurando poder darles lo mejor. 
Ella tiene una despensa bien surtida y muy conocida en el barrio. Una de sus hija le ayuda con las tareas en la despensa. Consiguió montar su despensa con un poco de dinero que había juntado con el trabajo que realizaba su hijo en el extranjero. 
Ella es una persona muy luchadora y honesta, conocida y querida por todos los que viven en su  barrio.  Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder surtir su despensa, con productos a granel, verduras, frutas, carnes y demás.
texts.en:
Sra. Primitiva is a single mother with four children. Two of them are working in Argentina. The other two children are still young, so they are the motivation she needs to work hard every day in order to give them the best.

Primitiva has an adequately stocked food pantry, which is well-known in her neighborhood. One of her daughters helps with the business duties. Primitiva was able to start this business with a little bit of money she had saved along with whatever her son earned from working abroad. She is a determined and honest person who is known and loved by everyone who lives in her neighborhood.

Primitiva is requesting this loan in order to buy various products to restock her food pantry such as bulk goods, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other items.

loans.use: to buy bulk goods, vegetables, fruits, meats, and other items.

loans.name: Illumenada

texts.en:
Illumenada has been farming for over five years, aside from their transportation services business. She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for farm fertilizer and seedlings. 

She took a new loan recently to buy additional organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a more productive harvest. She is now happy to say that with this loan, the entire farm will be fertilized, and rest assured will be a productive farm in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional organic fertilizer to restore farm nutrients to have a more productive harvest.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 44 years old, and three of her children are in school.

Ma. Fe has a pottery business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy raw materials needed for her pottery.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for ten years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy raw materials needed for her pottery.

loans.name: Mirasol

texts.en:
Mirasol is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 37 years old, and all her children are in school.

Mirasol has a restaurant business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy ingredients for her food business.

Mirasol has been in this business for 14 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food business.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.en:
For 12 years, Pedro has spent his professional career servicing apartment complexes, developing relationships with the management and preparing himself for his major move into becoming a business owner. 

Pedro prides himself on having a keen eye for spotting unusual or extraordinary circumstances regarding both property and residents. Having a strong background in facilities management, Pedro decided it was time for him to start his own business.
 
For almost a decade, Pedro has been the proud owner of P& N Painting. His company specializes in the maintenance of apartment properties. “The best part of being involved with maintenance was the painting,” Pedro said. “It was only natural that when I started my business that I specialize in it.”

Pedro sought out Accion Texas because he wanted to start marketing his business. His dream is to expand P & N painting to get more contracts with other properties.

With the new growth, Pedro is planning on adding one more full-time maintenance technician to his team. “I love what I do,” Pedro said. “I am extremely grateful that Accion Texas is giving me the opportunity to continue to grow—this means so much to my family.”

loans.use: To pay for marketing materials to help spread the word about his busines

loans.name: Sineng

texts.en: Residing in Kampong Cham province, Sineng is 42 years old and a mother of two children. She can earn an income to support her family's conditions via growing tobacco and corn. For Sineng, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use her entire loan portion to pay for school fees for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he gradates.

loans.use: To pay school fees for her son who wants to pursue his bachelor's degree.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Retna

texts.en:
This is the story of Karina, daughter of Retna :

"Due to very poor financial conditions, I turned to the student loan program from Kiva.  I want to grow and make my parents happy. Hopefully, with these loans, I can go to school well and smoothly, and provide the best for my parents. Thanks to the lenders that have given me the opportunity to go to school.

loans.use: to pay education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Sokheng

texts.en:
Sokheng, 42, is a local villager who lives in Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of three children; all of them are in university. To make her living, she grows rice on two hectares of land. Moreover, she can earn more income by raising pigs

This is the first cycle for Sokheng with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the school fee for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: to pay the school fee for her son, who wants to pursue a Bachelor's degree.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Liza

texts.en:
Liza is 45 years old and married with one child in school. Liza works very hard to provide for them.

Liza runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Liza has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as sugar, soap and other groceries. 

In the future, Liza would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: A local farmer from Kampong Chhnang province, Sokha is 56 years old and a mother of six children. She grows rice on two hectares as her main source of income and grows vegetable for resale. She earns about $6.56 (USD) a day. She has been with ViionFund for one cycle and now she is applying for a loan to pay the tuition fee for her son to study in university. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay the tuition fee for her son to study in university

location.town: Kampong Chhnang province, Tek Phos district

loans.name: Sok's Group

texts.en: A local resident from Battambang province, Sok is 46 years old and a father of five children. To support his family, he grows rice as his main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement his income. For Sok, this is his first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, he is the group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy fertilizers to support his farmland. He hopes that he can improve his family's living conditions.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers to support his farmland.

loans.name: Saveth's Group

texts.en: Saveth, 50, lives in a rural village in Kampong Speu province and is a mother of four children. She grows rice as her single resource of income. She can earn about 25,000 KHR per day. This is the first loan for Saveth with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of five members, she is group leader. She will use her loan to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to use.

loans.use: To buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Mohammad

texts.en:
This is the story of Ratna, grandaughter of Mohammad:


"I've been staying with my father'and mother until now. I went to Jakarta to earn a living for the family. I lived with my grandmother who is 75 years old. My mother works in Jakarta around the villages, earning about Rp.70.000 most every day. My grandparents could not work anymore because of their age. Until now I did not know my father, or whether he had died or not. Sometimes my mother also sells used goods such as old bottles. I am grateful to Kiva for helping offset the cost of my school.

loans.use: to pay grandauther's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Mwanaisha

texts.en:
Mwanaisha is a married woman and has been blessed with four kids who attend school. She lives in her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food and school fees. 

Mwanaisha operates a fish selling business, which has been operational for over two years. She mentioned seasonality as a challenge in the business. Mwanaisha dreams of becoming a wholesaler of fish in the future. 

With the KES 30,000, she wants to purchase sacks of fish for resale. She joined Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fish for resale

loans.name: Mwanasha

texts.en:
Mwanasha is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. Her husband is a businessman and he contributes to the upbringing of their children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasha has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces the major challenge of the high cost of transportation in her place of operation. Mwanasha dreams of expanding to a wholesale shop in the future.
 
With the KES 50,000, she wants to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale

loans.name: Ma. Flor

texts.en:
Ma. Flor is 35 years old and a married woman with one child in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.  

Ma. Flor has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. She has requested a 8,000 PHP loan through NWTF in order to buy more frozen foods to sell.

Ma. Flor has been in this business for three years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: A villager living in Takeo province, Song is 53 years old and a mother of four children. She earnd income to support her family by rice cropping. She earns additional income by weaving Khmer skirts called Hul. This is her sixth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. She will spend her loan potion to pay the school fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in English. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay school fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in English.

loans.name: Muhajir

texts.en:
This is the story of Anggi, son of Muhajir :

Every day my father works on the paddy harvest and plants seeds. When he is not in the fields, my father usually has a side job as a bricklayer, and my mother every day takes care of the household at a neighbor's house doing dusting, washing and cooking. My father's salary is uncertain. I have a brother working in Jakarta and I have a sister now in third grade.

loans.use: to pay for his son's education fees at the vocational school

loans.name: Ngeth

texts.en: A farmer living in Takeo province, Ngeth is 53 years old and a mother of six children. To support her family, she earns income by rice cropping and weaving Khmer skirts called Hul. For Ngeth, this is her first loan with VisionFund (kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in English. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the tuition fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in English.

loans.name: Al- Majd Group

texts.en:
This group is called Al-Majd. It consists of five women from Sana'a, Yemen. They applied for a loan of 290,000 YER from AMB.

Raja is the leader of the group. She is a 45-year-old married woman and a mother of three children, living with them in a humble house in Sana'a. Raja is an uneducated woman and works as a housewife. Her husband works as a solider with the army with very a small salary and it is not enough to cover the needs of the family.  The house where Raja and her family live lacks of a lot of home appliances and most of them are very old. Raja wants to make an improvement to her house, but she doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, she applied for a loan of 70,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase home appliances for her house.

Raja looks forward to providing her house with all home appliances and furniture.

loans.use: to purchase home appliances for her house.

loans.name: Khim

texts.en: Khim, a local farmer from Kampong Thom province, is 53 years old and a widow blessed with five children. She earns income to support her family by rice cropping and working for others for a fee. This is the first loan for Khim with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her loan portion to pay the school fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor degree's studying to become an electrician. She hopes that her son can get a good job after he graduates.

loans.use: To pay the school fee for her son who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, studyingh to be an electrician.

loans.name: Sopheap

texts.en: Soheap is a 36-year-old mother of three children living in Kampong Speu province, She grows rice on two hectares as her single source of income. For Sopheap, this is her fourth loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans wisely to gradually improve her living conditions. She will spend her entire loan portion to pay the school fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree, majoring in finance and banking. She hopes that her daughter can get a good job after she graduates.

loans.use: To pay the school fee for her daughter who wants to pursue a bachelor's degree majoring in finance and banking.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Felista

texts.en: Felista is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself as focused and determined. She operates a grocery store, where she sells groceries. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a highly populated place. She says her biggest business challenge is a lack of capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock for her grocery-selling business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of groceries.

loans.name: Ushindi Grp Group

texts.en:
Veronica is a 33-year-old mother of a boy and girl who are at school. She is married and supports her family by running a shop selling clothes, a business she has been with for 14 years now. She works from 7 am to 7 pm daily and is able to realize a small monthly profit.

Veronica is now requesting her first loan from Kiva partner's Tujijenge Tanzania. She will manage to repay back her loan successfully. Her capital is small, so she is requesting a loan so that she can improve her businesses to earn maximum income. She wants to expand her projects and be better in life.  

Veronica will share this loan with her loan group,Ushindi, which totals five members. The group members will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan. 
She will invest her portion of credit to buy clothes to resell in her shop.

loans.use: to buy clothes to resell in her shop.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more medicine to sell at her shop

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To build a green house

loans.name: Mwanasiti

texts.en:
Mwanasiti is married and has been blessed with three school-going children. They own a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

Mwanasiti has operated a fruit and vegetable stall business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of high cost of transportation in her place of operation. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of vegetables, potatoes, tomatoes, onions and fruits for resale.

loans.name: Meselemani

texts.en:
Meselemani is married and has ten children.  One attends school, and the others are adults. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. 

She operates a cassava business, selling at the market to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business.  Her dream is to establish a food selling business in the near future. 

With the 40,000 KES, she wants to purchase seven sacks of cassava for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase seven sacks of cassava for sale

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia tiene 18 miembros, donde todas y cada una de ellas están poniendo su mejor esfuerzo para poder ayudarse y crecer.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Fanni, quien en su última encuesta mostró un nivel de pobreza dentro del nivel tres, que ha ido mejorando a  través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo La señora tiene una mercería bien completa con todo tipo de productos, y es gracias a ello que ya tiene una muy buena clientela bien formada. Solicita de este préstamo para la compra de jeans, calzados, artículos de bazar, y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por un mejor porvenir para su familia.
texts.en:
The group “Santa Lucia” has 18 members. All of them are putting forth their best effort so that they can help one another and grow.

One of the members is Sra. Fanni. Her latest poverty elimination survey indicated that she was at a Stage 3 level. Fanni’s situation has been improving as a result of her efforts and continuous work. She has a haberdashery that is complete with all types of products. Thanks to this business, she has a well-established clientele.

Fanni is requesting this loan in order to buy jeans, shoes, bazaar merchandise, and other products. This will allow her to continue with her work so that she can strive for a better future for her family.

loans.use: to buy jeans, shoes, bazaar merchandise, and other products.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul is 56 years old and married with four children.  He resides in Jimenez with his family.
Paul owns and has operated a transport service for six years to earn a living. He has successfully repaid his previous loan, used for buying spare parts and tires. Recently, he took a new loan to cover the cost of repaint and motor repair of the motorcycle used for his transportation business. He plans to buy a sidecar for his motorcycle for expansion of his business in the near future.

loans.use: to cover the cost of repaint and motor repair of the motorcycle used for the transportation business

loans.name: Anderson

texts.en:
Anderson is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area. 

Anderson describes his biggest business challenge to be lack of capital. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy farm inputs to enable him to do farming. His business goal is to have a large business within five years. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to enable him to do farming

loans.name: Channak's Group

texts.en:
A young mother of a young kid living in Kampong Cham province, Channak is 20 years old. To support her family's condition, she grows jicama as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn extra income via fish-catching. 

For Channak, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy cucumber seed and fertilizers to start a new business. She hopes that she can help her family live in better conditions.

loans.use: to buy cucumber seed and fertilizers to start a new business.

location.town: Kampong Cham Province, Koh Sotin District

loans.name: Ameen

texts.en: Ameen is a 41-year-old married man with four children, living with them in Taiz city, Yemen. He has a University education.  Due to the high rates of unemployment in the country, Ameen didn't find a job to look after his family. He lives with his family in a very miserable condition, and he strives hard to change the condition of his family for the better. The house where Ameen and his family live lacks of a lot of furniture, such as beds and blankets. That makes the air inside the house very cold, particularly these days. Ameen wants to furnish his house, but he doesn't have enough money to do so. For this reason, he applied for a loan of 250,000 YER from AMB in order to purchase beds and blankets for his house.

loans.use: to purchase beds and blankets for his house.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es:
El Sr. Pedro es comerciante, tiene una casa comercial de venta de celulares  y accesorios hace mas de 10 años, actualmente a parte de su negocio tiene un consultorio con su esposa, comenta el Sr. Pedro que está muy contento de trabajar con la fundación, y gracias a esta ayuda podrá completar su tienda de celulares.
Pide este préstamo para la compra de celulares y accesorios para poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo. Agradece por esta oportunidad que recibe y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
Sr. Pedro is a merchant. He has a retail shop where he has been selling mobile phones and accessories for more than 10 years. Currently his shop has an office that he shares with his wife. Sr. Pedro says that he is very pleased to be working with Fundación Paraguaya. Thanks to their help, he will be able to fully supply his mobile phone shop.

Pedro is requesting this loan in order to buy mobile phones and accessories so that he can continue with his sales as before. He appreciates the opportunity he has received since it will be of great help.

loans.use: to buy mobile phones and accessories.

loans.name: Dembagnouma Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe Dembagnouma est composé uniquement de  femmes polygames. Elles ont en moyenne 43ans et 5 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako et se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce  de, pommes de terre, poissons, chaussures plastiques, laitues  et bananes plantains. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Awa  (femme assise à l’extrême droite sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente des tubercules (pommes de terre). Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter  6 sacs de pommes de terre en gros au grand marché de Bamako. La revente se fait en détails au marché de Badialanet en ambulant à une clientèle mixte. Madame  Awa  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 90 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité. Elle a pour objectif d’acheter un lot à usage d’habitation dans cette relation avec Soro Yiriwaso.
texts.en:
The Dembagnouma group is composed entirely of women living in polygamous families. On the average, they are 43 years old, with five children. They all live in Kalaban-coura, a neighborhood of Bamako and know each other as neighbors. The group members work as vendors selling potatoes, fish, plastic shoes lettuce and plantains. With the goal of replenishing their stock for cash, the group members have decided to collaborate with Soro Yiriwaso and are on their second solidarity loan cycle.

Mrs. Awa (the one seated on the far right in the photo) is well-known as a vendor of tubers (potatoes). She plans to use her loan to buy six bags of potatoes wholesale at the main market of Bamako. She sells retail at the market of Badialanet and as an ambulant vendor, to a mixed clientele. With this loan, Mrs. Awa hopes to earn an average monthly revenue of 90,000 West African francs, which will be used to reinvest in her business. Her goal is to buy a land plot and eventually build a house on it thanks to this collaboration with Soro Yiriwaso.

loans.use: to buy potatoes.

loans.name: Siguidia Group

texts.fr:
Les sept femmes du groupe Siguidia sont mariées uniquement dans des ménages polygamiques. Elles ont en moyenne 41ans et 4 enfants. Elles habitent toutes à Kalaban-coura l’un des quartiers de Bamako; Elles se sont connues à travers des liens de voisinage et de leurs activités génératrices de revenu à Kalaban-coura. Les membres du groupe font le petit commerce de, céréales pour la préparation de nourriture, viandes, jus et légumes. Dans le but de se ravitailler au comptant, les membres du groupe ont décidé de collaborer avec Soro Yiriwaso et sont à leur 2ème cycle de prêt solidaire.
Madame Assan  (femme  arrêtée à l’extrême gauche sur la photo) a une grande réputation dans la vente de restauration; Elle compte utiliser son prêt pour acheter 1sac de mil, 2 sacs de riz, 1 sac de fonio et 1 sac de maïs à  Médine en gros; La revente se fait à Kalaban-coura une clientèle mixte. Madame Assan  espère réaliser avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel moyen de 100 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé, pour être réinvesti dans l’activité et prendre en charge les soins de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The seven women who make up the group Siguidia are all married and living in polygamous households. They are on average 41 years old with an average of 4 children each. The women all live in Kalaban-coura, one of the neighborhoods of Bamako. They came to know each other through neighbors and their small businesses in Kalaban-coura.

The members of the group are in the business of selling cereals for food preparation, meat, juice, and vegetables. In order to increase their cash flow, the members of the group decided to partner with Soro Yiriwaso and they are on their second group loan cycle. 

Assan (pictured on the far left of the photo) has a good reputation selling food. She plans to use her loan to purchase 1 bag of millet, 2 bags of rice, 1 bag of fonio (a type of millet), and 1 bag of corn from wholesalers on Médine. She makes her sales in Kalaban-coura to a customer base made up of both men and women. Assan hopes that with this loan she will earn an average monthly income of 100,000 francs CFA, which she will use to reinvest in her business and to take care of her children's health.

loans.use: to purchase cereals

loans.name: Nasun

texts.en:
Nasun is a 40-year-old man who is married to Bilha, a 45-year-old woman.  They have been blessed with three children: Randi, 17, grade 3 of a vocational high school; Maria, 14, grade 3 of a junior high school; and Lodda, 9, grade 4 of an elementary school.

 Nasun is working as a police officer, while his wife is a teacher in local early childhood education.  To make more income for their family, Nasun and Bilha run a small kiosk selling daily needs such as soap, detergent, and instant noodles, etc. Nasun uses one room in their house to run the business. 

Currently Nasun is renovating his house into a permanent house. Unfortunately, his money is not enough to renovate the house. Therefore he requested an individual loan of IDR 10,000,000 from TLM to complete renovation of the house. The loan will be used to buy cement, sand, and timber.

loans.use: to buy cement, sand, and timber

loans.name: Sharon Rose

texts.en:
Sharon Rose is 37 years old and has three children.  She is married and her three children are in school.

Sharon Rose is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Sharon Rose has been raising pigs for eight years now, and has borrowed 14 times in the past from NWTF to sustain the business.

In the future, Sharon Rose would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Philip

texts.en:
Philip, 36, is a smallholder farmer. He wakes up when the sun comes out and works until it goes down, every day. He lives in a small village called Kamera in the Nyanza region of Kenya. In this area, dairy and banana farming are the main economic activities practiced by the constituents. Philip, a mixed-farmer, practices both. He has been doing this work for six good years. 

Philip's primary income sources are milk, bananas, and motorcycle transportation services. The father of three stated that milking is the most enjoyable of his activities on the farm. He is very connected with his dairy animals and has assigned a name to each of them. He has dreams of growing his dairy farm by herding more animals and buying more land. 

Philip is seeking a loan of KES 31,200 only to purchase a dairy cow. Business-related expenses keep rising by the day forcing farmers and businessmen alike to reduce costs and/or increase sales. The additional cow will help in the utilization of pasture and will increase milk production and availability of more by-products. Philip will be able to save a bit on expenses such as fertilizer. He hopes that he will be able to invest your loan wisely to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a dairy cow, of a good-quality breed

loans.name: Choem's Group

texts.en:
Choem is a resident of Kampong Speu province, and a mother of six children. For her entire family, rice farming is the sole source of income. She has been occupied in this business for several years. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others, for a fee.

For Choem, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of four members, she is leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family's living and good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Losina

texts.en:
Losina is a married mother of six children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past ten years, she has operated a clothes-selling business, selling from door-to-door, to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of transportation. She dreams of expanding and establishing a boutique business, in the future.

With the loan that she is requesting, KES 40,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes to resell. She decided to join Yehu to access loans, to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes to resell

loans.name: Taberta

texts.en:
Taberta is a 31-year-old woman and is married to Obet, a 38-year-old man. From their marriage they are blessed with three children: Deky, 8, an elementary school student; Jefri, 4; and Adelia, 1, both of them are not attending school yet. 

Taberta and her husband have been running a  furniture business since 2005. Previously Taberta ran a business selling palm sugar to Sumba. Their furniture business can fulfill their daily family needs. The furniture that they have been making are tables, chairs, book shelves, etc. 

Right now, Taberta and her husband need more cash to purchase raw materials to make the furniture, but they do not have much money. This situation led them to request an individual loan of IDR 15,000,000 from TLM.  The loan will be spent on timber as a raw material to create furniture.

loans.use: to purchase timber as a raw material to create  furniture

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is a 52-year-old married woman with five children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Susan has a fishing business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Susan has been in this business for seven years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Yem's Group

texts.en:
Yem is a farmer living in Kampong Speu province. She is 32 years old, and a mother of eight children. She secures the basic needs for her family via rice cultivation, and working for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in her business for ages, and earns about 20,000 KHR per day.

For Yem, this is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). As the leader of a group of three members, Yem will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in a healthy manner.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase new furniture for her house

loans.name: Enkhsaruul

texts.en:
Mr. Enkhsaruul, 25 years old, lives alone in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as a computer network professional in the banking industry since 2013. 

His work office is far from his home, so he is requesting a loan of 3,800,000 MNT to buy an electric car for transportation purposes. The advantage of an electric car is that it emits less smoke and wastes less fuel.

loans.use: to buy an electric car for transportation.

loans.name: Kuña Pyapy Mbarete Group

texts.es:
Este grupo está trabajando de manera unida, tienen muchos deseos de ir capacitándose y crecer en el emprendimiento que cada una tiene.
Una de las integrantes es la Sra. Elena quien se dedica a su despensa en su casa. A través del esfuerzo y el trabajo continuo y las aplicaciones de los comportamientos vitales de una mujer exitosa, ella se encuentra mejorando su situación económica.  También se debe destacar el trabajo de las asesoras, quienes hacen un seguimiento permanente de capacitaciones y verificaciones que de alguna manera exigen y al mismo tiempo incentivan a las mujeres a luchar para poder superar la pobreza.
La Sra. Elena pide este préstamo para la compra de insumos varios para su despensa, como ser bebidas, comestibles, lácteos, panificados, frutas y demás, de manera a poder seguir con su trabajo. Ella es una mujer que se está esforzando por crecer, es muy entusiasta.
texts.en: This group works in a unified way, and each member has a great desire to be trained and to grow in her own business. One of the members is Elena, who has a small shop in her house. Due to her efforts, her continuous work, and her determination to adopt the behaviors of a successful woman, she is improving her financial circumstances. She also wants to highlight the work of the advisers, who provide continuous training and oversight in order to motivate the women to struggle to overcome poverty. Elena is requesting a loan to buy a variety of supplies for her shop, such as drinks, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, fruit and other items, so that she can continue working. She is a very enthusiastic woman who is making efforts to grow her business.

loans.use: to buy drinks, groceries, dairy products, baked goods, fruit and other items.

loans.name: Ronelyn

texts.en:
Ronelyn, a 25-year-old single woman, sells cosmetic products in her village to make a living. Her income from this business has enabled her to make some home improvements. 

Ronelyn has requested a loan from GDMPC to purchase additional cosmetics to attract more customers. She plans to build a store where she can sell more cosmetics and other goods to ensure a better income.

loans.use: to purchase additional cosmetic products to attract customers

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is 49 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Kampong Cham province. 

To support her living, she can earn income to support her family’s conditions via working for others for a fee and rice cropping. She earns income of about 32,200 KHR per day. 

This is Ly’s first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two members. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy wood to build a house. She hopes that she can have a house for living in.

loans.use: to buy wood to build a house.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Gethrina

texts.en:
Gethrina is a 48-year-old woman, married to Marthen, a 62-year-old farmer. They have two children, Lusianty, 12, a junior high school student, and Novita, 9, an elementary school student.

Gethrina has a business selling seasonings, dried fish, and vegetables. She has been involved as a trader since 2003. She initiated the business with her own capital, obtained by selling “keripik pisang” (banana cracker) and “kiri-kiri,” a snack like a cheese stick used onion and wheat.

Recently, she ordered onion and dried fish from Ende, regency in Folres Island, as her customers had requested. She needs more money, to pay for the stock she ordered. Therefore, she applied for an individual loan, in the amount of IDR 5,000,000, from TLM. The loan is spent on two sacks of dried fish.

loans.use: to buy two sacks of dried fish.

loans.name: Srey's Group

texts.en:
A resident of Kampong Speu province, Srey is 31 years old and a mother of three children. A farmer who grows rice as her main business, she can earn about 15,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Now leading a group of seven, Srey is requesting her first loan with Kiva partner VisionFund. She will spend her entire portion to buy a water filter. She hopes to ensure that her family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Chanry's Group

texts.en:
Chanry, a mother of two young children, is 29 years old. She lives in Kampong Speu province. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she sells grocery items to supplement her income. She earns about 18,000 KHR per day.

This is her first loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of nine, she is group leader. Chanry will spend her entire loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can make her family have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter for her family

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Maria

texts.es: Maria es una mujer felizmente casada, ella tiene 3 hijos y vive con su familia en La Paz en una casa de adobe que le pertenece a su sobrino pero al menos la familia vive con relativa comodidad Maria es comerciante de frutas y verduras, ella viaja mucho para ofrecer sus productos  y quiere un prestamo para incrementar la cantidad de frutas y verduras que ofrece El esposo de Maria contribuye a la casa como chofer asalariado pero aún así su aporte no es suficiente, Maria goza de buena salud y espera su ayuda
texts.en: María is a happily married woman. She has 3 children and lives with her family in La Paz in an adobe house that belongs to her nephew, but at least the family lives in relative comfort.
