Maria sells fruit and vegetables. She travels a lot to sell her products, and she wants a loan to increase the amount of fruits and vegetables that she can offer for sale. Maria's husband contributes to the household expenses as a paid driver, but his contribution is still not enough. María enjoys good health and awaits your help.

loans.use: to increase the amount of fruits and vegetables that she can offer for sale.

loans.name: Rose Ann

texts.en:
Rose Ann is 33 years old and a married woman. She has two children, one of whom is in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She has a charcoal-retailing business in the Philippines.

Rose Ann requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF. She will use the loan in order to buy more stock of charcoal to sell. She has been in this business for three years. In the future, Rose Ann would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, age 35, is a local farmer living in Kampong Speu province. She is a mother of two children; one is in school, and the other one is too young. Nowadays, Ra grows rice as her single source of income. She earns about 22,000 KHR per day.

This is first loan for Ra with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a loan, and she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family will have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Tahire

texts.en:
Tahire is 49 years old, and she is a widow. Her husband died in the Karabakh War. Now she stays alone with her two children. It's too hard for her without a husband. 

Her family members are IDP (internally displaced persons) from the occupied territory of Azerbaijan. They have been in Agdam city over 22 years and now they are living in the Absheron region. Her older daughter is married and her younger daughter graduated school and is preparing for exams to enter university. 

Tahire explores the different types of diseases. Now Tahire wants to explores new types diseases, and she needs to buy new equipment for research. Therefore, she needs 2,350 AZN (Azerbaijan New Manat). Tahire is greatly thankful to the Kiva organization for this loan.

loans.use: to buy new equipment

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman; she has three children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a farm where she grows tea. Jane has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area, and her primary customers are large scale. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of finances. 

Jane will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank, and the previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
As a married mother of eight children, Wilma works hard to support her family.

Wilma has a ready-to-wear clothing business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from selling frozen foods. Wilma is borrowing PHP 26,000 through NWTF in order to buy more stock of blouses, pants, curtains and school uniforms.

Wilma has been sustaining her business activities through her past 14 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her to attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more stock of blouses, pants, curtains and school uniforms

loans.name: Pha's Group

texts.en:
Living in a rural area in Kampong Speu province, Pha, 47, is a mother of four children. To overcome the family’s hardship, she grows rice as her single source of income. She has been involved this business for ages, and it earns her about 20,000 KHR per day. This is Pha's first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

She leads a group of four to get new loan. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that she can make her family living in a good health.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Bernardita

texts.en:
Bernardita is 64 years old, and widowed with five children.  

She is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Bernardita requested a PHP 14,000 loan through NWTF to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Bernardita has been in pig fattening for 10 years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
This is Margaret. She is married, 36 years old, and blessed with five children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped improve her knowledge in business management skills. 

Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She is borrowing a loan to expand her business by buying farm inputs such as fertilizer and planting seeds.  She hopes by doing this she will increase her level of income, and support her family with food.

Margaret is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and planting seeds.

loans.name: Thoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Residing from Kampong Speu province, Theourn is 30 years old and a mother of two schoolchildren. Now she can earn income to support her family's condition via rice cropping. She can earn income of about 22,000 KHR per day. This is Theourn's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of eight members, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy a water filter. She hopes that her family has clean water to drink.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Belgica Yhomara

texts.es: Belgica es una joven emprendedora,madre de una hermosa niña ,actualmente estudia una carrera tecnica y a la ves se dedica a la venta de lenceria para poder generar un ingreso extra y asi solventar algunos gastos , uno de sus mayores anhelos es llegar a tener su negocio propio y terminar su carrera.Belgica esta solicitando un credito para comprar mas mercaderia y hacer crecer su negocio.Ella esta muy agradecida con los prestamistas de Kiva ya que de brindarle el credito cumpliria con sus metas trazadas y mejoraria la calidad de vida de su menor hija y la suya.
texts.en:
Belgica is a young entrepreneur and the mother of a beautiful little girl. Currently she is studying for a technical degree. At the same time Belgica is making a living selling lingerie in order to generate extra income and therefore cover some expenses. One of her greatest wishes is to finish her degree and have her own business. 

Belgica is asking for a loan to purchase merchandise and to expand her business. She is very grateful to Kiva lenders because providing her with the loan would allow her to meet her established goals and improve both her young daughter's and her own quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase clothes to sell.

loans.name: Nena

texts.en:
Nena is a widowed woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Nena is 42 years old, and has three children who are currently in school.

Nena has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 25,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase ingredients for her food production business.

Nena has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
Analiza is a married woman with two children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Analiza is 41 years old, and has two children who are in school.

Analiza has a food vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc. for her food production business.

Analiza has been in this business for 10 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, fish, vegetables, spices, etc.

loans.name: Dioceline

texts.en:
As a married mother of 10 children, Dioceline works hard to support her family.

She earns a living by a raising pigs business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Dioceline is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Dioceline has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF, and more recently, through Kiva. 

She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
25 kilometers from the rural town of Nyamira, Kenya, you meet Paul, a father of one who belongs to the smallholder category. The village of Kemera, where Paul resides, has largely stayed under-developed, with farmers persistently following traditional cultivation practices and mostly preferring to cultivate bananas. 

Paul has been practicing dairy farming, disrupting the traditional practice of cultivating bananas with an objective to improve his socio-economic status. The prevailing geological conditions of the village make it extremely suitable for dairy farming. The major challenge he faces is a lack of funds to push his dairy farming a notch higher. He is requesting a loan from Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva lenders to buy a quality breed of dairy cow. The additional cow will help in the use of pasture, and will increase milk production and availability to produce more byproducts. 

Through this loan, Paul will be able to challenge the existing norms and bring better and advanced dairy farming practices to his village, thus becoming a torchbearer for change in his village for others to follow. He hopes that he will be able to use your loan investment wisely to raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Kongato

texts.en:
The person in the photo is seventy-four year-old Kongato, who is married and blessed with six children.

Kongato joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 where she gained skills in enterprise development and financial management. Kongato has been doing dairy farming for the past two years. 

Kongato is taking a loan so as to buy fodder for her cows and also to start a poultry business. She anticipates improved income which will enable her family to cater for household expenses such as food and clothing. 

Kongato appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: To purchase fodder and chickens.

loans.name: Yoryi Enrique

texts.es:
Yoryi Enrique tiene 31 años de edad, es soltero, no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de su abuela junto a su tia, cuenta con servicios de luz y agua. Yoryi Enrique es natural de la zona. La comunidad de Morropón se dedica a la crianza de ganado mayor vacuno y a la agricultura prinicpalmente de Arroz. Dicha comunidad está ubicada en la región de Piura, costa norte de Perú.

La actividad que desarrolla Yoryi Enrique es el servicio de mano de obra no calificada desarrollandose como peón agrícola, ayudante de albañileria, él trabaja en la zona de Morropón. Yoryi Enrique solicita crédito para comprar cargas de arroz, almacenarlas y luego revenderlas a un mejor precio, esto le permitirá obtener otros ingresos producto de la venta y sus cuotas las cancelaria de forma mensual por medio de su trabajo diario. Estos ingresos adicioneles le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida ya que podrá aportar más a su canasta familiar.
texts.en:
Yoryi Enrique is 31 years old; he is single and has no children. He lives in his grandmother's house with his aunt, and the house and light and water. Yoryi Enrique is from the area. The community of Morropón works to breed cattle and to grow mainly rice. It is located in the Piura region, on the northern coast of Peru.

Yoryi Enrique is an unqualified manual labourer, and works as an agricultural workman and a builder's assistant; he works in the Morropón area. Yoryi Enrique is asking for a loan to buy sacks of rice, stock them, and then sell them on for a better price; this will allow him to obtain a better income as a result of the sales, and he would pay back his loans on a monthly basis through his everyday work. This additional income will allow him to improve his quality of life, since he will be able to contribute more to the household.

loans.use: to buy sacks of rice, stock them and then sell them on for a better price.

loans.name: Khem's Group

texts.en:
Khem is 32 years old and a mother of one school child; they are living in Kampong Speu province. She struggles for a living via rice cropping. Moreover, she works for others for a fee, and grows vegetables to earn extra income. This is her first cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

In a group of five, she is a leader. She will spend her loan to buy a water filter. Khem hopes that her family can have clean water to use.

loans.use: to buy a water filter

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Phnom Srouch District

loans.name: Faustino Samuel

texts.es:
Faustino Manuel tiene 37 años de edad, vive con su cónyuge y sus cuatro hijos, su casa es de material rustico caracteristico de la zona, ubicada en el distrito de Cañarís, provincia de Ferreñafe, región Lambayeque, costa norte de Perú. Su comunidad está dedicada básicamente a la agricultura, ganadería y al comercio.

Faustino Manuel se dedica al Cultivo de café, desde hace más de 10 años en el Caserío la Lucma. Faustino Manuel requiere el crédito para invertir en compra de abonos para obtener mejoras en su cultivo y con esto incrementar los rendimientos del mismo, asegurando de esta forma su cosecha para el 2015. Faustino Manuel posee experiencia en el negocio lo que le permitirá obtener una utilidad aceptable para que mejore su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Faustino Manuel is 37-years old. He lives with his wife and their four children. Their house is built of rustic materials typical of the area he lives in. His home is located in the Cañarís District and Ferreñafe Province of the Lambayeque Region on the northern coast of Perú. The people in his community make their livings primarily in agriculture, raising livestock and sales.

Faustino Manuel has made his living growing coffee in the village of Lucma for more than ten years. He needs the loan to invest in the purchase of compost to improve his crop and increase the output he gets from his plants. This way, he will ensure his crop for 2015. Faustino Manuel has experience in this business, which will allow him to earn an acceptable profit so he can improve his own quality of life and that of his family as well.

loans.use: to invest in the purchase of compost so he can improve his crop and increase the output he gets from his plants.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water purification machine for the home.

loans.name: Sountong Nooma Group

texts.fr: Binta, représentante du groupe Sountong Nooma est veuve avec sept(07) enfants dont quatre(04) majeurs qui travaillent déjà. En effet, Binta vend des céréales destinée à nourrir les poules de race depuis 15 ans. Cette femme est dynamique puisqu'en plus de la vente des céréales, elle fait l'élevage des poules avec un de ses fils. Avec ce prêt, Binta pourrait acheter des céréales pour vendre et accroître son élevage. Les bénéfices lui permettront de prendre soins de ses enfants mineurs; de faire face à ses charges familiales; de continuer ses ventes et son élevage.
texts.en: Binta, the Sountong Nooma group representative, is a widow with 7 children, 4 of whom are adults and already working. Binta has been selling cereals destined for chicken feed for 15 years. She is a dynamic woman who, as well as selling cereals, also breeds chickens with one of her sons. With this loan, Binta will be able to buy cereals for resale and to expand her breeding business. The profits will enable her to take care of her minor children, to cover the family expenses and to keep selling cereals and breeding chickens.

loans.use: to buy cereal for use as chicken feed.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Elenith

texts.es: Ropa y artículos de segunda, que ofrece de casa en casa, a crédito y de contado,como el cliente lo requiera, es el negocio de Elenith, una mujer de 31 años que habita en la ciudad con su cónyuge y sus tres hijos en las edades de 10 a 14 años. Ella inició  su negocio comercial, en el año 2001 con una amiga, pues le regalaron ropa que ella vendió a precios de oportunidad en su barrio y generó ingresos, experiencia que le gustó y con la que ha alternado sus actividades de madre, esposa y administradora de su hogar.  Hoy 13 años después, sueña con tener un local de mayor tamaño, mejorar sus condiciones habitacionales y lograr su mayor desafió, que no es otro que complacer a su clientela, y que a estos les guste y necesiten lo que ella vende : "Ropa usada". Todos los días  Elenith sale de su vivienda, desde las 8 de la mañana y regresa a las 8 de la noche, sus vecinos son sus mayores clientes y  ellos, en esta temporada en la que se acercan las fiestas de fin de año, la han colmado de pedidos, que Elenith quiere cumplir. Esta es la razón por la cual acude a un  credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará ropa usada, y artículos para el hogar, con motivos navideños, con esta inversión sus inventarios se incrementaran, para ofrecer mas mercancias,  porque tendrá un fondo de efectivo, que le permite comprar mas  que antes de obtener su crédikiva y esto es bueno para impactar las ventas de su negocio y hacer que su inversión sea exitosa
texts.en:
Elenith, 31, lives in the city with her partner and their three children aged from 10 to 14. She works selling secondhand clothing and other items door to door for credit or cash, depending on the customer.

She began her retail business in 2001 with a friend when she sold her clothes at lower prices than in the neighbourhood and made a profit. She liked this experience and alternates this with being a mother, wife and managing her home. Today, 13 years later, she dreams of having a larger business, better housing and to achieve her greatest challenge, which is simply to please her customers and to give them what they like and need with what she sells: used clothing. 

Elenith is out of her home every day from 8am until 8pm. Her neighbours are her biggest customers and in this season when the holidays are approaching, she is overwhelmed with orders that Elenith wants to meet.

This is why she is going to a credikiva, the first funding from the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation, through which she will buy used clothing and household items with Christmas decorations.

With this investment, her inventories will increase to provide her with more market opportunities as she will have a cash flow that will allow her to buy more than before her credikiva and this is good for business and making her investment successful

loans.use: to buy secondhand clothing and household items.

loans.name: Sophal's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Moung Russey district, where crop farming is a common way to earn a living, Sophal, 42, is married with four children. She and her husband grow rice and plant corn as the main business for the family’s income. They have been in the business for 15 years. 

Sophal has been a member of Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, for three cycles already and she wisely and successfully used the past two loans to improve her family’s livelihood. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sophal wants to use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland and use a portion of it to spend on labor. She hopes to increase crop yields to earn a larger income in order to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Kuña Rory Group

texts.es:
El grupo kuña rory  está en su ciclo número 6 del programa de comité de mujeres, donde todas trabajan y se ayudan por salir adelante. Están haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de pobreza, donde cada una gracias al esfuerzo en conjunto y las capacitaciones que van recibiendo han podido mejorar.
Todas son mujeres muy trabajadoras, pero en especial se destaca la Sra. Abelina, una  humilde pero sacrificada señora que se dedica a vender cosméticos variados, ella ayuda a su familia por medio de ese trabajo, ya que quiere darles una vida digna sin privaciones.
Abelina pide este préstamo para poder comprar cosméticos variados para poder seguir con sus ventas, invirtiendo en su plan de negocios y seguir luchando para poder dar a su familia todo lo que necesitan. Agradecen por la oportunidad que han recibido y que le será de mucha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Kuña Rory group is in its sixth cycle with the women’s committee program.  All of them are working and helping each other get ahead.  They have been working with the poverty elimination survey project.  Thanks to the effort they make together and the trainings they are getting, they have been able to improve.

All of the women are very hard-workers.  However, Abelina especially stands out.  She is a self-sacrificing woman who sells various cosmetics.  She helps her family through this work.  She does this because she wants to give them a decent life without deprivations.

Abelina is requesting this loan to be able to buy various cosmetics in order to be able to continue with her sales.  She will be investing in her business plan, and she will continue struggling in order to be able to give her family everything that they need.  

They are grateful for the opportunity that they are being given; it will be a big help.

loans.use: to buy various cosmetics to sell.

loans.name: La Alegria Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado La Alegria  está en su ciclo número 1º del programa de comité de mujeres, ellas se unieron para poder crecer en los emprendimientos que cada una viene haciendo. Ellas quieren  dar a sus familias todo lo que no pudieron tener y que no pasen por necesidades.
La presidenta de este grupo es la Sra. Valeria, quien comenta que siempre trata de incentivar a sus amigas para poder crecer e ir mejorando en los emprendimientos que cada una hace. Ella se dedica a la venta de comidas variadas, que todos los días desde muy tempranas horas prepara y que luego sale a vender de manera ambulante. 
Valeria pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos varios para poder seguir con sus ventas, como ser verduras, condimentos, hortalizas, carne, pollo y demás.
texts.en:
The La Alegria group is in its first cycle with the women’s committee program.  They got together in order to be able to grow in the endeavors that each one of them is making.  They want to give their families everything that they were not able to have, and they don’t want their families to experience need.

Valeria is the president of this group.  She says that she always tries to motivate her friends in order to be able to grow and improve in each of their endeavors.  She sells various foods.  She starts very early every day preparing the food, and then she goes out to sell in an itinerant manner.  Valeria is requesting this loan to be able to buy various supplies in order to be able to continue with her sales.  She will buy things like vegetables, condiments, greens, meat, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, condiments, greens, meat, chicken, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Eliza

texts.es: Eliza tiene un hijo y vive en la comunidad de Arajllanga en una humilde casa de adobe que le pertenece a sus padres Eliza se dedica a la venta de leche y corre el peligro de que sus vacas no produzcan como se debe debido a que las esta haciendo trabajar demasiado, por eso, Eliza quiere un prestamo para la compra de ganado vacuno para mejorar sus ingresos Eliza goza de buena salud y tiene deseos de superarse, por lo que espera su ayuda
texts.en:
Eliza has one child.  She lives in the Arajllanga community in a humble adobe house that belongs to her parents.  Eliza sells milk.  She runs the risk of her cows not producing as they should because she is working them too much.

Therefore, Eliza wants a loan to buy a cow in order to improve her income.  Eliza enjoys good health and has the desire to improve herself.  That is why she hopes to have your help.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Benedicta

texts.en:
Benedicta is 47 years old and married with four children. She resides at Villalin, Pana-on with her family. 

She owns and operates a transportation business, providing transportation services to local community members. She has been in the business for two years and earns 5,000 PHP per month. 

She has repaid successfully her previous loan used for buying tires and accessories for her motorcycle. She is now taking a new loan to repaint her motorcycle and buy a new brake pad for safe travel with customers. 

Benedicta plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve and expand her business.

loans.use: to repaint her motorcycle and buy a new brake pad for safe travel with customers.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is 44 years old and married with one child in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Marilou has a personal products business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 10,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more items like body lotion, perfumes, shampoo, and other personal products.

Marilou has been in this business for four years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy more items like body lotion, perfumes, shampoo, and other personal products.

loans.name: Loida

texts.en:
Loida is 44 years old and married.

Loida is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

Loida has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed three times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Loida would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma is a married woman with three children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Elma is 34 years old and has three children who are in school.

Elma has a buy and sell ready to wear business in the Philippines. Elma requested a PHP 12000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear to sell to her customers.

Elma has been in this business for 1 year. In the future, Elma would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks of ready to wear items

loans.name: Lunie

texts.en:
Lunie is 50 years old and has seven children. Lunie is married and has five children who are still in school.

Lunie is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Lunie requested a PHP 10000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

Lunie has been in pig fattening for 22 years now, and has borrowed 2 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it. In the future, Lunie would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal retailing business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to purchase more stocks to sell for her charcoal retailing business.

NWTF is relisting Alma's business profile again in support of her efforts to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a laptop to use it in his work.

loans.name: Jenny

texts.es: Jenny vive en Arajllanga y para ganarse la vida elabora queso pero requiere un credito para la compra de ganado vacuno Jenny no esta sola, ella vive con sus padres quienes la ayudan a pesar de tener recursos limitados, por eso, Jenny quiere mejorar sus ingresos, Jenny no tiene deudas pendientes ni tampoco tiene responsabilidades de madre pero goza de buena salud y su evaluación es buena
texts.en: Jenny lives in Arajilanga, and she makes cheese to earn a living.  She needs a loan to buy a dairy cow.  Jenny is not alone, she lives with her parents whom she helps in spite of having limited resources.  This is why Jenny wants to increase her income.  Jenny has no outstanding debt, and neither does she have any children to support.  She enjoys good health, and she has a good credit evaluation.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a charcoal-selling business in the Philippines. 

She is borrowing PHP 25000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her selling charcoal business.

Victoria has been in this business for 5 years. Victoria earns more income from buying and selling banana.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Victoria has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell

loans.name: Eng's Group

texts.en:
A woman living in Kampong Speu province, Eng is 60 years old and a mother of one child. She grows rice and works for others for a fee to support her family's condition. She can earn income of about KHR 25,000 per day. This is her second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. 

In a group of three, Eng is a leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that her family can live in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

location.town: Kampong Speu Province, Korng Pisey District

loans.name: John

texts.en:
Chickens form the largest proportion of domesticated poultry birds in Kenya. Farmers like John do chicken keeping for its cultural and commercial value. He has kept poultry for over one decade on his mixed farm. He also keeps dairy cattle and grows tea in order to make more income from different revenue streams. However, for him to maintain a family of five children, he needs more income. 

John is seeking a loan to expand his poultry farm. By purchasing more poultry, he is going to significantly increase the farm's output and, consequently, his income. He spends a lot of time working on his land and tending to his animals. He has enough time, space and knowledge to take in more poultry.

Income from this investment will enable him to repay the loan and to pay for his children's education.

loans.use: To purchase poultry

loans.name: Justine

texts.en: Wonderful Kiva lenders! Introducing you to Justine, a 33-year-old honest, hard-working and ever-smiling father of 1 adorable child. He hails from Nyamira in Kenya, a banana-growing area where the staple food is “matoke”, a mouthwatering delicacy prepared from bananas. Justine has been involved in farming for the past 10 years and he owns dairy cows that produce milk for sale. Besides his dairy cows, he also keeps poultry and when you visit his farm you will witness tea growing as well as a variety of vegetables. Justine has a passion for dairy farming and has even nicknamed one of his cows “Nyabarati” (from a person's name); but all is not well for this humble man. He is facing the challenge of the lack of a proper dairy unit which is why he is seeking funds to construct a proper dairy unit. With your loan, he will be able to better manage his dairy farm and create more value. A better dairy unit will assist Justine to save more money because his cows will never be sick and this will also boost his dairy's milk production. Through building a dairy unit with the loan, Justine will be able to collect the cows' by-products, namely, cow dung and urine which can be sold or better yet used on his farm. With a dairy unit, he will be able to better feed his animals and collect by-products such as dung to generate biogas fuel, make organic fertilizer and plaster his hut. The money that he will earn from the dairy unit will be reinvested back into the business to create growth. Joseph is a very ambitious man and he projects that through the loan he will have higher quality dairy cows and be able to permanently change his living conditions and secure his children's future.

loans.use: To construct a proper dairy unit

loans.name: Ulezi Group

texts.en:
Joyce, who is in her early 50s is married with three children who are still at school. She has been running a genge (grocery hut) business for three years now. She works from 07am to 09pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. 

This will be Joyce's 2nd loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loan to increase the genge stock and has paid back her loan successfully. She used the profit to pay school fees and household expenses. She is happy with the loan. She will use this loan to restock the out of stock items in her genge. She dreams of making her business to grow.

Joyce will share this loan with her loan group "Ulezi" which consist of four members who will hold each other other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to restock the out of stock items in her genge.

loans.name: San Cayetano Group

texts.es:
San Cayetano se llama esta grupo, son 19 mujeres de la ciudad de Itá, todas ellas amigas y vecinas de esa ciudad. Todas y cada una está poniendo el mayor de sus esfuerzos para poder mejorar sus vidas.
La Sra. Mirtha forma parte de este grupo, ella está haciendo la encuesta de eliminación de la pobreza lo cual ha mostrado que ella ha podido mejorar bastante y que está poniendo todo lo mejor de sí para poder luchar  y poder ir mejorando su situación de pobreza. Es una mujer muy trabajadora y luchadora, que se dedica a la costura, hace todo tipo de prendas, y con ello está luchando por un mejor futuro para su familia.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar telas e hilos, gomas, cierres y demás, para poder seguir con su trabajo, luchando por crecer y mejorar.
texts.en:
This group is named San Cayetano. They are 19 women from the city of Ita. They are all friends and neighbors from this city. Each and every one of them is putting forth their best effort in order to improve their lives.

Mirtha is a part of this group. She is part of a poverty elimination poll which has shown that she has been able to improve greatly. She is putting forth her best in order to fight to go on improving her situation in poverty. She is a hard working woman who makes a living by sewing. She makes all types of garments and with this she is fighting for a better future for her family. She is requesting this loan in order to buy fabric and thread, elastic, fasteners and everything else in order to continue with her work, struggling to grow and improve.

loans.use: to buy fabric and thread, elastic, fasteners and everything else.

loans.name: Marylen

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Marylen works hard to support her family.

She has a bakery business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Marylen is borrowing PHP 10000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her bakery business.

Marylen has been sustaining her business activities through her past 4 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, sugar, yeast, etc. for her business

loans.name: Jenita

texts.en:
Jenita is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as being God-fearing. 

Jenita operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a secure place. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport. 

Jenita will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stocks of clothes. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. She will use the anticipated profits to open other businesses.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of clothes.

loans.name: Merlin Elizabeth

texts.es:
Merlin de 25 años de edad, esta acompaña y tienen un hijo de 6 años de edad. Estudio hasta 9° grado de educación básica, su pareja es agricultor.

Merlin  es comerciante pequeño, tiene una tienda en la que vende chocobananos y charamuscas, que le da cierta cantidad de ingresos. El préstamo lo necesita para comprar queso, pues quiere empezar a ofrecer otro tipo de producto para tener más clientes y mejorar su economía familiar.

Merlin sueña con tener un negocio más estable que ofrezca diversidad de productos para tener acceso a otro tipo de clientes, que le dé mejores ingresos y estabilidad familiar.
texts.en:
Merlin is 25 years old, lives with someone and has a 6-year-old son. She studied up to 9th grade of basic education. Her boyfriend is a farmer. 

Merlin is a small businesswoman. She has a store where she sells chocolate-covered bananas and frozen treats called "charamuscas" that bring in a certain amount of income. She needs the loan to buy cheese, because she wants to start offering another type of product, so she can get more customers and improve her family's finances. 

Merlin dreams of having a more stable business with a range of products in order to access another type of clientele, that would afford her better income and family stability.

loans.use: To buy and sell cheese.

loans.name: Veronicah

texts.en:
The person in the photo, Veronicah, is 50 years old, married, and blessed with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in June 2013.

Veronicah operates an agrovet, selling animal mineral nutrients. Having gone through enterprise and financial management training provided by HiH EA, she is now able to efficiently manage her business. 

She is borrowing a Kiva loan to purchase more stocks of animal mineral nutrients to enable her to meet customers' rising demands. She hopes her business will flourish, hence creating increased income which will enable her to support her children's education and other family basic needs.

Veronicah is appreciative of Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and she promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of animal mineral nutrients.

loans.name: Kitoben Women Group

texts.en:
The lady raising her hand in the photo is Joan, a member of Kitoben Women Group. She is twenty-nine years old, married and a mother of six children.

Joan operates a retail shop where she sells flour, cooking fat, sugar, cleaning detergents and snacks. She describes her biggest business challenge to be lack of enough funds.

Joan will use the loan to buy more retail shop products. Her business goal is to open another shop within three years, which will enable her support her family.

Joan is happy for Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy more stock of snacks, cleaning detergent, sugar, cooking fat and flour

loans.name: Kitoben Women Group

texts.en:
The person raising her hand in the photo is Elizabeth, a member of Kitoben Women Group. She is married and has six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She grows vegetables such as onions, tomatoes, and peas. She is borrowing money to buy hybrid planting seeds, which she hopes will improve her crop yield. More supply to the market will ensure she maintains a stable and consistent level of income. This will ensure she continues to support her family needs such as food and shelter. 

Elizabeth is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy planting seeds.

loans.name: Leo

texts.en: Leo is 35 years old, married, and resides in Jimenez with his family. He peddles fresh fish in the local community to make a living. For over seven years, it has sustained his family and provided for his children's education costs. He had successfully repaid his previous loan, which he used to buy fish to sell. He is now taking a new loan to make some repairs, to buy motor accessories, and to pay for expenses like renewal of motor registration and licenses. He is hopeful to earn more income and to be able to operate his business safely.

loans.use: to make repairs, to buy motor accessories, and to pay for expenses like renewal of motor registration and licenses.

loans.name: María Berta

texts.es:
María es una señora muy trabajadora de 68 años de edad, es ama de casa, no estudió porque sus padres no vieron la necesidad de darle estudio y también porque no tenían los recursos económicos para apoyarle en los gastos del estudio, entonces decidieron mejor enseñarle a trabajar para que les apoyara en los gastos de la casa. 

Ella estuvo acompañada en un tiempo, pero ahora es madre soltera de 1 hijo de 40 años de edad, el cual ya tiene su esposa y sus 3 hijos por lo tanto ya no depende de ella.

 María se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y a la crianza de cerdos de engorde desde hace años, trabajo que lo aprendió de sus padres y por la necesidad de los recursos económicos que estaban pasando, además cuida los nietos ya que su nuera trabaja todos los días, María no necesita trasladarse porque el negocio lo tiene en su casa.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar mas cerdos de engorde donde tendrá en un tiempo mas ganancias para tener un mejor ingreso y así mejorara su calidad de vida. El sueño de María es comprar un vehículo para que su hijo se traslade y ya no ande en bus.
texts.en:
Maria is a 68 year-old woman who is very hardworking.  She is a housewife who did not get an education because her parents didn't see the need to provide her with one, and also because they did not have the financial resources to pay for her studies.  They decided instead to teach her to work so that she could contribute to the household finances.

Maria was married for a time, but now she is a single mother with a 40 year-old son.  Her son is married and has 3 children; he is no longer dependent. Maria does the housework and has also been raising pigs for years.  Her parents taught her how to do this work so that she could meet the need for financial resources in the household.  In addition, she cares for her grandchildren, as her daughter-in-law works every day.  Maria does not need to travel to get to work, because her business is located at her house.

Maria is requesting a loan to buy more pigs to fatten so that in time she will have more earnings and income.  This way, she can improve her quality of life.  Maria's dream is to buy a vehicle so that her son can get around without taking the bus.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten

loans.name: Sugutek Women Group

texts.en:
Mercy, who is raising her hand in the photo, is a member of Sugutek Women Group. She is married, 31 years old, and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from training on enterprise development and financial management. This has helped her improve her knowledge in business management.

Her economic activity is vegetable farming. She wants to start potato farming. This is why she has applied for a loan to buy manure and planting seeds. She hopes by starting this new enterprise she will increase her level of income in order to continue supporting her family.

Mercy is very grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support.

loans.use: To buy manure and planting seeds.

loans.name: Karla Marisela

texts.es:
Karla tiene 28 años de edad, está casada y se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tiene un hijo de 6 años de edad. Ella  estudio hasta tercer año de bachillerato, su pareja trabaja en albañilería y solo ellos tres viven en la casa

Karla no trabaja, es ama de casa utilizara el préstamo para comprar tejas, madera, clavos y demas para cambiar el techo de su casa, sueña con hacer su casa de ladrillo para que sea segura y su familia viva bien, también darle una buena educación al hijo que tiene y los demás que lleguen.
texts.en:
Karla is 28 years old, married to a construction worker, and is the mother of a six-year-old son. Karla attended high school for three years and now manages the home where she, her husband, and son live. 

Karla doesn't work outside the home, and is will use this loan for the purchase of tiles, wood, nails, and other building supplies she'll need to replace the roof on her house. She hopes to remodel her home with bricks so that the family will be safe and more comfortable. She also hopes to ensure that he son, and the other children she may have some day, receive a solid education.

loans.use: to purchase tiles, wood, nails, and other building supplies.

loans.name: Arlin

texts.en:
Arlin is a married woman with six children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Arlin is 42 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Arlin has a business selling frozen foods in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers.

Arlin has been in this business for eight years. In the future, Arlin would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more packs of frozen foods to sell to her customers
